[{'created': '2019-03-01 21:21:34.000000000', 'message': "Check that the networks are defined on update

Check defined networks in the resource registry of the stack against the
networks defined in the environment files. If the environment provided
doesn't have the networks defined, it's likely they were improperly
dropped which can lead to deployment issues. This is a light check that
only checks for the existance of the networks but not the contents of

	tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py

(cherry picked from commit 1a71c441fa8958896d7f380636075612c67bf7da)
"}]
commit_message:
Check that the networks are defined on update

Check defined networks in the resource registry of the stack against the
networks defined in the environment files. If the environment provided
doesn't have the networks defined, it's likely they were improperly
dropped which can lead to deployment issues. This is a light check that
only checks for the existance of the networks but not the contents of
those networks. This handles the case where a user forgets to include
the network-isolation configuration on a subsequent update to the cloud.
This does not prevent a user from changing the contents of the networks
to something that breaks their deployment.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py

Partial-Bug: #1817631
Change-Id: Ia97a2367770e37bf8c55f2fd04c9a9efde914a67
(cherry picked from commit 1a71c441fa8958896d7f380636075612c67bf7da)

commit_message:
Remove the dependency on SSH for monitors

To detect if we can copy keyrings off a monitor, we do not need to
introduce a hard dependency on SSH contact, we only need to ensure
that the ansible has a working execution path to the monitor over
what ever connection plugin is used.

Change-Id: Idb9a178ca2165920804eee12a54419722aa64f51
(cherry picked from commit f8187bda2cb7bdc306e09f369ecbed15fba1e041)

commit_message:
Remove truncate from rootwrap filters

Use oslo.privsep for the truncate command.

Change-Id: Ic287c64a4e0f663738e23d22e819b6ffee9c84c1
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>

subject: [k8s] Update cluster health status by native API

commit_message:
[k8s] Update cluster health status by native API

Calling Kubernetes native API to update the cluster health status
so that it can used for cluster auto healing.

Task: 24593
Story: 2002742

Change-Id: Ia76eeeb2f1734dff38d9660c804d7d2d0f65b9fb
(cherry picked from commit c38edc69297cc077411c89df5de31d9b84a125ee)

commit_message:
Make Grafana and Prometheus cluster accessible only

Currently, Magnum can support master LB without floating IP. So
it would be to drop the nodeport for Prometheus and Grafana so
that user can access them with cluster IP and kubectl proxy.

Task: 22587
Story: 2002737

Change-Id: I9396bbbe98ff5bc17b34c68228f5ec7111f65fc0

commit_message:
Remove Docker when upgrading to Podman

When upgrading to Podman, we'll purge Docker resources with the prune
command. Then we'll stop Docker and remove the package.
Then remove /var/lib/docker.
It'll happen in post_upgrade_tasks.

blueprint podman-support
Change-Id: Idac992510a29e89ffa9d252e3c8f9fa89175b18a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-27 16:16:34.000000000', 'message': 'fix unit tests

With the introduction of [1] into neutron, the revision number of a
created router is now 1 and not 0. The dragonflow code is expecting 0
today and thus 3 unit tests fail due to this.

This patch updates to the tests to expect the revision number to be 1
rather than 0 as per [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635671/

Change-Id: I8d16fada6972854719d9023dd79915820a73ff3b
'}]
commit_message:
fix unit tests

With the introduction of [1] into neutron, the revision number of a
created router is now 1 and not 0. The dragonflow code is expecting 0
today and thus 3 unit tests fail due to this.

This patch updates to the tests to expect the revision number to be 1
rather than 0 as per [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635671/

Change-Id: I8d16fada6972854719d9023dd79915820a73ff3b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 17:44:59.000000000', 'message': 'fix up numa-topology live migration hypervisor check

It turns out that even when KVM is supported by qemu the libvirt
driver will report the hypervisor type as "QEMU".  So we need to
fix up the hypervisor type check in the live migration code that
checks whether the instance has a NUMA topology.

Closes-Bug: #1818092
Change-Id: I5127227a1e3d76dd413a820b048547ba578aff6b
Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4da058723332a58323640fabce3d95902946a07d)
'}]
commit_message:
fix up numa-topology live migration hypervisor check

It turns out that even when KVM is supported by qemu the libvirt
driver will report the hypervisor type as "QEMU".  So we need to
fix up the hypervisor type check in the live migration code that
checks whether the instance has a NUMA topology.

Closes-Bug: #1818092
Change-Id: I5127227a1e3d76dd413a820b048547ba578aff6b
Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4da058723332a58323640fabce3d95902946a07d)

[{'created': '2019-02-22 12:06:57.000000000', 'message': 'DVR edge router: avoid accidental centralized floating IP remove

Need to pass centralized floating IPs as preserve_ips to
_external_gateway_added during DVR router update.
Otherwise IP addresses will be deleted from gw device in certain case.
The case is when a router with active centralized floating IPs is
being scheduled to a new dvr_snat L3 agent (rescheduled from a down one).
Please see corresponding traces in the bug description.

Change-Id: Iaeb9fbed73144df6fcd9092c665ed19986e85f4d
Closes-bug: #1817306

commit_message:
DVR edge router: avoid accidental centralized floating IP remove

Need to pass centralized floating IPs as preserve_ips to
_external_gateway_added during DVR router update.
Otherwise IP addresses will be deleted from gw device in certain case.
The case is when a router with active centralized floating IPs is
being scheduled to a new dvr_snat L3 agent (rescheduled from a down one).
Please see corresponding traces in the bug description.

Change-Id: Iaeb9fbed73144df6fcd9092c665ed19986e85f4d
Closes-bug: #1817306

[{'created': '2018-07-06 14:28:50.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Placement reporting service plugin

Since this code functionally depends on ML2 we can also consider making
it part of ML2, but at the moment it is a service plugin for better
decoupling.

Example config for neutron-server:

neutron.conf:
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins = neutron.services.placement_report.plugin.\
                  PlacementReportPlugin

TODO tests

'}, {'created': '2018-07-27 14:59:36.000000000', 'message': "WIP Placement reporting service plugin

Since this code functionally depends on ML2 we can also consider making
it part of ML2, but at the moment it is a service plugin for better
decoupling. Even if you load the service plugin the logic gracefully
degrades for heartbeat messages not containing resource provider info.

If needed the sync can be forced in multiple ways. First, if you restart
an agent then the RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. You may
also delete the agent by 'openstack network agent delete' and let the
next heartbeat message re-create the agent object. On re-creation the
RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. On the other hand a
neutron-server restart does not trigger a re-sync in any way. Depending
on the trade-off between the admin's needs to force re-syncs and the
performance of (not absolutely necessary) Placement updates re-sync
conditions may be further fine tuned.

Example config for neutron-server:

neutron.conf:
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins = neutron.services.placement_report.plugin.\
                  PlacementReportPlugin

TODO break up this change to multiple files and changes
TODO more tests

Change-Id: Ia1ff6f7559ab77913ddb9c3b134420a401b8eb43
Co-Authored-By: Lajos Katona <lajos.katona@ericsson.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/577220
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

Since this code functionally depends on ML2 we can also consider making
it part of ML2, but at the moment it is a service plugin for better
decoupling. Even if you load the service plugin the logic gracefully
degrades for heartbeat messages not containing resource provider info.

If needed the sync can be forced in multiple ways. First, if you restart
an agent then the RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. You may
also delete the agent by 'openstack network agent delete' and let the
next heartbeat message re-create the agent object. On re-creation the
RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. On the other hand a
neutron-server restart does not trigger a re-sync in any way. Depending
on the trade-off between the admin's needs to force re-syncs and the
performance of (not absolutely necessary) Placement updates re-sync
conditions may be further fine tuned.

Example config for neutron-server:

neutron.conf:
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins = neutron.services.placement_report.plugin.\
                  PlacementReportPlugin

TODO break up this change to multiple files and changes
TODO more tests

Change-Id: Ia1ff6f7559ab77913ddb9c3b134420a401b8eb43
Co-Authored-By: Lajos Katona <lajos.katona@ericsson.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/586567
Partial-Bug: #1578989

See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

"}, {'created': '2019-01-23 16:11:18.000000000', 'message': "Placement reporting service plugin

This service plugin synchronizes ML2 mechanism driver agents' resource
information to Placement. To use this service an agent must add
'resource_provider_bandwidths' to the 'configurations' field of its
RPC heartbeat. It also may add 'resource_provider_inventory_defaults'
to fine tune Placement inventory parameters. Again to use this service a
mechanism driver must implement get_standrd_device_mappings() and allocate
a UUID as mechanism driver property 'resource_provider_uuid5_namespace'.

The synchronization is triggered by:
* any new agent object in the DB
* restart of an agent (via 'start_flag' in the RPC heartbeat)
* if an agent's 'resources_synced' attribute is not True (None/False)

The latter should autoheal transient errors of the synchronization
process. That is if a sync attemp fails then we store
resources_synced=False which triggers a sync retry at each new heartbeat
message until a sync attempt finally succeeds and we can set
resources_synced=True.

Since this code functionally depends on ML2 we can also consider making
it part of ML2, but at the moment it is a service plugin for better
decoupling. Even if you load the service plugin the logic gracefully
degrades for heartbeat messages not containing resource provider info.

If needed the sync can be forced in multiple ways. First, if you restart
an agent then the RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. You may
also delete the agent by 'openstack network agent delete' and let the
next heartbeat message re-create the agent object. On re-creation the
RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. On the other hand a
neutron-server restart does not trigger a re-sync in any way. Depending
on the trade-off between the admin's needs to force re-syncs and the
performance of (not absolutely necessary) Placement updates re-sync
conditions may be further fine tuned.

Example config for neutron-server:

neutron.conf:
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins = placement

Change-Id: Ia1ff6f7559ab77913ddb9c3b134420a401b8eb43
Co-Authored-By: Lajos Katona <lajos.katona@ericsson.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/586567
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

"}, {'created': '2019-02-28 15:03:22.000000000', 'message': "Placement reporting service plugin

This service plugin synchronizes ML2 mechanism driver agents' resource
information to Placement. To use this service an agent must add
'resource_provider_bandwidths' to the 'configurations' field of its
RPC heartbeat. It also may add 'resource_provider_inventory_defaults'
to fine tune Placement inventory parameters. Again to use this service a
mechanism driver must implement get_standrd_device_mappings() and allocate
a UUID as mechanism driver property 'resource_provider_uuid5_namespace'.

The synchronization is triggered by:
* any new agent object in the DB
* restart of an agent (via 'start_flag' in the RPC heartbeat)
* if an agent's 'resources_synced' attribute is not True (None/False)

The latter should autoheal transient errors of the synchronization
process. That is if a sync attemp fails then we store
resources_synced=False which triggers a sync retry at each new heartbeat
message until a sync attempt finally succeeds and we can set
resources_synced=True.

Since this code functionally depends on ML2 we can also consider making
it part of ML2, but at the moment it is a service plugin for better
decoupling. Even if you load the service plugin the logic gracefully
degrades for heartbeat messages not containing resource provider info.

If needed the sync can be forced in multiple ways. First, if you restart
an agent then the RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. You may
also delete the agent by 'openstack network agent delete' and let the
next heartbeat message re-create the agent object. On re-creation the
RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. On the other hand a
neutron-server restart does not trigger a re-sync in any way. Depending
on the trade-off between the admin's needs to force re-syncs and the
performance of (not absolutely necessary) Placement updates re-sync
conditions may be further fine tuned.

Example config for neutron-server:

neutron.conf:
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins = placement

Change-Id: Ia1ff6f7559ab77913ddb9c3b134420a401b8eb43
Co-Authored-By: Lajos Katona <lajos.katona@ericsson.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/586567
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
Placement reporting service plugin

This service plugin synchronizes ML2 mechanism driver agents' resource
information to Placement. To use this service an agent must add
'resource_provider_bandwidths' to the 'configurations' field of its
RPC heartbeat. It also may add 'resource_provider_inventory_defaults'
to fine tune Placement inventory parameters. Again to use this service a
mechanism driver must implement get_standrd_device_mappings() and allocate
a UUID as mechanism driver property 'resource_provider_uuid5_namespace'.

The synchronization is triggered by:
* any new agent object in the DB
* restart of an agent (via 'start_flag' in the RPC heartbeat)
* if an agent's 'resources_synced' attribute is not True (None/False)

The latter should autoheal transient errors of the synchronization
process. That is if a sync attemp fails then we store
resources_synced=False which triggers a sync retry at each new heartbeat
message until a sync attempt finally succeeds and we can set
resources_synced=True.

Since this code functionally depends on ML2 we can also consider making
it part of ML2, but at the moment it is a service plugin for better
decoupling. Even if you load the service plugin the logic gracefully
degrades for heartbeat messages not containing resource provider info.

If needed the sync can be forced in multiple ways. First, if you restart
an agent then the RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. You may
also delete the agent by 'openstack network agent delete' and let the
next heartbeat message re-create the agent object. On re-creation the
RPs belonging to that agent will be re-synced. On the other hand a
neutron-server restart does not trigger a re-sync in any way. Depending
on the trade-off between the admin's needs to force re-syncs and the
performance of (not absolutely necessary) Placement updates re-sync
conditions may be further fine tuned.

Example config for neutron-server:

neutron.conf:
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins = placement

Change-Id: Ia1ff6f7559ab77913ddb9c3b134420a401b8eb43
Co-Authored-By: Lajos Katona <lajos.katona@ericsson.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/586567
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
Remove TypeError handling for get_info

This was only put in to handle out of tree drivers in backports to
stable branches; kill it in master.

Change-Id: I73d90d11577fb5a2ef5363c8168970f7bbeda6ec

commit_message:
ironic: check fresh data when sync_power_state doesn't line up

We return cached data to sync_power_state to avoid pummeling the ironic
API. However, this can lead to a race condition where an instance is
powered on, but nova thinks it should be off and calls stop(). Check
again without the cache when this happens to make sure we don't
unnecessarily kill an instance.

Closes-Bug: #1815791
Change-Id: I907b69eb689cf6c169a4869cfc7889308ca419d5

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 13:45:22.000000000', 'message': 'Restart all L3 agents in test that check no packet loss in HA routers

In fullstack test
test_l3_agent.test_ha_router_restart_agents_no_packet_lost
restarts of L3 agents where done in 2 steps:
1. restart of all standby agents,
2. restart of all active agents.

It was done like that because of bug [1] and [2].
Now when those bugs are fixed, lets change this test to
some "more probable" scenario. So agents will be restarted
without checking which one is master and which is standby.
However agents will be restarted one by one instead of doing
restarts in (almost) exactly same time.

Restarting all agents in same time caused still some issue
on my local testing environment but I suspect that it might be
some problem related to the nature of fullstack tests and to the
fact that 2 different "nodes" are in fact simulated by namespaces only.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1776459
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1798475

Change-Id: I731211b56a57d44636e741009721522f67c12368
'}]
commit_message:
Restart all L3 agents in test that check no packet loss in HA routers

In fullstack test
test_l3_agent.test_ha_router_restart_agents_no_packet_lost
restarts of L3 agents where done in 2 steps:
1. restart of all standby agents,
2. restart of all active agents.

It was done like that because of bug [1] and [2].
Now when those bugs are fixed, lets change this test to
some "more probable" scenario. So agents will be restarted
without checking which one is master and which is standby.
However agents will be restarted one by one instead of doing
restarts in (almost) exactly same time.

Restarting all agents in same time caused still some issue
on my local testing environment but I suspect that it might be
some problem related to the nature of fullstack tests and to the
fact that 2 different "nodes" are in fact simulated by namespaces only.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1776459
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1798475

Change-Id: I731211b56a57d44636e741009721522f67c12368

commit_message:
Add oslo.privsep to config-generator list

We recently exposed the privsep opts for config generator use, so
projects that depend on oslo.privsep should include them in their
sample configs.

Change-Id: I7fab7002d51b2aaf1b0a6545d07b616120e26461

commit_message:
Trim test list for lio-barbican job

We're running a fair number of scenario tests
that we don't need to be here.  Just grab the
ones that are interesting for Cinder.

Change-Id: If17a249bc99d3e16bd57cdf7ce73e1ce3a739455

commit_message:
Replace hiera lookup for ceph::profile::params::fsid

We do not deploy Ceph via puppet-ceph so we need to pass to
cinder-volume the RBD secret UUID explicitly

Implements: blueprint remove-puppet-ceph
Change-Id: I8b22917e7436084028ef4fbe7604d28d6a68bee0

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-27 19:15:28.000000000', 'message': 'Add oslo.privsep to config-generator list

We recently exposed the privsep opts for config generator use, so
projects that depend on oslo.privsep should include them in their
sample configs.

Change-Id: I59702c8b84bbcf21d32150ede0a3758d1a456bd6
'}]
commit_message:
Add oslo.privsep to config-generator list

We recently exposed the privsep opts for config generator use, so
projects that depend on oslo.privsep should include them in their
sample configs.

Change-Id: I59702c8b84bbcf21d32150ede0a3758d1a456bd6

commit_message:
Fix for auth version change in Brcd HTTP

On FOS 8.1.0b and greater firmwares, the authentication
for HTTP sessions has changed.  Add check to get
the auth version, then authenticate with identifier
rather than randomno when authversion is not 1.

Also, the formatting of nsinfo.htm has changed,
so now using the formatted nsinfo.html page
to gather nport wwns from the name server.

Change-Id: Ia2773f930513a5c8914e40805291d015a2ecb130
Closes-Bug: #1810327

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-03 05:23:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix gate issues on master

We recently removed nenutron.common.rpc [1] as the rpc module lives in
neutron-lib now. This project was missed because I didn't find
neutron.common.rpc as an import. This patch switches rpc uses over to
neutron-lib.

This also addresses an issue where toxenv fails when it encounters a
non-empty __pycache__ directory. This adjusts the options passed to
find so that it is tolerant of this scenario and allows tox runs to
proceed.

"rm -rf .tox/lower-constraints/*" in testenv command in tox.ini
is unnecessary, so it is dropped too.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634790/

Change-Id: I95490cba503d3f3a61bdc28ef63edc82a3ae1be3
(cherry picked from commit 36ca752e80d21b4490d5dfb13f16b351ff6ff34f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix gate issues on master

We recently removed nenutron.common.rpc [1] as the rpc module lives in
neutron-lib now. This project was missed because I didn't find
neutron.common.rpc as an import. This patch switches rpc uses over to
neutron-lib.

This also addresses an issue where toxenv fails when it encounters a
non-empty __pycache__ directory. This adjusts the options passed to
find so that it is tolerant of this scenario and allows tox runs to
proceed.

"rm -rf .tox/lower-constraints/*" in testenv command in tox.ini
is unnecessary, so it is dropped too.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634790/

Change-Id: I95490cba503d3f3a61bdc28ef63edc82a3ae1be3
(cherry picked from commit 36ca752e80d21b4490d5dfb13f16b351ff6ff34f)

commit_message:
Add support for binding activate and deactivate

Add support for binding activate and deactivate callbacks
in SR-IOV mechanism driver agent.

this work item is required for supporting VM live-migration
with SR-IOV in nova with libvirt as hypervisor.

This commits implemets the following:
- Implement binding_activate() and binding_deactivate() methods in agent.
- Configure agent to listen on the relevant topics.
- RPC version bump on agend side.
- When processing an activated binding treat it as a newly added port.
- Deactivated binding will trigger a NO-OP as once a binding is
  deactivated it will be removed by Hypervisor.

Closes-Bug: #1815361

Change-Id: I6b7195e08ed8932cfc2785b66627de2854ead85d

commit_message:
Add "links" in the response of "nova show" for a down-cell instance

The down-cell microversion 2.69 just recently merged and it returns
links in the response for GET /servers/detail and GET /servers but not
for GET /servers/{server_id} which was an oversight because that API
returns links normally.

We should include the links key in the 'nova show' case as well and this
patch does exactly that.

Typically this would require a microversion change but given the code
merged recently and is not yet released we are just fixing this
oversight through this patch without a microversion bump.

Closes-Bug: #1818131
Change-Id: I2ce03df994f59c37b5ce3102c4e7165d17701798

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-18 19:57:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix __pycache__ deletion causing tox breakage

It looks like most if not all CI for neutron-fwaas is broken because
tox.ini includes the use of `find` to delete directories named
__pycache__.  This breaks because the directories are not empty, like
so [1]:

tox.ini includes the use of `find` to delete directories named
__pycache__ and pyc|o files. This breaks because the directories are
not empty, like so [1]:

  ubuntu-xenial |   /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas$ /usr/bin/find . -type d -name __pycache__ -delete

"}, {'created': '2019-02-19 08:39:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix gate issues on master

We recently removed nenutron.common.rpc [1] as the rpc module lives in
neutron-lib now. This project was missed because I didn't find
neutron.common.rpc as an import. This patch switches rpc uses over to
neutron-lib.

This also addresses an issue where toxenv fails when it encounters a
non-empty __pycache__ directory. This adjusts the options passed to
find so that it is tolerant of this scenario and allows tox runs to
proceed.

"rm -rf .tox/lower-constraints/*" in testenv command in tox.ini
is unnecessary, so it is dropped too.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634790/

Change-Id: I95490cba503d3f3a61bdc28ef63edc82a3ae1be3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix gate issues on master

We recently removed nenutron.common.rpc [1] as the rpc module lives in
neutron-lib now. This project was missed because I didn't find
neutron.common.rpc as an import. This patch switches rpc uses over to
neutron-lib.

This also addresses an issue where toxenv fails when it encounters a
non-empty __pycache__ directory. This adjusts the options passed to
find so that it is tolerant of this scenario and allows tox runs to
proceed.

"rm -rf .tox/lower-constraints/*" in testenv command in tox.ini
is unnecessary, so it is dropped too.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634790/

Change-Id: I95490cba503d3f3a61bdc28ef63edc82a3ae1be3

commit_message:
Tests: Fix up migrate notify tests

Search for notify calls in a way that ignores extra
notifications.

Remove mock_notify.assert_not_called()

Partial-Bug: #1803648

Change-Id: I5e0823453cbadbd7ab1dcaa3e651769629eb409e

commit_message:
Cleanup DVR SNAT port list creation code

port_list is already an empty list if no SNAT ports were found,
no reason to re-initialize or print it.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I0589266646dfa0bc42ef6b7e6929f4dc2237f2b6

commit_message:
Class to represent Placement state and sync

Represent the desired state of the Placement DB and provide a method to
sync this state to Placement. This is unused as is. A later patch in
the same series is going to use it. But it is broken out into its own
file and patch, so the code is organized better and easier to review.

Change-Id: I3728117f90b7fad2423c2a4276db214ec86c9d8e
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/570847
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/577220
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/616194
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 14:18:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix modules import order

Change fixes placement of single module import. Previous import
placement prevented configuration options from being loaded in
correct order in relation to other modules. As a result modules
using configuration on Trove service startup did not see modified
configuration and behave in unexpected way.

Change-Id: I22edfcb80ecb597826cd01f0aad448cfa169b422
'}]
commit_message:
Fix modules import order

Change fixes placement of single module import. Previous import
placement prevented configuration options from being loaded in
correct order in relation to other modules. As a result modules
using configuration on Trove service startup did not see modified
configuration and behave in unexpected way.

Change-Id: I22edfcb80ecb597826cd01f0aad448cfa169b422

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 14:40:29.000000000', 'message': 'Make resource class required

Allocation API requires a resource class, so we have to require it now.

Change-Id: Ic3729fb8aa02c82379eceb2a2555fc9c0ba9bc57
'}]
commit_message:
Make resource class required

Allocation API requires a resource class, so we have to require it now.

Change-Id: Ic3729fb8aa02c82379eceb2a2555fc9c0ba9bc57

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/348080/55 : SUCCESS in 1h 46m 14s'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-22 23:10:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 55:

> @Michael Bayer it would be a huge help if you had a minute to pull
 > down PS 55. In the mean time I'll do as you suggest and try to see
 > if I can get a handle on what exactly is running through
 > sqlalchemy.

I can confirm the general issue is that the using() in question, both of them, when used correctly are introducing a different Session than the one that's intended to be used.   The reason using(context.session) "works" is because it silently fails.   The issue is a side effect of the fact that Neutron and neutron-lib are freely intermingling two completely different means of acquiring the current transaction context.    

I need to spend much more time with this to isolate exactly where it's going wrong, however.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-22 23:43:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 56.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-22 23:46:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 56:

so it's impossible to trace out which session is which, and basically the presence of neutron_lib.context.Context.session is kind of a disaster because it generates its own session if called before enginefacade is.   With enginefacade, there *is* a context.session attribute, it's just that you need to be inside of a transaction block.      so the hack here is to make sure that block exists, but overall, taking out that accessor in neutron_lib is the long-term solution as it will immediately illustrate all parts of the code which need to be changed to ensure there is a session scope and not an implicit session generated out of nowhere."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-02-23 01:21:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 56:

Build succeeded.

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-07-27 23:26:18.000000000', 'message': 'Enable adoption of subnets into a subnet pool

This patch enables the adoption of existing subnets into a
subnetpool. Adoption of a subnet is done by passing the ID
of the hosting network and the address family (ip_version)
which causes all subnets in the specified address family
on the given network to be adopted by the subnet pool. This
continues to work within the constraints on subnet pool
membership of subnets on the same network. This also ensures
prefix uniqueness across an address scope before comitting the
adoption of subnets.

Change-Id: I5d3c07beb7f109142d2e3633e69f86ca39edc450
Implements: blueprint subnetpool-adoption

continues to work within the constraints on subnet pool
membership of subnets on the same network. This also ensures
prefix uniqueness across an address scope before comitting the
adoption of subnets.

Depends-On: Ib925028a84a86d0707ed24d5edb62bdf552db1e6
NOTE: The modification in _create_subnetpool is a temp change.
We are looking at other method to improvise the test cases.

commit_message:
Enable adoption of subnets into a subnet pool

This patch enables the adoption of existing subnets into a
subnetpool. Adoption of a subnet is done by passing the ID
of the hosting network and the address family (ip_version)
which causes all subnets in the specified address family
on the given network to be adopted by the subnet pool. This
continues to work within the constraints on subnet pool
membership of subnets on the same network. This also ensures
prefix uniqueness across an address scope before comitting the
adoption of subnets.

Change-Id: I5d3c07beb7f109142d2e3633e69f86ca39edc450
Partially-Implements: blueprint subnet-onboard
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Tidwell <rtidwell@suse.com>
Co-Authored-By: Reedip <reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>
Co-Authored-By: Trevor McCasland <TM2086@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bernard Caffarelli <bcafarel@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-02-28 22:32:29.000000000', 'message': 'Document the wonders of scale testing nova with the fake driver

Devstack has some little known variables for running nova
with the fake compute driver and running several nova-compute
services on a single host, which can be useful for testing
move operations and scale testing of controller services like
nova-api and nova-scheduler.

This adds documentation about the fake virt driver and related
variables and scaling considerations when using them.

Change-Id: Ic89d463d0f3f180b323edd6e2c8ff0404638ef07

commit_message:
Document the wonders of scale testing nova with the fake driver

Devstack has some little known variables for running nova
with the fake compute driver and running several nova-compute
services on a single host, which can be useful for testing
move operations and scale testing of controller services like
nova-api and nova-scheduler.

This adds documentation about the fake virt driver and related
variables and scaling considerations when using them.

Change-Id: Ic89d463d0f3f180b323edd6e2c8ff0404638ef07

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-14 16:53:22.000000000', 'message': "Record requester in the InstancePCIRequest

An InstancePCIRequest might represents the VF device request of a
neutron port that has bandwidth request as well. In this case nova
needs to correlate the pci request with the port's resource request to
make sure the bandwidth and the VF are allocated from the same PF.

This patch introduces the new ``requester_id`` field to the
InstancePCIRequest ovo and stores the port_id in that field if the
pci request is created from a neturon port. For completeness if the
pci request is created from a flavor then the flavor_id will be stored
there.

The value of the ``requester_id`` field will be used in a subsequent
patch.

TODO:
 * add unit test coverage

Change-Id: I73786b7900957faca72d6ddfd01023a4b186e14d
blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider

commit_message:
Record requester in the InstancePCIRequest

An InstancePCIRequest might represent the VF device request of a
neutron port that has bandwidth request as well. In this case nova
needs to correlate the pci request with the port's resource request to
make sure the bandwidth and the VF are allocated from the same PF.

This patch introduces the new ``requester_id`` field to the
InstancePCIRequest ovo and stores the port_id in that field if the
pci request is created from a neutron port.

The value of the ``requester_id`` field will be used in a subsequent
patch to match it against the existing RequestGroup.requester_id.

Change-Id: I73786b7900957faca72d6ddfd01023a4b186e14d
blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider

[{'created': '2019-02-22 11:59:38.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent re-process the ports again during restart

If ovs-agent is restarting, the added port list and
updated list will be the same. So here we just set
the current map to the processed results to prevent
re-process these ports again.

Related-Bug: #1813703

Change-Id: I1804e534beff88671920028a13c590161137d0e1
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent re-process the ports again during restart

If ovs-agent is restarting, the added port list and
updated list will be the same. So here we just set
the current map to the processed results to prevent
re-process these ports again.

Related-Bug: #1813703

Change-Id: I1804e534beff88671920028a13c590161137d0e1

commit_message:
Adds the server group info into show server detail API.

The server-groups UUID add to response of 'GET /servers/{id}',
'PUT /servers/{server_id}" and rebuild API
'POST /servers/{server_id}/action'.

Change-Id: I4a2a584df56ece7beb8b12c0ce9b0e6b30237120
Implements: blueprint show-server-group
Co-authored-by: Gerry Kopec <Gerry.Kopec@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>

commit_message:
Replace cp -l with --reflink=auto

Hardlinking in cp has special file permission requirements that can
make it fail.

Using --reflink=auto is much safer and does not have
the same requirements, while preserving its advantages.

This allows us to undo the unsecure chmod done on src dir
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625576/

Change-Id: I51e73f5880206f9ce8cdd85584d80ca7103fd965

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-31 22:39:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race in test_volume_swap_server_with_error

Change I03c8e8225e51fd80580772752c0b292987e34218 added
another notification to the list checked in
test_volume_swap_server_with_error and then change
Id587967ea4f9980c292492e2f659bf55fb037b28 relied on
checking the last notification in the list (compute.exception)
but per the note in the test, that last exception can
race to show up by the time we check the size of the
notification list which can result in an IndexError.

This change updates the note about the size of the list
and also adds a wait loop for the last notification to show
up before we check it.

Change-Id: I8165fcd98e11b9155640559a36ae90a38f63c0dd
Closes-Bug: #1814177
'}, {'created': '2019-02-11 15:42:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race in test_volume_swap_server_with_error

Change I03c8e8225e51fd80580772752c0b292987e34218 added
another notification to the list checked in
test_volume_swap_server_with_error and then change
Id587967ea4f9980c292492e2f659bf55fb037b28 relied on
checking the last notification in the list (compute.exception)
but per the note in the test, that last exception can
race to show up by the time we check the size of the
notification list which can result in an IndexError.

This change fixes the race by just waiting for the
compute.exception notification rather than the racy
_wait_until_swap_volume_error which depended on the
cinder fixture swap_error variable (which is removed
in this change).

Change-Id: I8165fcd98e11b9155640559a36ae90a38f63c0dd
Closes-Bug: #1814177
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race in test_volume_swap_server_with_error

Change I03c8e8225e51fd80580772752c0b292987e34218 added
another notification to the list checked in
test_volume_swap_server_with_error and then change
Id587967ea4f9980c292492e2f659bf55fb037b28 relied on
checking the last notification in the list (compute.exception)
but per the note in the test, that last exception can
race to show up by the time we check the size of the
notification list which can result in an IndexError.

This change fixes the race by just waiting for the
compute.exception notification rather than the racy
_wait_until_swap_volume_error which depended on the
cinder fixture swap_error variable (which is removed
in this change).

Change-Id: I8165fcd98e11b9155640559a36ae90a38f63c0dd
Closes-Bug: #1814177

commit_message:
Remove port allocation during detach

If the port has resource allocation in placement then during interface
detach nova needs to update the instance allocation in placement,
removing the resources from it that was there because of the port that
is being detached.

blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider

Change-Id: I0fb35036e77e9abe141fe8831b4c23d02e567b96

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 18:16:41.000000000', 'message': 'Change process name of neutron-server to match worker role

We spawn a lot of neutron-servers, on all but the smallest systems.
It's often hard to tell which are busy/overloaded or spinning.
Add an option to set the process names to their role. This should
likely be off by default, so we don't break any existing scripting,
but I'm leaving it on for the first pass of CI, just in case.

Note: DO NOT MERGE until the default is flipped off, unless everyone
wants it on.

Sample output:
$ ps xw | grep neutron-server
 1126 pts/2    S+     0:00 grep --color=auto neutron-server
25355 ?        Ss     0:26 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/neutron-server --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini
25368 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25369 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25370 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25371 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25372 ?        S      0:02 neutron-server: rpc worker
25373 ?        S      0:02 neutron-server: rpc worker
25374 ?        S      0:02 neutron-server: services worker

The "normal" looking ps output is the main parent.

This will require a global-requirements change. Including those changes
here temporarily, to see if the tests will run.

Change-Id: I0e664a5f8e792d85b8f5483fb8c6f1cd59a677cd

commit_message:
Change process name of neutron-server to match worker role

We spawn a lot of neutron-servers, on all but the smallest systems.
It's often hard to tell which are busy/overloaded or spinning.
Add an option to set the process names to their role.

This has a small chance of breaking existing scripting, depending
how they're parsing ps output.

Sample output:
$ ps xw | grep neutron-server
 1126 pts/2    S+     0:00 grep --color=auto neutron-server
25355 ?        Ss     0:26 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/neutron-server \
  --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf \
  --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini
25368 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25369 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25370 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25371 ?        S      0:00 neutron-server: api worker
25372 ?        S      0:02 neutron-server: rpc worker
25373 ?        S      0:02 neutron-server: rpc worker
25374 ?        S      0:02 neutron-server: services worker

The "normal" looking ps output is the main parent.

Partial-Bug: #1816485
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/637119
Change-Id: I0e664a5f8e792d85b8f5483fb8c6f1cd59a677cd

commit_message:
Amp driver support sni option to send the hostname to backend

If the Tls option of Pool is True, we default configure a sni option in
the associated members configuration, which is "sni ssl_fc_sni".

Story: 2003858
Task: 26684
Change-Id: Id61e0302dac3a5471b4fcb526b4edec50ec1a6fc

[{'created': '2019-02-26 13:57:47.000000000', 'message': "Update requests to 2.20.1 for CVE-2018-18074

Given that the OpenStack deployment projects, and many operators
make use of upper-constraints for building OpenStack from source,
it would be prudent to update the requests library to the release
which takes care of this vulnerability.

The version change only includes bug fixes in the changelog, but
notably removes official support for python 2.6. If OpenStack
still considers python 2.6 as officially supported for stable/rocky,
then we'd have to advise packagers, deployment projects and operators
 to implement alternative strategies based on the version of python
they consider supported for their implementations.

Change-Id: Ia9a9d500a5d2df92321f4201f291401787fb8914
Changelog: http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/community/updates/#release-and-version-history

Story: 2004979

commit_message:
Update requests to 2.20.1 for CVE-2018-18074

Given that the OpenStack deployment projects, and many operators
make use of upper-constraints for building OpenStack from source,
it would be prudent to update the requests library to the release
which takes care of this vulnerability.

The version change only includes bug fixes in the changelog, but
notably removes official support for python 2.6. If OpenStack
still considers python 2.6 as officially supported for stable/rocky,
then we'd have to advise packagers, deployment projects and operators
to implement alternative strategies based on the version of python
they consider supported for their implementations.

Change-Id: Ia9a9d500a5d2df92321f4201f291401787fb8914
Changelog: http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/community/updates/#release-and-version-history
CVE: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-18074
Story: 2004979

commit_message:
Add remove_resources_from_instance_allocation to report client

The subsequent patch I0fb35036e77e9abe141fe8831b4c23d02e567b96 will need
to modify the existing instance allocation by removing a set of resources.
This patch adds the necessary report client code to be able to do that.

Change-Id: I66d69327d3361825ca0b44b46744b97ea3069eb1
blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider

commit_message:
fix up numa-topology live migration hypervisor check

It turns out that even when KVM is supported by qemu the libvirt
driver will report the hypervisor type as "QEMU".  So we need to
fix up the hypervisor type check in the live migration code that
checks whether the instance has a NUMA topology.

Closes-Bug: #1818092
Change-Id: I5127227a1e3d76dd413a820b048547ba578aff6b
Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>

commit_message:
Silence syncronize on post to avoid console spam

Makes rsync quiet on console for successes but always dumps its
output to rsync-result.json file.

Improves UX by making easier to read the log and to find the real
error message while still allowing the user to dig for extra
information if needed.

Change-Id: I506ef82e9ece4bcad6a4e3e95a8bed36c005d990
Relates-To: I364e4cc7607e94e82420e108ac03520dd4e62eab

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-31 17:14:05.000000000', 'message': 'Made quickstart.sh BSD compatible

- Corrects rpm command dependency when checking for sudo.

- Applies selinux workaround only for selinux enabled systems,
  previously it was failing on such systems

- avoid failure to load ansible_ssh_env.sh when run with -n

- allow execution from non supported systems if user defines QS_DISTRO
  variable to one of the supported versions.

- includes Fedora in list of supported distros

- prints list of supported distros when it fails

Newer version succesfully executes on MacOS and FreeBSD.

Change-Id: Ib36a0f7de64d158b801d48356536569560f83acf
'}, {'created': '2019-01-08 16:01:35.000000000', 'message': 'Made quickstart.sh more portable

commit_message:
Made quickstart.sh more portable

- Corrects rpm command dependency when checking for sudo.

- Applies selinux workaround only for selinux enabled systems,
  previously it was failing on such systems.

- avoid failure to load ansible_ssh_env.sh when run with -n

- allow execution from non supported systems if user defines
  QS_SUPPORTED_DISTRO_CHECK (or supported_disto_check in ansible)
  to false.

- includes Fedora in list of supported distros

- prints list of supported distros when it fails

Newer version succesfully executes on Fedora/Debian/MacOS/FreeBSD.

Change-Id: Ib36a0f7de64d158b801d48356536569560f83acf

commit_message:
Add boolean tls_enabled option into Pool

Add "tls_enabled" option in Pool API.
This option will work on cert cases or no cert cases.

Story: 2003858
Task: 26672
Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I62e31aaa66748ba652dfd5dbfd5a8b06d9ba0dfe

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 21:56:50.000000000', 'message': 'Adjust default of ``ram-allocation-ratio`` configuration option

In modern hyper-converged architectures the upstream default of
1.5 does not really fit.

Set to 0.98 to give some headroom on the compute nodes and add
a note about the potential need to adjust this value further.

Change-Id: I64e3379686128dd7f222bdfae133a6c90e8f3ef0
Closes-Bug: #1818234
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust default of ``ram-allocation-ratio`` configuration option

In modern hyper-converged architectures the upstream default of
1.5 does not really fit.

Set to 0.98 to give some headroom on the compute nodes and add
a note about the potential need to adjust this value further.

Change-Id: I64e3379686128dd7f222bdfae133a6c90e8f3ef0
Closes-Bug: #1818234

commit_message:
Update docs landing page to follow guideline

During the rocky cycle, there was a docs-spec approved [0] with the
goal of having a recommended consistent documentation landing page
for all projects.

This updates our docs landing page to follow the structure described
in that recommendation.

[0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/docs-specs/specs/rocky/front-page-template.html

Change-Id: Ie2d2a2c06ef0ffe32a80eac85313ab57020af5ba

subject: Normalize the image pull policy.
messages:
[{'account_id': 25493, 'date': '2018-12-21 06:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2019-03-02 10:32:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

These values are not using in Kubernetes. We define and use here [1]. Lowercase value is still correct.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/common/utils.py#L248'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-21 06:22:33.000000000', 'message': 'Normalize the image pull policy.

It should be "IfNotPresent","Always" and "Never" whose first letter is
capital. While in some template files of this project, it was wrote like
"ifnotpresent" which is not supported by the latest version of
Kubernetes.

Change-Id: Ice99f328a22e874ef7cabd8636a1581fef84056b
Closes-Bug:#1809350
'}]
commit_message:
Normalize the image pull policy.

It should be "IfNotPresent","Always" and "Never" whose first letter is
capital. While in some template files of this project, it was wrote like
"ifnotpresent" which is not supported by the latest version of
Kubernetes.

Change-Id: Ice99f328a22e874ef7cabd8636a1581fef84056b
Closes-Bug:#1809350

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 11:52:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fix L3 agent scheduler tests in multinode environments

Router in test_l3_agent_scheduler module will now always be
created as HA router. This will allow to always schedule it to one
of available L3 agents without raising Conflict exception in
Neutron.
Such Conflict can be returned from neutron server if nonHA router
already scheduled to one L3 agent is tried to be added manually
to other L3 agent.

Change-Id: Ia45ac3528385dce7f25c557e682eaf1923393f94
Closes-Bug: #1817696
'}, {'created': '2019-02-27 10:25:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix L3 agent scheduler tests in multinode environments

Test will now first try to remove router from all agents on
which it was hosted and then add it to one of agents again.

Change-Id: Ia45ac3528385dce7f25c557e682eaf1923393f94
Closes-Bug: #1817696
'}]
commit_message:
Fix L3 agent scheduler tests in multinode environments

Test will now first try to remove router from all agents on
which it was hosted and then add it to one of agents again.

Change-Id: Ia45ac3528385dce7f25c557e682eaf1923393f94
Closes-Bug: #1817696

[{'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-02-28 00:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-02-28 07:07:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

it's only listed in global requirements, so that's good.  it seems like tox-siblings or something should be used if installing via url.  tentative +1 as it should be removed if not used by any openstack managed project.


this SHOULD fail (and does, causing your problem)
tox -evenv-tempest -- pip install -c /opt/stack/new/requirements/upper-constraints.txt /opt/stack/new/neutron-tempest-plugin

what most projects do is edit the constraints file before install, look at tools/tox_install.sh in neutron-lib for an example (look for edit-constraints)."}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-02-28 07:53:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Matthew,
thank you for comment.
it's devstack lib/tempest which does the failing pip install.
i'm a bit puzzled because i thought tempest plugins were supposed to be branchless."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:24:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

it was added in baa8b82c4ce14551c585ed1dcae0509eb81858c3 so we should find out why a tempest plugin is NEEDED at install or test time (test-reqs.txt or reqs.txt).'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:26:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-12 18:28:20.000000000', 'message': 'RT: improve logging in _update_usage_from_migration

While working on some code which performs a resize_claim
I was finding that the actual new_flavor usage was not being
tracked on the destination host. It was a coding mistake
because I had not set instance.new_flavor before calling
resize_claim but that is extremely tightly coupled behavior
with how prep_resize works and the bowels of the
_update_usage_from_migration code works. This change simply
improves logging in the _update_usage_from_migration method
for debugging and updates the resize_claim docstring to
indicate the coupled nature of instance.new_flavor when calling
that method.

Change-Id: Ieb539c9a0cfbac743c579a1633234537a8e3e3ee
'}]
commit_message:
RT: improve logging in _update_usage_from_migration

While working on some code which performs a resize_claim
I was finding that the actual new_flavor usage was not being
tracked on the destination host. It was a coding mistake
because I had not set instance.new_flavor before calling
resize_claim but that is extremely tightly coupled behavior
with how prep_resize works and the bowels of the
_update_usage_from_migration code works. This change simply
improves logging in the _update_usage_from_migration method
for debugging and updates the resize_claim docstring to
indicate the coupled nature of instance.new_flavor when calling
that method.

Change-Id: Ieb539c9a0cfbac743c579a1633234537a8e3e3ee

[{'created': '2019-02-14 20:24:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix _find_related_obj() RuntimeError output

When _find_related_obj() raises a RuntimeError, the output
is something like this:

RuntimeError: (u'revises_on_change relationships must have
                 load_on_pending set to True to bump parent
                 revisions on create: %s', 'networks')

Should be using a % to print the message correctly.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I90f9ef7c6de00ae388adb303c0e22a2a6c112e88
"}]
commit_message:
Fix _find_related_obj() RuntimeError output

When _find_related_obj() raises a RuntimeError, the output
is something like this:

RuntimeError: (u'revises_on_change relationships must have
                 load_on_pending set to True to bump parent
                 revisions on create: %s', 'networks')

Should be using a % to print the message correctly.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I90f9ef7c6de00ae388adb303c0e22a2a6c112e88

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 16:58:22.000000000', 'message': "Do not print router resize messages when not resizing

I noticed in the functional logs that the l3-agent is constantly
logging this message, even when just adding or removing a single
router:

  Resizing router processing queue green pool size to: 8

It's misleading as the pool is not being resized, it's still 8,
so let's only log when we're actually changing the pool size.

Change-Id: I5dc42fa4b4c1964b7d027681b61550cd82e83234
"}]
commit_message:
Do not print router resize messages when not resizing

I noticed in the functional logs that the l3-agent is constantly
logging this message, even when just adding or removing a single
router:

  Resizing router processing queue green pool size to: 8

It's misleading as the pool is not being resized, it's still 8,
so let's only log when we're actually changing the pool size.

Change-Id: I5dc42fa4b4c1964b7d027681b61550cd82e83234

commit_message:
Add py3/f28 support to tripleo-container-build-base

Enable Fedora 28 and Python3 support on tripleo-buildcontainers
playbook and on tripleo-repos role.

Centos-7 job would run upstream and its fedora-28 counterpart would
be run on RDO and be non voting

Uses: https://review.openstack.org/637212
User-Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/650
Change-Id: Ie46d0d7fa7c41427bb44bcfad5cf59af745ac627
Co-Authored-By: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-03-01 14:53:24.000000000', 'message': 'Reproducer script: run only on job started by zuul

The reproducer script is assuming a job was started by zuul. In some instances
we are still running jobs from platform different than zuul like ci.centos. In
those instances the log collection fails because the reproducer script creation
misses a lot of files
This patch includes that role only under the condition that zuul variable is

commit_message:
Reproducer script: run only on job started by zuul

The reproducer script is assuming a job was started by zuul. In some instances
we are still running jobs from platform different than zuul like ci.centos. In
those instances the log collection fails because the reproducer script creation
misses a lot of files
This patch includes that role only under the condition that zuul variable is
defined.

Change-Id: I01ec134f85943a8332832bdc6caf138d978c1c37

conf: Call out where pci.alias should be set

We could probably do with a more concrete way to specify what services
use a given configuration value, but this is a start.

commit_message:
conf: Deprecate 'disable_libvirt_livesnapshot' option

This was added to handle gate issues seen with libvirt 1.2.2. We haven't
supported that version of libvirt for some time and we don't enable this
in the gate anymore. Deprecate it and remove unnecessary references to
it from tests and the support FAQ document.

Change-Id: Ie3fa537a42d208a35467f03bd2110c2976927477

commit_message:
Pool support sni cert for backend re-encryption

Add 1 fields like Listener does, which is 'tls_container_ref', this
field is introduced into Pool for storage the pool client certificate to
the backend servers, when the traffic willing to bring a cert to the
servers and check for tls connection.

Story: 2003859
Task: 26685
Change-Id: I29b7c7116e6087c942179ed9efdead494ef277a3

[{'account_id': 14624, 'date': '2018-11-12 11:25:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-11-12 14:31:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck

Horizon and nova failures look unrelated.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-11-12 14:52:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

You should also ban the broken version so cinder can block it'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-11-12 14:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-12 15:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-11-12 15:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Would be good to get this fixed.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-11-13 13:10:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

I think the best option here would be to request requests to tag and move to that.  rolling back has caused problems in the past that I'd like to avoid.  This is what we've done in the past (unless the release would take a while)."}, {'account_id': 18742, 'date': '2018-11-14 01:43:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Requests v2.20.1 was published. https://github.com/requests/requests/releases/tag/v2.20.1

We could update the constraint accordingly.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-11-14 04:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I think the best option here would be to request requests to tag
 > and move to that.  rolling back has caused problems in the past
 > that I'd like to avoid.  This is what we've done in the past
 > (unless the release would take a while).

Actually it's what we've done sometimes but not in scenarios like this.  That satement is factually wrong.  The response to "this version of a library is broken for some way" shouldn't be "try a new untested version"  It must be restore the last known good state and evaluate how we allowed the broken version to merge.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-11-14 04:22:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-11-14 06:19:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2018-11-14 08:59:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Agree that we should roll back to last known version.
But since it works except for a specific driver, we should make the change contingent on presence cinder/manila configuration for specific driver. Hope that is possible.

Would love to know how it passed 3rd party CI testing.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-11-14 12:59:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Why were urllib and zhmclient held back (the 'why' is not in the commit message) (that's the reason for -1)

generate-constraints bot update includes the update to 2.20.1  The actual changes are VERY minor, only containing one commit with a code change.
https://github.com/requests/requests/compare/v2.20.0...v2.20.1
https://github.com/requests/requests/commit/ea9436a5d6a5934a906e91202349aabf9af75d15

I'd prefer to use the update in https://review.openstack.org/616780 since it's going to merge soon anyway (hopefully), but won't hold this one back."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-11-14 13:02:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Further, the refrenced bug then refrences this patch (PR) which was merged (and linked as the commit in my last comment).  https://github.com/requests/requests/pull/4851'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-11-15 12:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

is this still needed now that 2.20.1 is set (for the last day or so)?'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-11-22 21:35:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-11-22 23:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2018-11-27 03:38:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-28 20:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-11-29 06:27:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-11-29 16:34:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-02 04:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 982b5667622bbf0e4d5393c2a4bb4df39428d283'}]

commit_message:
Add oslo.privsep to config-generator list

We recently exposed the privsep opts for config generator use, so
projects that depend on oslo.privsep should include them in their
sample configs.

Change-Id: I01606fc921d7ca2e581ac987f6b8d331631278e2

commit_message:
Add oslo.privsep to config-generator list

We recently exposed the privsep opts for config generator use, so
projects that depend on oslo.privsep should include them in their
sample configs.

Change-Id: Ibaef2e2848855cd8ef987ec58457220911ad7c69

commit_message:
Make tempest-multinode-full job for stable branch

tempest-multinode-full should be available to run on
all stable branch not just master. All the devstack
changes are backported already.

tempest-multinode-full will use Bionic node from
stein onwards and xenial for all other stable branches.

Change-Id: I94f66028df58a69aa7c26e8a03428bf48596d25c

commit_message:
Sonobuoy: allow multiple simultaneous chart installations

Manually set Namespace for Sonobuoy's config.json.

Sonobuoy's bug forcing heptio-sonobuoy namespace [1] usage only does not
impact this Helm chart because the config.json is directly controlled
by the `values.yaml` and not Sonobuoy's CLI.

Now multiple instances of this chart may exist at once by specifying
unique namespaces at helm install time.

Modify Sonobuoy test script to install two instances of Sonobuoy Helm
chart. Also install readonly serviceaccount to verify it will work with
more than one instance simultaneously.

[1] https://github.com/heptio/sonobuoy/issues/420

Change-Id: I6d4ecfb812a4312af13abf1e265de495e27967f9

for HTTP sessions has changed.  Add check to get

Also, the formatting of nsinfo.htm has changed,

commit_message:
Fix for auth version change in Brcd HTTP

On FOS 8.1.0b and greater firmwares, the authentication
for HTTP sessions has changed.  Add check to get
the auth version, then authenticate with identifier
rather than randomno when authversion is not 1.

Also, the formatting of nsinfo.htm has changed,
so now using the formatted nsinfo.html page
to gather nport wwns from the name server.

Change-Id: Ia2773f930513a5c8914e40805291d015a2ecb130
Closes-Bug: #1810327
(cherry picked from commit 28a696ea625e4113706e030b773fcf39cb1c49a1)

commit_message:
Remove protocol policies from v3cloudsample.json

By incorporating system-scope and default roles, we've effectively
made these policies obsolete. We can simplify what we maintain and
provide a more consistent, unified view of default protocol
behavior by removing them.

Related-Bug: 1806762
Closes-Bug: 1804518
Change-Id: Ia839555d8211596213311c4246135cdae4f46ab2

commit_message:
Don't disable radvd if radvd if it wasn't initialized

In some cases on dvr ha router it may happend that
RouterInfo.radvd.disable() will be called even if
radvd DaemonMonitor wasn't initialized earlier and it is
None.
To prevent exception in such case, this patch adds check
if DaemonMonitor is not None to call disable() method on
it.

Change-Id: Ib9b5f4eeae6e4cebcb958928e6521cf1d69b049c
Closes-Bug: #1817435

commit_message:
remove publish-loci-requirements post-job

Needed as it's breaking requirements post jobs.  We cannot use
another repos secrets without being marked as a trusted repo.

Change-Id: I8806ae39db50534993d6113a623adbe22c2d15d9
Story: 2005108
(cherry picked from commit ccf26eb2f643184879cff7728827a78f7d85c481)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 16:01:30.000000000', 'message': 'fix bug with XML matcher handling missing children

In the XMLMatches matcher used by assertXmlEqual(), it did not
correctly handle the case where a child element of an element <foo>
was expected but the actual element <foo> was totally empty.  In this
scenario, an error like the following would be generated:

    nova.tests.unit.test_matchers.TestXMLMatchesOrderedExtraChildren.test_describe_difference
    -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Captured traceback:
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
        Traceback (most recent call last):
          File ".../nova/.tox/py27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/testtools/tests/matchers/helpers.py", line 32, in test_describe_difference
            mismatch = matcher.match(matchee)
          File "nova/tests/unit/matchers.py", line 431, in match
            actual.getroot(), state, None)
          File "nova/tests/unit/matchers.py", line 520, in _compare_node
            state, actual_child_idx)
          File "nova/tests/unit/matchers.py", line 520, in _compare_node
            state, actual_child_idx)
          File "nova/tests/unit/matchers.py", line 534, in _compare_node
            actual_child_idx + 1)
        UnboundLocalError: local variable 'actual_child_idx' referenced before assignment

actual_child_idx was being used when constructing the XMLExpectedChild
XMLMismatch object, in order to indicate that the missing child was
expected at that position in the list of XML siblings.  However this
was only being set as a side-effect of the loop

    for actual_child_idx in range(...):
        ....

which is brittle in general, but also specifically is guaranteed to
break when the start and end parameters supplied to range() are equal
- in this case actual_child_idx will not get set.

While fixing this reference to the uninitialized variable, it became
apparent that the XMLExpectedChild subclass of XMLMismatch was
generating a slightly misleading error which claimed that the missing
child was expected at a certain index even when the matcher was set
with allow_mixed_nodes=True in order to not require strict ordering of
siblings.

It also became apparent that the use of a context manager for tracking
the XMLMatchState was not appropriate, because the state was stored in
a single object which got mutated as the XML tree was recursed, and
this did not allow for bubbling XMLMismatch objects up the stack which
would accurately preserve the details of the mismatch.

Bearing these issues in mind, make the following changes:

  - Avoid the use of the potentially uninitialized actual_child_idx
    variable.

  - Generate a new XMLMatchState object for each layer of recursion.

  - When an XMLExpectedChild or XMLUnexpectedChild mismatch is
    encountered, bubble that all the way up to the caller.

  - Allow the idx parameter to XMLExpectedChild to be None, when
    strict ordering is not required.

  - Add test cases to cover these scenarios.

Since comparison of XML trees is a generic task, in the future most
likely it would make sense to remove this code from nova, and use
an upstream alternative such as xmldiff:

    https://xmldiff.readthedocs.io/en/stable/

Change-Id: I2dc912d4e3059ab86d414937223f766a1b893900

commit_message:
fix bug with XML matcher handling missing children

In the XMLMatches matcher used by assertXmlEqual(), it did not
correctly handle the case where a child element of an element <foo>
was expected but the actual element <foo> was totally empty.  In this
scenario, an error like the following would be generated:

    nova.tests.unit.test_matchers.TestXMLMatchesOrderedExtraChildren.test_describe_difference
    -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Captured traceback:
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
        Traceback (most recent call last):
          File ".../nova/.tox/py27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/testtools/tests/matchers/helpers.py", line 32, in test_describe_difference
            mismatch = matcher.match(matchee)
          File "nova/tests/unit/matchers.py", line 431, in match
            actual.getroot(), state, None)
          File "nova/tests/unit/matchers.py", line 520, in _compare_node
            state, actual_child_idx)
          File "nova/tests/unit/matchers.py", line 520, in _compare_node
            state, actual_child_idx)
          File "nova/tests/unit/matchers.py", line 534, in _compare_node
            actual_child_idx + 1)
        UnboundLocalError: local variable 'actual_child_idx' referenced before assignment

actual_child_idx was being used when constructing the XMLExpectedChild
XMLMismatch object, in order to indicate that the missing child was
expected at that position in the list of XML siblings.  However this
was only being set as a side-effect of the loop

    for actual_child_idx in range(...):
        ....

which is brittle in general, but also specifically is guaranteed to
break when the start and end parameters supplied to range() are equal
- in this case actual_child_idx will not get set.

While fixing this reference to the uninitialized variable, it became
apparent that the XMLExpectedChild subclass of XMLMismatch was
generating a slightly misleading error which claimed that the missing
child was expected at a certain index even when the matcher was set
with allow_mixed_nodes=True in order to not require strict ordering of
siblings.

It also became apparent that the use of a context manager for tracking
the XMLMatchState was not appropriate, because the state was stored in
a single object which got mutated as the XML tree was recursed, and
this did not allow for bubbling XMLMismatch objects up the stack which
would accurately preserve the details of the mismatch.

Bearing these issues in mind, make the following changes:

  - Avoid the use of the potentially uninitialized actual_child_idx
    variable.

  - Generate a new XMLMatchState object for each layer of recursion.

  - When an XMLExpectedChild or XMLUnexpectedChild mismatch is
    encountered, bubble that all the way up to the caller.

  - Allow the idx parameter to XMLExpectedChild to be None, when
    strict ordering is not required.

  - Add test cases to cover these scenarios.

Since comparison of XML trees is a generic task, in the future most
likely it would make sense to remove this code from nova, and use
an upstream alternative such as xmldiff:

    https://xmldiff.readthedocs.io/en/stable/

Change-Id: I2dc912d4e3059ab86d414937223f766a1b893900

subject: Fix disk-image-create command existence
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-02 02:31:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix disk-image-create command existence

disk-image-create command doesn't support --version option,
and current existence way is failed. Most cases pass through
$DIB_REPO_PATH directory which avoids this existence check.
That is the reason why this issue didn't appear until now.
This fixes it by replacing --version option with --help
option which is supported by disk-image-create command.

Change-Id: Ib50c46283d685fea497eddc8b6a8d923b21d12ed
"}]
commit_message:
Fix disk-image-create command existence

disk-image-create command doesn't support --version option,
and current existence way is failed. Most cases pass through
$DIB_REPO_PATH directory which avoids this existence check.
That is the reason why this issue didn't appear until now.
This fixes it by replacing --version option with --help
option which is supported by disk-image-create command.

Change-Id: Ib50c46283d685fea497eddc8b6a8d923b21d12ed

commit_message:
remove publish-loci-requirements post-job

Needed as it's breaking requirements post jobs.  We cannot use
another repos secrets without being marked as a trusted repo.

Change-Id: I8806ae39db50534993d6113a623adbe22c2d15d9
Story: 2005108
(cherry picked from commit ccf26eb2f643184879cff7728827a78f7d85c481)

[{'created': '2019-02-28 00:57:16.000000000', 'message': 'Stop using "nova" in API samples when creating a server

The "availability_zone" parameter for server create in the
API reference and the availabilty zone user docs both say
that users should not use the default availability zone (nova)
yet our server create API samples use "nova" which is...bad.

This change fixes the API samples and related tests to use
a fake "us-west" availability zone. For any samples that were
requesting an AZ when creating a server, those are changed from
requesting "nova" to requesting "us-west" and a new
AvailabilityZoneFixture is added to stub out the code used to
validate the requested AZ and what is shown in server detail
responses.

Some unused samples are removed from the os-availability-zone
directory and the API reference and AZ user docs are updated for
formatting and linking to other docs for reference.

Change-Id: I3161157f15f05a3ffaaf1b48e7beb6b3e59c5513
Closes-Bug: #1817963

'}]
commit_message:
Stop using "nova" in API samples when creating a server

The "availability_zone" parameter for server create in the
API reference and the availabilty zone user docs both say
that users should not use the default availability zone (nova)
yet our server create API samples use "nova" which is...bad.

This change fixes the API samples and related tests to use
a fake "us-west" availability zone. For any samples that were
requesting an AZ when creating a server, those are changed from
requesting "nova" to requesting "us-west" and a new
AvailabilityZoneFixture is added to stub out the code used to
validate the requested AZ and what is shown in server detail
responses.

Some unused samples are removed from the os-availability-zone
directory and the API reference and AZ user docs are updated for
formatting and linking to other docs for reference.

Change-Id: I3161157f15f05a3ffaaf1b48e7beb6b3e59c5513
Closes-Bug: #1817963

commit_message:
Add a check that keepalived interfaces have IPs

Since keepalived v1.2.20, keepalived will fail if it cannot find an
IP the the requested interface.

Change-Id: Ib828bbe5a5b7311cb5e4b456456e51bf511f056d

"}, {'created': '2019-02-28 16:34:10.000000000', 'message': "Make event debug log more useful

commit_message:
Make event debug log more useful

self.events isn't useful info since the given RowEvent will always
have the same self.events. More useful is the *actual* event that
was matched, so if we are listening for create/update we can see
that we matched on update, etc.

Change-Id: I28e7421238660bc0b986b42d0a88e5c6b6d9a75a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 21:08:45.000000000', 'message': 'Compact DB migrations to Ocata

This compacts all database migrations up to Ocata into one
intial schema to remove the need to apply every database
change along the way.

Change-Id: I53f45472d6c1aeafa35064cc1d80c5376ff32b9b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Compact DB migrations to Ocata

This compacts all database migrations up to Ocata into one
intial schema to remove the need to apply every database
change along the way.

Change-Id: I53f45472d6c1aeafa35064cc1d80c5376ff32b9b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: add python 3.7 unit test job
messages:
[{'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-15 18:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-10-15 18:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

There are material changes between python3.5 and 3.6/3.7 in how the code itself works. I expect we will need to maintain python3.5 testing for the forseeable future, especially if we drop py2.7 testing in the near-ish term.

-2 on these changes. Chattted with zaneb in #openstack-tc and it appeears the plan is to keep py35.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-10-15 21:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Removing -2, waiting for TC resolution(s) to land. Corey is covering the change well.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-18 18:47:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Let's wait for this to settle: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610708/"}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-02-14 13:18:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-02-15 08:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2019-02-15 19:21:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-02-18 10:52:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2019-03-01 20:30:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 18:04:59.000000000', 'message': "Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Idb2fb5bf8633c5980132e701157715690f22546f
Story: #2004073
Task: #27422
"}, {'created': '2019-02-14 13:18:58.000000000', 'message': 'add python 3.7 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Idb2fb5bf8633c5980132e701157715690f22546f
Story: #2004073
Task: #27422
'}]
commit_message:
add python 3.7 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Idb2fb5bf8633c5980132e701157715690f22546f
Story: #2004073

commit_message:
Use infra generation of ARA reports

ARA reports are generated automatically in infra when
they are in ara-report directory. Don't generate htmls in upstream
jobs to save a space.

Change-Id: I7aa81ae3b06878baeab471e340477ca8a20f8594
