revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 15:36:05.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Install extra dependencies for Swift

The list of dependencies for Swift is really small and it does not
include for example keystonemiddlewere. This is not usually a problem
because keystonemiddleware is installed by something else when deploying
a complete OpenStack instance. It is a problem though when all services
but Swift are deployed using Python 3: in that case, the library
will not be available.
Swift recently added keystonemiddlewere as "extra" dependency, so
use it.

Change-Id: Ifbbf2c561cbacf21a9f87f493e0e623f7c756e9a
'}, {'created': '2018-02-14 15:36:58.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Install extra dependencies for Swift

The list of dependencies for Swift is really small and it does not
include for example keystonemiddleware. This is not usually a problem
because keystonemiddleware is installed by something else when deploying
a complete OpenStack instance. It is a problem though when all services
but Swift are deployed using Python 3: in that case, the library
will not be available.
Swift recently added keystonemiddleware as "extra" dependency, so
use it (see https://review.openstack.org/544121).

Change-Id: Ifbbf2c561cbacf21a9f87f493e0e623f7c756e9a
'}, {'created': '2018-03-02 11:54:45.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Install some more dependencies for Swift (python 2)

The list of dependencies for Swift is really small and it does not
include for example keystonemiddleware and ceilometermiddleware.
This is not usually a problem in a full-Python 2 deployment, but
it is when Swift is the only service where Python 3 is not enabled.

Add some workarounds to make sure that the missing libraries are
installed also in this case.

commit_message:
WIP Install some more dependencies for Swift (python 2)

The list of dependencies for Swift is really small and it does not
include for example keystonemiddleware and ceilometermiddleware.
This is not usually a problem in a full-Python 2 deployment, but
it is when Swift is the only service where Python 3 is not enabled.

Add some workarounds to make sure that the missing libraries are
installed also in this case.

Change-Id: Ifbbf2c561cbacf21a9f87f493e0e623f7c756e9a

Add role assignment test coverage for system admin

This commit adds role assignment test coverage for users who have the
admin role assigned on the system.

Subsequent patches will:

  - add functionality for domain readers
  - add functionality for domain members
  - add functionality for domain admins
  - add functionality for project readers
  - add functionality for project members

  - remove the obsolete policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-21 01:08:30.000000000', 'message': 'Reorganize role assignment tests for system users

The GET /v3/role_assignments API is a read-only API, making the
behavior for all system users the same. They should all be able to
list and filter role assignments for the entire deployment.

This commit moves the existing system reader tests into a common class
that can be reused by other test classes for system members and system
administrators.

Subsequent patches will:

  - add test coverage for system members
  - add test coverage for system admins
  - add functionality for domain readers
  - add functionality for domain members
  - add functionality for domain admins
  - add functionality for project readers
  - add functionality for project members
  - add functionality for project admins
  - remove the obsolete policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

Change-Id: Ic9b1ad3306bb272d3e24a00009014df16b36a65d

commit_message:
Reorganize role assignment tests for system users

The GET /v3/role_assignments API is a read-only API, making the
behavior for all system users the same. They should all be able to
list and filter role assignments for the entire deployment.

This commit moves the existing system reader tests into a common class
that can be reused by other test classes for system members and system
administrators.

Subsequent patches will:

  - add test coverage for system members
  - add test coverage for system admins
  - add functionality for domain readers
  - add functionality for domain members
  - add functionality for domain admins
  - add functionality for project readers
  - add functionality for project members
  - add functionality for project admins
  - remove the obsolete policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

Change-Id: Ic9b1ad3306bb272d3e24a00009014df16b36a65d
Partial-Bug: 1750673
Partial-Bug: 1816833

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 20:11:40.000000000', 'message': '[queens] Pin puppet-ceph to stable/luminous

Pin puppet-ceph to stable/luminous. This fixes puppet-openstack-unit
test errors introduced when keystone v2.0 was deprecated from
puppet-ceph [1] (certain rgw_keystone_admin_XXX parameters no longer
have default values).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/638922

Closes-Bug: 1818287
Change-Id: I40f2d22fc79397dac92bc4e9ebc69e9ddeb41895
'}]
commit_message:
[queens] Pin puppet-ceph to stable/luminous

Pin puppet-ceph to stable/luminous. This fixes puppet-openstack-unit
test errors introduced when keystone v2.0 was deprecated from
puppet-ceph [1] (certain rgw_keystone_admin_XXX parameters no longer
have default values).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/638922

Closes-Bug: 1818287
Change-Id: I40f2d22fc79397dac92bc4e9ebc69e9ddeb41895

commit_message:
Implement system reader for role_assignments

This change adds tests cases for the default roles
keystone supports at install time. It also modifies
the policies for the role_assignments API to be more
self-service by properly checking for various scopes.

Subsequent patches will:

  - add test coverage for system members
  - add test coverage for system admins
  - add functionality for domain readers
  - add functionality for domain members
  - add functionality for domain admins
  - add functionality for project readers
  - add functionality for project members
  - add functionality for project admins
  - remove the obsolete policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

Co-Authored-By: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I671eec8544f7361c895c19e6785d38993707854e
Partial-Bug: 1750673
Partial-Bug: 1816833

commit_message:
Drop py35 jobs

Python 3.5 was the target runtime for the Rocky release.
The current target py3 runtime for Stein is Python 3.6,
so there is no reason to keep testing against the older version. Also
correct setup.cfg and tox.ini to reflect the current supported Python
versions.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: I9d1b57b981269fea3afe39cf524350f3c4a7d944

commit_message:
Remove heat_api_cloudfront from haproxy services

Cloudwatch was disabled in queens as of 17.0.0.0rc1. These two
lines will allow for cleaning out the service in haproxy

Depends-On: I1db5932c559b5e04d330c114164869dd43c1cbb2
Change-Id: Ifab4e9ea7022ff2db4a5f09348287022f317c025

commit_message:
Drop py35 jobs

Python 3.5 was the target runtime for the Rocky release. The current
target py3 runtime for Stein is Python 3.6, so there is no reason to
keep testing against the older version.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: If810570859e4c4a942f44097717170d5a0affbd0
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-12 18:28:20.000000000', 'message': 'Make Claim._claim_test handle SchedulerLimits object

The _claim_test() code expects a dict but we should be able
to pass is a SchedulerLimits object which is what we get
back from the scheduler service and should be able to pass
through to the compute.

Change-Id: Ibf9c016c9d5f39ae207cf638f9d42b66ead996fc
'}]
commit_message:
Make Claim._claim_test handle SchedulerLimits object

The _claim_test() code expects a dict but we should be able
to pass is a SchedulerLimits object which is what we get
back from the scheduler service and should be able to pass
through to the compute.

Change-Id: Ibf9c016c9d5f39ae207cf638f9d42b66ead996fc

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-27 18:46:42.000000000', 'message': 'Set ceph_rgws default to empty list

tempest_service_available_swift value depends on ceph_rgws value
Since os_tempest is used outside OSA and deployments does not have
ceph_rgws configured which leads to ceph_rgws as undefined var.
So setting the default to empty list will return false and fixes
the issue.

Change-Id: I077fceb7f8e9bee46ef71595a43d7687b8f98508
'}, {'created': '2019-02-27 18:53:49.000000000', 'message': 'Set ceph_rgws only when it is defined

tempest_service_available_swift value depends on ceph_rgws value
Since os_tempest is used outside OSA and deployments does not have
ceph_rgws configured which leads to ceph_rgws as undefined var.
So setting it defined and then set the value fixes
the issue.

Change-Id: I077fceb7f8e9bee46ef71595a43d7687b8f98508
'}, {'created': '2019-03-01 08:07:16.000000000', 'message': 'Handle ceph_rgws variable being undefined

The tempest_service_available_swift variable depends on ceph_rgws being
defined which is always the case when os_tempest is used in OSA. This
patch allows os_tempest to run correctly when ceph_rgws is undefined, as
would bethe case outside OSA.

Change-Id: I077fceb7f8e9bee46ef71595a43d7687b8f98508
'}]
commit_message:
Handle ceph_rgws variable being undefined

The tempest_service_available_swift variable depends on ceph_rgws being
defined which is always the case when os_tempest is used in OSA. This
patch allows os_tempest to run correctly when ceph_rgws is undefined, as
would bethe case outside OSA.

Change-Id: I077fceb7f8e9bee46ef71595a43d7687b8f98508

commit_message:
Remove endpoint policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

By incorporating system-scope and default roles, we've effectively
made these policies obsolete. We can simplify what we maintain and
provide a more consistent, unified view of default endpoint behavior
by removing them.

Change-Id: I423e54c359b787efdda70f5d141f21e9103f3524
Closes-Bug: 1804482

commit_message:
add python 3.7 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

commit_message:
Update section 'When do i need a new Microversion?'

It is been agreed upon that if a new feature is proposed
sharing similarities (in terms of intention and code)
with a previously merged feature then both the features
can be clubbed together within the same (previous feature)
microversion given that the previously merged feature isn't
released.

Change-Id: I80216f9c2645ece1ea4c57550936a247440a5a82

commit_message:
rally-jobs: Add FloatingIP workloads: assoc/dissoc

As discussed on the neutron-performance meeting [1] floating IP operations
should be covered in the neutron gate rally job. As I set out to write
the missing tests I discovered that some of them were already written
by rally folks. For example see [2]. Keep in mind the test code has been
relocated since to the rally-openstack repository. For example see [3].
They were later added to neutron's rally job definition [4].

Here we add a one more scenario to exercise the floating IP operations
left uncovered by the above changes: associate and dissociate.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_performance/2018/neutron_performance.2018-10-22-16.02.log.html#l-143
[2] https://review.openstack.org/225223
[3] https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/4e4bfc5/rally_openstack/scenarios/neutron/network.py
[4] https://review.openstack.org/620952

Change-Id: Id2e27258f2e9a35bb8123854e098d0822458b314
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/624036

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 10:51:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect application of 'ip' commands for bridges

The code that applies iproute2 commands to bridges that are
modified specifies "interface" rather than "bridge", so it does
not function correctly. This patch fixes the typos so that
bridges will have updates applied through iproute2 if a restart
is not required.

Change-Id: I53df2f3506cca2b69e4f1f59471c7b90dc8fdfb7
Closes-bug: 1806128
(cherry picked from commit 61b0d665e6b9a0ff35ce06e2bcc315a54e4efbdb)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect application of 'ip' commands for bridges

The code that applies iproute2 commands to bridges that are
modified specifies "interface" rather than "bridge", so it does
not function correctly. This patch fixes the typos so that
bridges will have updates applied through iproute2 if a restart
is not required.

Change-Id: I53df2f3506cca2b69e4f1f59471c7b90dc8fdfb7
Closes-bug: 1806128
(cherry picked from commit 61b0d665e6b9a0ff35ce06e2bcc315a54e4efbdb)

commit_message:
Add verbosity level to the ansible update/upgrade run

The tripleo-common allow us to provide a verbosity level
but its not possible to pass it with the cli.
This review catch the --debug option passed to the cli
and provide it to package_update workflow

Manual Cherry pick from: Ib1fc8f6aab9a0b1a26945d441185b5c8ccb6e7dd

Change-Id: Ib1fc8f6aab9a0b1a26945d441185b5c8ccb6e7dd

commit_message:
Drop SELinux support for CentOS 7

We do not have a maintainer at the moment for SELinux and hopefully
we will adopt the upstream openstack-selinux package, but for now
in order to let deploys in environments where SELinux is set to
permissive work, we'll have to remove these bits.

This change can be reverted whenever we have a maintainer that's
available to do the work required.

Change-Id: I61141da3a391a99cb111733eae22cc7c54ce48c6
(cherry picked from commit a6dba10bb10d39b119af44ef7dbc13894773dd3e)

commit_message:
Create project for ansible-role-ara-web

This project will contain an Ansible role for deploying and installing
the ara-web project.

Jobs will be managed in-tree and there are no upstreams to import
from.

commit_message:
Ironic: bump minimum API version to 1.38

1.38 was released in Rocky, and covers all features released with
the Rocky version of Nova. Given that Nova only supports one release
of Ironic in either direction, we can bump to 1.38 and clean up
code that deals with it not being available.

Change-Id: Ie762c9f9287a5ce3b0b32748c06a137a6f93df06

messages:
[{'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-02-26 10:44:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-02-26 10:44:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 19307, 'date': '2019-02-26 14:22:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Linking the rabbitmq HA documentation in the commit message can be a  bonus https://www.rabbitmq.com/ha.html'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-02-27 13:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-02-27 20:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We should really stop shipping default policies in this role which are OpenStack specific.

I would suggest putting this override here:

https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/master/inventory/group_vars/rabbitmq_all.yml

Eventually, I would encourage that we drop that default we have inside this role.  Could you push the change there instead?'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-02-28 10:10:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hello,

I understand Mohammed's point, to be very agnostic of the scope of the role.
However, in the past, we've assumed this role would be providing safe defaults.

Increasing the amount of group vars would not be beneficial, as it's most likely these won't be overriden, and therefore we are slowing down the deployments for everyone for no good reason.

I would be happy to chat in our weekly meeting about that if necessary.

That would be my reason to add a positive vote to this review.

However, I will vote negatively, because we would need a release note to explain the change of default policy to deployers."}, {'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:41:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This is a safe default for OpenStack, not for a RabbitMQ deployment.

Do we consider our role OpenStack specific?'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)'}, {'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

@Mohammed,
So basically we have to remove the policy here (that is a generic rabbitmq installation) and move it to https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/master/inventory/group_vars/rabbitmq_all.yml that it is OpenStack specific, right?
That makes sense to me'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:57:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Gabriele I'd rather still keep it in this role because it makes it easier to find and maintain in context. It can still be done if you look at my suggested approach."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:08:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

removing my -1 and making it for the commit message only, please address that and we'll work on a follow up change to improve it :)"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:09:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)

I will do the follow up patch to separate that optional behaviour.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-01 09:37:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19307, 'date': '2019-03-01 11:57:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-03-01 20:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 10:44:37.000000000', 'message': 'Change the default HA policy for RabbitMQ mirroring

The reply_* queues have a single consumer and TTL, it is not necessary
to mirror them.

Same for _fanout_ queues, with a TTL policy.

Reducing the mirror increase the performances.
It is a best practice to mirror only the necessary queues.

ref:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/oslo/2019/oslo.2019-02-25-15.22.txt

Change-Id: I783d314aaa68b09abb4fed90818165b9e61e9758
'}, {'created': '2019-02-28 14:32:01.000000000', 'message': "The pattern  '^(?!(amqp.)|(.*_fanout_)|(reply_)).*' excludes:

 - reply_* queues. These queues have a single consumer and TTL policy.
 - *_fanout_* queues. These queues have the a TTL policy.
 - amqp.* queues. Auto-delete queues, with a single consumer.

It is not necessary to mirror the queues above, because are usually
bound to one specific consumer if there is some problem, oslo-messaging
recreates the need queues.

Reducing the mirror increase the performances and reduce the resourced
used.

ref:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/oslo/2019/oslo.2019-02-25-15.22.txt

More info about RabbitMQ HA [1]

1- https://www.rabbitmq.com/ha.html

Change-Id: I783d314aaa68b09abb4fed90818165b9e61e9758
"}, {'created': '2019-02-28 15:38:31.000000000', 'message': 'Improve the Highly Available (Mirrored) Queues policy

Without this policy, the queues reply_*, *_fanout_* are mirrored, across
all the RabbitMQ nodes.
It is not necessary to mirror the queues above, because they are usually
bound to one specific consumer, so the mirroring is not essential.
The new policy reduces the number of mirror queues and increases, in
general, the performances because it reduces the number of copies across
the cluster.

More info about RabbitMQ HA [1]

[1]: https://www.rabbitmq.com/ha.html

ref:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/oslo/2019/oslo.2019-02-25-15.22.txt

Change-Id: I783d314aaa68b09abb4fed90818165b9e61e9758
'}]
commit_message:
Improve the Highly Available (Mirrored) Queues policy

Without this policy, the queues reply_*, *_fanout_* are mirrored, across
all the RabbitMQ nodes.
It is not necessary to mirror the queues above, because they are usually
bound to one specific consumer, so the mirroring is not essential.
The new policy reduces the number of mirror queues and increases, in
general, the performances because it reduces the number of copies across
the cluster.

More info about RabbitMQ HA [1]

[1]: https://www.rabbitmq.com/ha.html

ref:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/oslo/2019/oslo.2019-02-25-15.22.txt

Change-Id: I783d314aaa68b09abb4fed90818165b9e61e9758

commit_message:
Add a blank baremetal_hosts file and skip_tags options

Baremetal jobs usinga vrt undercloud need to
ters down previous vm set ups.

A blanks hosts file is needs as the virthost and vm
will be defined in the job.

Change-Id: I0f5194c5d01a991fec010163f1cfe18548132c74

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 22:28:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix memcache pool client in monkey-patched environments

First off, this is an ugly hack, but we're dealing with code that
essentially monkey-patches a monkey-patch. You reap what you sow.

Per the linked bug, our connection pool client explodes on python 3
with eventlet monkey-patching in force:

TypeError: object() takes no parameters

This is due to the way __new__ is overridden in the class. We need
to strip arguments from the call before they get to object(), which
doesn't accept args.

Unfortunately, when we're _not_ monkey-patched, adding the new
override implementation fails with:

TypeError: object.__new__(_MemcacheClient) is not safe,
use Client.__new__()

As such, we need different implementations depending on whether we
are monkey-patched or not. This change passes both with and without
monkey-patching and adds a unit test that exposes the bug.

Note that this is a temporary, backportable fix that will ultimately
be replaced by a switch to the pymemcache library which does not
have the threading.local problem being worked around here.

Change-Id: I039dffadeebd0ff4479b9c870c257772c43aba53
Partial-Bug: 1812935
"}, {'created': '2019-02-27 16:23:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix memcache pool client in monkey-patched environments

essentially monkey-patches a monkey-patch. You reap what you sow.

doesn't accept args.

Unfortunately, when we're _not_ monkey-patched, adding the new
override implementation fails with:

TypeError: object.__new__(_MemcacheClient) is not safe,
use Client.__new__()

As such, we need different implementations depending on whether we
are monkey-patched or not. This change passes both with and without
monkey-patching and adds a unit test that exposes the bug.

Note that this is a temporary, backportable fix that will ultimately
be replaced by a switch to the pymemcache library which does not
have the threading.local problem being worked around here.

Change-Id: I039dffadeebd0ff4479b9c870c257772c43aba53
Partial-Bug: 1812935
"}]
commit_message:
Fix memcache pool client in monkey-patched environments

First off, this is an ugly hack, but we're dealing with code that
essentially monkey-patches a monkey-patch. You reap what you sow.

Per the linked bug, our connection pool client explodes on python 3
with eventlet monkey-patching in force:

TypeError: object() takes no parameters

This is due to the way __new__ is overridden in the class. We need
to strip arguments from the call before they get to object(), which
doesn't accept args.

Unfortunately, when we're _not_ monkey-patched, adding the new
override implementation fails with:

TypeError: object.__new__(_MemcacheClient) is not safe,
use Client.__new__()

As such, we need different implementations depending on whether we
are monkey-patched or not. This change passes both with and without
monkey-patching and adds a unit test that exposes the bug.

Note that this is a temporary, backportable fix that will ultimately
be replaced by a switch to the pymemcache library which does not
have the threading.local problem being worked around here.

Change-Id: I039dffadeebd0ff4479b9c870c257772c43aba53
Partial-Bug: 1812935

commit_message:
Use set instead of list

We used a list for duplicate check of `AllocationRequest`s,
but now they are hashable so this patch refactors it to use
set instead of list for the check.

Change-Id: Idb56eb0047b8b26a7a918610b1ab277462172440

commit_message:
Updated "create_pool" method in plugin

Once the pool object is created in the DB and the listeners
are updated with the pool information, the updated listeners
are retrieved and populated into the pool object.

The DB method to create the pool now flushes the context to
retrieve an updated pool DB object at the end of the method,
instead of retrieving again the same object from the DB.

This is needed to make solve the Queens backport of
I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e.

Story: 2001962

Change-Id: Icf43952f6e5c5004a5c4d8d541b6efcb5d3ec50c
(cherry picked from commit c672b0d5675e3723df76f4943d9f3e5e7d63fb88)

commit_message:
Updated "create_pool" method in plugin

Once the pool object is created in the DB and the listeners
are updated with the pool information, the updated listeners
are retrieved and populated into the pool object.

The DB method to create the pool now flushes the context to
retrieve an updated pool DB object at the end of the method,
instead of retrieving again the same object from the DB.

This is needed to make solve the Queens backport of
I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e.

Story: 2001962

Change-Id: Icf43952f6e5c5004a5c4d8d541b6efcb5d3ec50c
(cherry picked from commit c672b0d5675e3723df76f4943d9f3e5e7d63fb88)

messages: [{'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-03-01 17:36:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2019-03-01 19:18:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 17:36:29.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the legacy integration tests job

The tests should be fixed in master/stein first, because the integration
test frameworks is available from horizon only for those releases.
As the frameworks is unlikely to be backported, there is no point
in keeping a broken version of a native job.

If the integration tests are fixed at some point, this decision can be
re-evaluated.

This was discussed during the Sahara weekly meeting:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/sahara/2019/sahara.2019-02-28-14.01.log.html#l-109

Change-Id: I311203779bd3e6c6660cfe1b84e89c7dc0825c98
(cherry picked from commit ea3a84ac4ef86e64891107c66d02459a87933568)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the legacy integration tests job

The tests should be fixed in master/stein first, because the integration
test frameworks is available from horizon only for those releases.
As the frameworks is unlikely to be backported, there is no point
in keeping a broken version of a native job.

If the integration tests are fixed at some point, this decision can be
re-evaluated.

This was discussed during the Sahara weekly meeting:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/sahara/2019/sahara.2019-02-28-14.01.log.html#l-109

Change-Id: I311203779bd3e6c6660cfe1b84e89c7dc0825c98
(cherry picked from commit ea3a84ac4ef86e64891107c66d02459a87933568)

[{'created': '2019-03-01 06:54:12.000000000', 'message': "Remove unnecessary if statement

The interface_list method of
the novaclient.v2.server.Server class always returns
an object of the novaclient.base.ListWithMeta class
which is a sub class of list.

So 'if' statement that check whether it is an instance of list
is not necessary when printing the return value of the method.

Change-Id: I5dc5bfc6a783bb59c3aec2cce626bb00de633754
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary if statement

The interface_list method of
the novaclient.v2.server.Server class always returns
an object of the novaclient.base.ListWithMeta class
which is a sub class of list.

So 'if' statement that check whether it is an instance of list
is not necessary when printing the return value of the method.

Change-Id: I5dc5bfc6a783bb59c3aec2cce626bb00de633754

commit_message:
Drop py35 jobs

Python 3.5 was the target runtime for the Rocky release.
The current target py3 runtime for Stein is Python 3.6,
so there is no reason to keep testing against the older version. Also
correct setup.cfg and tox.ini to reflect the current supported Python
versions.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: I67c892e0b5afaf8e603a77102e06567a1bfe2eb6

commit_message:
Add image tasks schema methods

A follow-up of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/637540/ to bring tasks
schema methods to the image proxy and add all schema methods to proxy
docs
Release-note is inherited here (no need for a separate RN)

stable branch and we need to bump up the minor release to have room in
case of bugfix backports.

Change-Id: I36d15d509cf31afe3f576513fac461c0153254ae
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Follow W3C guidelines for links

Using hyperlinks with the text "click here" is unfriendly to
accessibility tools like screen readers, and the W3C recommends against
it[1]. Use more descriptive phrasing to conform to accessibility
recommendations.

[1] https://www.w3.org/QA/Tips/noClickHere

Change-Id: I44790bb03992dba0edc0214c5d32be17802c7f98

subject: Check wheels built are valid zip files
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-10-16 16:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-16 16:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-10-17 05:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Could we hold off on this for a bit?  As it is, with this, if we hit a corrupt zip it will fail the job (-e) and the logs won't be copied so we loose a bunch of info.

I've done some digging and yes thing seem very odd.  The release job was actually broken until Iee83a463aa9f3d4d45727e3f6c641ce8436b0b83 which would have merged in 2018-10-12 18:09:10.274848.

The problem was reported in with the file [2].  Thus it seems it must have been the 10-16 build that somehow populated this corrupt file, that is logged in [3].

Looking through those logs, it does not appear the SQLAlchemy build failed in any way.  You have to extract the build logs, but the file is "./master/1/SQLAlchemy-Utils===0.33.6/stdout" and there's nothing suggesting corruption in there.

... I have a theory.  I think maybe I3761dd9d2ab752e66bcccdd2434405f11535b95f is not doing what I think it is doing.  I think the python2 & python3 copies are still happening at the same time [4].  Note both produced the same wheel [5] -- but *slightly* different.  I suspect that that small race (maybe not so small, given weird behavior of multiple writers to a single AFS) could be behind this.

I've run out of time for today; I need to read up on the most ansible-ly way to serialise these two tasks

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/27/610527/1/gate/sahara-tests-scenario/73bcec5/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-10-16_13_38_57_196915
[2] http://mirror.dfw.rax.openstack.org/wheel/ubuntu-16.04-x86_64/sqlalchemy-utils/SQLAlchemy_Utils-0.33.6-py2.py3-none-any.whl
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/requirements/master/publish-wheel-mirror-ubuntu-xenial/25125c0/
[4] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/requirements/master/publish-wheel-mirror-ubuntu-xenial/25125c0/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-10-16_06_47_04_534881
[5] http://paste.openstack.org/show/732308/'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-17 06:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-10-17 17:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-03-01 18:13:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This ended up being an issue with parallel wheels builds writing over each other.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-16 16:22:33.000000000', 'message': "Check wheels built are valid zip files

This adds an unzip test to every wheel built by our wheel build jobs to
ensure they are valid zip files before publishing. We've seen invalid
zip files end up on our mirrors in the past particularly with the
sqlalchemy-utils package.

This check may not prevent the problem if the corruption happens during
or after publication but we can guard against early corruption and rule
out the builds themselves this way.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/611074
Change-Id: Ibde12187b2b01e6c59cc099c980078d34989fad8
"}]
commit_message:
Check wheels built are valid zip files

This adds an unzip test to every wheel built by our wheel build jobs to
ensure they are valid zip files before publishing. We've seen invalid
zip files end up on our mirrors in the past particularly with the
sqlalchemy-utils package.

This check may not prevent the problem if the corruption happens during
or after publication but we can guard against early corruption and rule
out the builds themselves this way.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/611074
Change-Id: Ibde12187b2b01e6c59cc099c980078d34989fad8

commit_message:
Revert "PowerMax driver - rebranding VMAX to PowerMax"

The patch was not backward compatible. We should properly
deprecate the old parameters to not break our users.

This reverts commit 0c831bbed88fa3cc3177b76b94738fc447b06a2f.

Change-Id: Ib37c75952fed7c762a71dae3cd169b7753faf6f7

'}, {'created': '2019-01-07 12:02:00.000000000', 'message': 'placement: Extract the service from nova.pp

This change extracts the Placement service related logic into a separate
manifest by using the newly created puppet-placement module. All
scenarios are also updated to use this.

Additionally a workaround has been included to avoid problems due to the
current use of the Rocky UCA by the Ubuntu test jobs. This should be
removed once the Stein UCA that provides the now extracted Placement
packages is used.

Change-Id: I5260b4d3478008a76fbe53fdbb716004d11b22df

capable of deploying the fully extracted Placement service.

This is then used to deploy Placement in the majority of the scenarios
with only a single scenario continuing to use the nova_placement.pp
manifest to ensure backwards compatibility is retained by puppet-nova
until the T release.

commit_message:
placement: Use puppet-placement to deploy an extracted service

This change introduces an extracted placement class capable of deploying
the service using puppet-placement ahead of the official extraction of
the service from Nova in Train.

scenario001 continues to deploy Placement using the now deprecated
puppet-nova classes ahead of their removal in Train.

Change-Id: I5260b4d3478008a76fbe53fdbb716004d11b22df

commit_message:
nova: Extract placement deployment into a separate class

This change extracts the existing logic to deploy the Nova Placement
service into a separate class. This should allow POI to continue to test
that puppet-nova is able to deploy the service after puppet-placement is
introduced.

Change-Id: I8e54d851bc433527d010b763e4aad54172a17676

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 17:04:41.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the legacy integration tests job

The tests should be fixed in master/stein first, because the integration
test frameworks is available from horizon only for those releases.
As the frameworks is unlikely to be backported, there is no point
in keeping a broken version of a native job.

If the integration tests are fixed at some point, this decision can be
re-evaluated.

This was discussed during the Sahara weekly meeting:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/sahara/2019/sahara.2019-02-28-14.01.log.html#l-109

Change-Id: I311203779bd3e6c6660cfe1b84e89c7dc0825c98
(cherry picked from commit ea3a84ac4ef86e64891107c66d02459a87933568)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the legacy integration tests job

The tests should be fixed in master/stein first, because the integration
test frameworks is available from horizon only for those releases.
As the frameworks is unlikely to be backported, there is no point
in keeping a broken version of a native job.

If the integration tests are fixed at some point, this decision can be
re-evaluated.

This was discussed during the Sahara weekly meeting:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/sahara/2019/sahara.2019-02-28-14.01.log.html#l-109

Change-Id: I311203779bd3e6c6660cfe1b84e89c7dc0825c98
(cherry picked from commit ea3a84ac4ef86e64891107c66d02459a87933568)

commit_message:
Stricter use of Boolean type in database queries

For better cross-SQL database support we need to actually
use a boolean datatype for Boolean() fields rather than expecting
implict type conversion.

Without this change, sql operations are failing with traces
similar to

ERROR oslo_db.sqlalchemy.exc_filters [-] DBAPIError exception wrapped from (psycopg2.ProgrammingError) operator does not exist: boolean = integer

Co-Authored-By: Thomas Bechtold <tbechtold@suse.com>
Closes-Bug: #1687585
Change-Id: Ic444197b5406a9c87d41f3a034ca9eeaa0e43523

[{'created': '2019-02-19 18:40:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fallback to the first element if no nodes match

"UnboundLocalError: local variable 'actual_child_idx' referenced before
assignment" happens if the expected xml has a child element and actual
has not.

Change-Id: I2773cfb5b3c2a13d514899c64dc052086134a5c4
'}, {'created': '2019-02-19 21:09:40.000000000', 'message': 'Don't reference unassigned variable in xml matchers in test

"UnboundLocalError: local variable 'actual_child_idx' referenced before
assignment" happens if the expected xml has a child element and actual
has not.

Fallback to the first element if no nodes match.

Change-Id: I2773cfb5b3c2a13d514899c64dc052086134a5c4
'}]
commit_message:
Don't reference unassigned variable in xml matchers in test

"UnboundLocalError: local variable 'actual_child_idx' referenced before
assignment" happens if the expected xml has a child element and actual
has not.

Fallback to the first element if no nodes match.

Change-Id: I2773cfb5b3c2a13d514899c64dc052086134a5c4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-15 15:00:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix rabbitmq reconfigure, simplify role

Since Id724b44a3edd951fa8b06c9f2c347e9ed8c5ffd9, there is a reference to a
non-existent variable, rabbitmq_confs, that causes deployment to fail if
rabbitmq configuration other than config.json is changed.

I'm taking this opportunity to simplify the role, since we can use the Ansible
handler notification system to determine when handlers need to run, without
registering and checking variables. This simpler approach was used in the
haproxy refactor.

Change-Id: Ibe0e7fda93afff741243ff9c350db1c8c6e1e6d3
Closes-Bug: #1816053
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq reconfigure, simplify role

Since Id724b44a3edd951fa8b06c9f2c347e9ed8c5ffd9, there is a reference to a
non-existent variable, rabbitmq_confs, that causes deployment to fail if
rabbitmq configuration other than config.json is changed.

I'm taking this opportunity to simplify the role, since we can use the Ansible
handler notification system to determine when handlers need to run, without
registering and checking variables. This simpler approach was used in the
haproxy refactor.

Change-Id: Ibe0e7fda93afff741243ff9c350db1c8c6e1e6d3
Closes-Bug: #1816053

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 19:33:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add retry decorator update_segment_host_mapping()

When multiple agents register at the same time there is
a possible race condition causing segment host mappings
updates to fail. StaleDataError raised by SQLAlchemy ORM.

Adding retry_if_session_inactive() decorator to the method
fixes the issue.

Also serialize the method with lockutils. It takes 25+
seconds to update segment host mappings for 10 agents with
the retry decorator alone. With the method serialized the
same operation completes in less than 1 second. The retry
decorator is still required for active/active scenarios.

Closes-Bug: #1743579
Change-Id: I616457f094d000a4016c610b454be8269d9b4948
(cherry picked from commit f84781f246004651e0636f8b6507ee1e48bac6b0)
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry decorator update_segment_host_mapping()

When multiple agents register at the same time there is
a possible race condition causing segment host mappings
updates to fail. StaleDataError raised by SQLAlchemy ORM.

Adding retry_if_session_inactive() decorator to the method
fixes the issue.

Also serialize the method with lockutils. It takes 25+
seconds to update segment host mappings for 10 agents with
the retry decorator alone. With the method serialized the
same operation completes in less than 1 second. The retry
decorator is still required for active/active scenarios.

Closes-Bug: #1743579
Change-Id: I616457f094d000a4016c610b454be8269d9b4948
(cherry picked from commit f84781f246004651e0636f8b6507ee1e48bac6b0)

commit_message:
Remove the legacy integration tests job

The tests should be fixed in master/stein first, because the integration
test frameworks is available from horizon only for those releases.
As the frameworks is unlikely to be backported, there is no point
in keeping a broken version of a native job.

If the integration tests are fixed at some point, this decision can be
re-evaluated.

This was discussed during the Sahara weekly meeting:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/sahara/2019/sahara.2019-02-28-14.01.log.html#l-109

Change-Id: I311203779bd3e6c6660cfe1b84e89c7dc0825c98

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 22:26:24.000000000', 'message': "Don't change az name when setting aggregate metadata

The POST /os-aggregates/action (set_metadata) action overwrites
the metadata about an aggregate. An availability zone in the compute
service is just a reserved metadata keyword on a host aggregate.

Changing an AZ is dangerous when there are instances in the AZ and
nova is now fixing that long-standing bug [1] by making the compute
API return a 400 error when attempting to rename an AZ while it has
instances in it.

This change fixes a race in test_aggregate_basic_ops where it was
overwriting metadata on an aggregate which would also overwrite
the availability_zone which will now fail with nova change [1].

[1] Ic27195e46502067c87ee9c71a811a3ca3f610b73

Change-Id: I120fa002c4a5f5b5eacdf36984fc573ac2c0317c
Related-Bug: #1378904
"}, {'created': '2019-02-19 22:28:54.000000000', 'message': "Don't change az name when setting aggregate metadata

The POST /os-aggregates/{aggregate_id}/action (set_metadata) action
overwrites the metadata about an aggregate. An availability zone in
the compute service is just a reserved metadata keyword on a host
aggregate.

Changing an AZ is dangerous when there are instances in the AZ and
nova is now fixing that long-standing bug [1] by making the compute
API return a 400 error when attempting to rename an AZ while it has
instances in it.

This change fixes a race in test_aggregate_basic_ops where it was
overwriting metadata on an aggregate which would also overwrite
the availability_zone which will now fail with nova change [1].

[1] Ic27195e46502067c87ee9c71a811a3ca3f610b73

Change-Id: I120fa002c4a5f5b5eacdf36984fc573ac2c0317c
Related-Bug: #1378904
"}]
commit_message:
Don't change az name when setting aggregate metadata

The POST /os-aggregates/{aggregate_id}/action (set_metadata) action
overwrites the metadata about an aggregate. An availability zone in
the compute service is just a reserved metadata keyword on a host
aggregate.

Changing an AZ is dangerous when there are instances in the AZ and
nova is now fixing that long-standing bug [1] by making the compute
API return a 400 error when attempting to rename an AZ while it has
instances in it.

This change fixes a race in test_aggregate_basic_ops where it was
overwriting metadata on an aggregate which would also overwrite
the availability_zone which will now fail with nova change [1].

[1] Ic27195e46502067c87ee9c71a811a3ca3f610b73

Change-Id: I120fa002c4a5f5b5eacdf36984fc573ac2c0317c
Related-Bug: #1378904

commit_message:
Add oslo.privsep to config-generator list

We recently exposed the privsep opts for config generator use, so
projects that depend on oslo.privsep should include them in their
sample configs.

Change-Id: Ibea975823f5851a86dfd016a8500278c523f4501

commit_message:
Add 'project_id' response to group snapshots

Since we've already merged the spec for adding 'project_id' to
group response, we're adding the spec 'project_id' response of group
snapshots under the same microversion to avoid version bump for
similar type of features.

Change-Id: I99e760c29080b47207eef320cc16add695e91e37
Implements: blueprint add-project-id-to-group-groupsnapshot-response

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 12:13:28.000000000', 'message': "Deploy templates: fix updating steps in Python 3

If a step in a deploy template is updated, changing only the step's
'args' field, then we see the following error on Python 3:

TypeError: unorderable types: dict() < dict()

In Python 3, dicts are no longer orderable, so cannot be used as part of
the key to a sort function. This change uses a JSON dump of the step
with sorted keys for comparison, as suggested in [1].

[1] https://stackoverflow.com/a/22003440

Change-Id: I70b806d5850f0678f3dd6633228947f6cd39d691
Story: 1722275
Task: 29750
"}]
commit_message:
Deploy templates: fix updating steps in Python 3

If a step in a deploy template is updated, changing only the step's
'args' field, then we see the following error on Python 3:

TypeError: unorderable types: dict() < dict()

In Python 3, dicts are no longer orderable, so cannot be used as part of
the key to a sort function. This change uses a JSON dump of the step
with sorted keys for comparison, as suggested in [1].

[1] https://stackoverflow.com/a/22003440

Change-Id: I70b806d5850f0678f3dd6633228947f6cd39d691
Story: 1722275
Task: 29750

commit_message:
echo out the user that tempest is containerized

Let's make it obvious if tempest is executing
via the container and not from the undercloud.
echo out a statement, noting it.

Change-Id: I50a6b8ebcf33a7d216237b06f1e3e24867d17f58

commit_message:
Add support for 1.18 microversion

The 1.18 microversion of placement adds support for the
required parameter when requesting a list of resource
providers. The values are traits which limit the results
to only those providers that have those traits. The
--required argument may be specified multiple times.

Note the NOTE in the added test about raciness. There's
not a ton we can do about that since the functional
tests aren't actually functional tests, they are
integration.

Change-Id: If79b4d12c712fdeeafa5ea77ae3411d31c8cfe9b

commit_message:
make the git clone idempotent

do not try to reclone tq/repro git repos
after they have initially been cloned.
set update: false

Change-Id: I213fd82b6cd9005762b1287292cb44e8c6f574af

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 12:38:17.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add override repos into tripleo-ci tripleo-repos role

To be passed by the periodic for buildcontainers so we can set
tripleo-ci-testing

Tracked by ci team in [1]

[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/773
Depends-On: I5effd0e77215109720370f470a8fe4e444048afc
Change-Id: I37bc90881ef19ae4aeace65750da4dd93da5f4e2
'}, {'created': '2019-02-25 13:30:54.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add override repos into tripleo-ci tripleo-repos role

The tripleo-repos role in tripleo-ci defaults to current-tripleo
for master and current for everything else. There is no support
for the tripleo-ci-testing repo.

This adds 2 params: i) override_repos as a param
to tripleo-ci tripleo-repos and ii) buildcontainers_override_repos
as a param in the tripleo-buildcontainers job. ii) is passed from
periodic version of buildcontainers in [1]. Tracked by
tripleo-ci-squad in [2] and the depends-on adds support for
tripleo-ci-testing into tripleo-repos currently not supported

commit_message:
Add override_repos into tripleo-ci tripleo-repos role

The tripleo-repos role in tripleo-ci defaults to current-tripleo
for master and current for everything else. There is no support
for the tripleo-ci-testing repo.

This adds 2 params: i) override_repos as a param
to tripleo-ci tripleo-repos and ii) buildcontainers_override_repos
as a param in the tripleo-buildcontainers job. ii) is passed from
periodic version of buildcontainers in [1] and is then used to
set the value of override_repos, passed into ci tripleo-repos.

The depends-on adds tripleo-ci-testing as an option for
tripleo-repos itself as it is currently unsupported.
Tracked by tripleo ci squad with [2]. See test review at [3] which
runs the periodic container build in check with this code.

Also adds /etc/yum.repos.d/ into collected buildcontainer logs.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/18975
[2] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/773
[3] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/19000
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/638651 # tripleo-repos
Change-Id: I37bc90881ef19ae4aeace65750da4dd93da5f4e2

subject: Increase nb_cfg when needed only (reducing the # of transactions)
messages:
[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-05 11:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-05 11:18:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-02-05 11:19:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-05 11:22:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-02-05 11:22:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This is a good optimization as all those extra transactions are generating traffic from ovsdb-server and the number of workers connected to it can be really high for big deployments (neutron-server workers on controllers + metadata-agents on computes). A follow up to this is required in TripleO to reduce the # of workers of metadata-agent as well which now defaults to os_workers (#CPUs/2 typically)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-05 11:24:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-02-05 13:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-05 13:41:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-02-05 17:03:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

It seems like the original patch for agent support only updated nb_cfg on ping, but didn't really work well so we changed it to do this. But staring at the code I can't see any reason why this patch wouldn't work. Maybe the relaxed time for determining liveness using agent_down_time means this will work better than it used to?

With the read-only stuff, we will already cut down a lot on this. If I'm reading things right, this code will save us from SB transactions for writes to the NBDB that don't already cause an update to the SBDB, right? (Because if the NB write triggers a change in SBDB and increments nb_cfg, the sb_cfg update will be part of the transaction that calls update_logical_port_status()).

I think this is fine, but I'll play with it for a bit today just to make sure. Tentative +1 :)"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-06 09:43:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> It seems like the original patch for agent support only updated
 > nb_cfg on ping, but didn't really work well so we changed it to do
 > this. But staring at the code I can't see any reason why this patch
 > wouldn't work. Maybe the relaxed time for determining liveness
 > using agent_down_time means this will work better than it used to?
 > 
 > With the read-only stuff, we will already cut down a lot on this.
 > If I'm reading things right, this code will save us from SB
 > transactions for writes to the NBDB that don't already cause an
 > update to the SBDB, right? (Because if the NB write triggers a
 > change in SBDB and increments nb_cfg, the sb_cfg update will be
 > part of the transaction that calls update_logical_port_status()).
 > 
 > I think this is fine, but I'll play with it for a bit today just to
 > make sure. Tentative +1 :)

Thanks! Were you able to test it yesterday ?"}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-02-07 14:30:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

After merging https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635354/, everything seemed to work locally.

What do you think about also bumping the nb_cfg on some things that are going to trigger a write to the SBDB anyway, so it wouldn't change the number of transactions?  I like that bumping nb_cfg theoretically lets us know that something has actually been implemented on the target, not just written to a DB. We could start with just what would be necessary to not have modify the metadata agent test. But I agree that doing it indiscriminately is a bad idea.

Just a thought, to avoid having to modify the test. If you don't think it's worth it, not a big deal."}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-02-07 21:25:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-12 09:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

Thanks Terry, I will address the comments there!'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-12 09:28:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-22 14:23:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Bump do we want to go ahead with this ?'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-02-28 13:51:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:10:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-03-01 13:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Just clarifying from our irc conversation that still nb_cfg will be bumped periodically when checking liveness (although the commit message implictly says it :)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-05 11:04:11.000000000', 'message': "Increase nb_cfg when needed only (reducing the # of transactions to NBDB)

Prior to this patch, any transaction would result in the nb_cfg frm NBDB
being increased by 1. That would propagated to the SBDB and the metadata
agent would get an event which would result in yet another transaction
being created to update the Chassis' external_ids column to inform that
the agent was alive.

This patch is changing that behavior to bump the nb_cfg only when the
get_agents() API call is invoked, reducing the number of transactions
for any other operation.

Closes-Bug: #1814698
Change-Id: I6f91955444e0601f10f2d5e509d4a4453def5f2b
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-02-05 11:18:19.000000000', 'message': "Increase nb_cfg when needed only (reducing the # of transactions)

Prior to this patch, any transaction would result in the nb_cfg from
NBDB being increased by 1. That would propagated to the SBDB and the
metadata agent would get an event which would result in yet another
transaction being created to update the Chassis' external_ids (SBDB)
column to inform that the agent was alive.

This patch is changing that behavior to bump the nb_cfg only when the
get_agents() API call is invoked which would reduce the number of
transactions created in the SBDB due to that health check mechanism.

Closes-Bug: #1814698
Change-Id: I6f91955444e0601f10f2d5e509d4a4453def5f2b
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-02-05 11:24:06.000000000', 'message': "Increase nb_cfg when needed only (reducing the # of transactions)

Prior to this patch, any transaction to NBDB would result in the nb_cfg
from NBDB being increased by 1. That would propagated to the SBDB and
the metadata agent would get an event which would result in yet another
transaction being created to update the Chassis' external_ids (SBDB)
column to inform that the agent was alive.

This patch is changing that behavior to bump the nb_cfg only when
the get_agents() API call is invoked which would reduce the number
of transactions created in the SBDB due to our current health check
mechanism.

Closes-Bug: #1814698
Change-Id: I6f91955444e0601f10f2d5e509d4a4453def5f2b
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-02-12 09:28:54.000000000', 'message': "Increase nb_cfg when needed only (reducing the # of transactions)

Prior to this patch, any transaction to NBDB would result in the nb_cfg
from NBDB being increased by 1. That would propagated to the SBDB and
the metadata agent would get an event which would result in yet another
transaction being created to update the Chassis' external_ids (SBDB)
column to inform that the agent was alive.

This patch is changing that behavior to bump the nb_cfg only when
the get_agents() API call is invoked which would reduce the number
of transactions created in the SBDB due to our current health check
mechanism.

Closes-Bug: #1814698

commit_message:
Increase nb_cfg when needed only (reducing the # of transactions)

Prior to this patch, any transaction to NBDB would result in the nb_cfg
from NBDB being increased by 1. That would propagated to the SBDB and
the metadata agent would get an event which would result in yet another
transaction being created to update the Chassis' external_ids (SBDB)
column to inform that the agent was alive.

This patch is changing that behavior to bump the nb_cfg only when
the get_agents() API call is invoked which would reduce the number
of transactions created in the SBDB due to our current health check
mechanism.

Closes-Bug: #1814698
Change-Id: I6f91955444e0601f10f2d5e509d4a4453def5f2b
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-11-20 05:09:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-25205 : SUCCESS in 2h 23m 01s'}, {'account_id': 28913, 'date': '2018-11-20 15:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28913, 'date': '2018-11-20 15:24:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am not even sure if this a nova bug. I think the issue is with the Cinder manager, because it never updates the status as "migrating". Hence the check fails.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2018-11-22 10:04:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If you read the bug... cinder has *never* set the status to migrating. It was a bug in Nova that we assumed it did. This code has only ever worked because for retype it sets the status to retyping. I had thought that it sets migration_status to 'migrating' in both cases, hence this code, but given the test failures I may have overlooked something. I haven't investigated."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-02-21 09:45:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Replaced by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/637224/'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-03-01 16:13:40.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Superceded by lyarwood's patch"}]

Hi, currently the iscsi role is still in the 'old' format. We've started to migrate roles to using notify handlers as this form of reconfigure proved to be very slow (see https://blueprints.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+spec/better-reconfigure).

So what's really needed here is to move the iscsi role to match roles such as glance or keystone, then we get reconfigure for free. Please feel free to give me a shout via irc if you'd like more info."}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-06-27 04:38:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> Hi, currently the iscsi role is still in the 'old' format. We've
 > started to migrate roles to using notify handlers as this form of

 > 
 > So what's really needed here is to move the iscsi role to match
 > roles such as glance or keystone, then we get reconfigure for free.
 > Please feel free to give me a shout via irc if you'd like more
 > info.

agree, please switch to better reconfigure"}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-06-27 07:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2018-10-04 06:45:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 12:25:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error message when updating quota values

The error message mixes smaller and greater which leads to error
messages like "Quota value 4000 for gigabytes are greater than
already used and reserved 8000.". The proposed patch fixes this
(and replaces 'are' by 'is' in the message).

Change-Id: I90b04ae12235d5fabc57d549aff53eaa7bd99565
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error message when updating quota values

The error message mixes smaller and greater which leads to error
messages like "Quota value 4000 for gigabytes are greater than
already used and reserved 8000.". The proposed patch fixes this
(and replaces 'are' by 'is' in the message).

Change-Id: I90b04ae12235d5fabc57d549aff53eaa7bd99565

commit_message:
Enable MP-BGP capabilities in Ryu BGP driver

This change enables all capabilties regardless of peer address
family, thereby enabling announcement of IPv6 prefixes over IPv4
sessions and vice-versa. Peers can opt in/out with capabilities
configured on the remote end of the session.

Change-Id: I7b241cdfddcecbdd8cdde2e88de35b9be6982451
Closes-Bug: #1784590

[{'created': '2019-02-27 14:02:29.000000000', 'message': 'Default to Prometheus tag for all Prometheus images

This allows an operator to pin the Prometheus docker image
tag for all Prometheus images to that specified by the `prometheus_tag`.

commit_message:
Default to Prometheus tag for all Prometheus images

This allows an operator to pin the Prometheus docker image
tag for all Prometheus images to that specified by the `prometheus_tag`.
Without this change, the alert manager and cadvisor tags would also need
to be set.

Change-Id: Iadef001af7d3be5b2a39ce5e2363d05a33a775e4

commit_message:
Add Ceph base class and relation adapter

Our Ceph packages are distributed along with our OpenStack
packages both for distro and UCA.

Reactive Ceph charms can thus reuse a large portion of the
``charms.openstack`` library, both for basic package and
service management and for default reactive handlers.

The new classes are placed in a ``plugins`` directory.

First consumer of the ``CephCharm`` class is the
``ceph-rbd-mirror`` charm accompanied by the
``charm-layer-ceph`` layer.

Existing reactive charms that consume or provide Ceph services
should also be ported to use the base functionality now added
to the ``OpenStackCharm`` and ``CephCharm`` base classes
(e.g. ``ceph-fs``, ``gnocchi``).

Adds support to OpenStackRelationAdapter for passing on
properties from Endpoint based interfaces.

Change-Id: I86bdd35b301fa39504c5d5af9a2b7d01bfd38768

commit_message:
Add tripleo-ci-testing to tripleo-repos for use in periodics

For periodic containers build job tripleo-ci-testing makes more
sense than current. Used by [1] and tracked in [2]. The actual
tripleo-ci-testing repo is specified by [3] in rdo config.
You can see a test review in [4] which runs the periodic container
build job in check with this code.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/638652
[2] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/773
[3] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/18975/
[4] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/19000

commit_message:
Correct how failed containers make the whole thing fail

It might happen we don't have either podman or docker installed.
The previous version didn't take care of that case, and basically
failed with some ansible error, creating false-positive.

Also, take into account only tripleo_* systemd units.
This will allow to avoid current false-positive with services
that are present, but not really needed, such as NetworkManager.

Change-Id: Icbcdc716a753240259859a5a24d92bf63ec40254

commit_message:
Add requirements history

We have static URLs redirecting /constraints/upper/series to the
appropriate git interface.  In the next change in this series we move to
a data-driven model so let's supply the data :)

Even though we have tag history that goes back to Folsom only import
Juno and later because that's when we first added constraints support

This means as the create and delete branches for requirements, like
other projects, we have a central source of truth (other than git) from
which to update the htaccess redirects.

I had update deliverables.py to account for the fact most of the
requirements branches don't have a release.  This does make the table
look a little funny (as the earliest release is the series eol tag :()
but I'm not sure how we can do better there.

Change-Id: Ie8e60dc865ab301539c0bb085a52dd25f3f62edf

[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:51:33.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I380c7b2010248a257612ad707a69b433054d7a4a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Add doc/requirements.txt to releasenotes tox environment

Without these dependencies, the releasenotes build does not actually
work.

commit_message:
PowerMax driver - rebranding VMAX to PowerMax

PowerMax is to replace VMAX in release notes, online documentation,
directory structure and driver name.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/620659/
Change-Id: Ibddeb7244386f5af266d4dfbb7f76c63f463b8df

commit_message:
Use config-table for dynamic config documentation

A lot of our config option reference documentation was out of date, with
deprecated and removed options and changed defaults. This changes the
"Additional options" configuration reference to use the config-table
directive so the published docs stay in sync with changes in the code.

Closes-bug: #1814910

Change-Id: Ib891435dc69eb795ea6d4d0fb6626259e95cf27f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

novajoin tests only in job that support it like featureset 039.

[{'created': '2019-03-01 10:02:30.000000000', 'message': 'Added tox environment for gathering coverage

This technique was borrowed from the tox "cover" environment in
openstack/nova's tox.ini.  This leverages the fact that stestr lets
you override the python executable via the PYTHON environment
variable.  Doing this allows us to easily generate coverage for our
unit tests.

An important caveat is that this does not provide any coverage for
tests via zaza, amulet, etc.  It is purely focused on the unit tests.

Note that this replaces the previous .coveragerc; coverage
configuration is instead pulled from tox.ini.

commit_message:
Added tox environment for gathering coverage

This technique was borrowed from the tox "cover" environment in
openstack/nova's tox.ini.  This leverages the fact that stestr lets
you override the python executable via the PYTHON environment
variable.  Doing this allows us to easily generate coverage for our
unit tests.

An important caveat is that this does not provide any coverage for
tests via zaza, amulet, etc.  It is purely focused on the unit tests.

Note that this replaces the previous .coveragerc; coverage
configuration is instead pulled from tox.ini.

Change-Id: I2a14d3a3b0215aa637bc18e780d1ad765c796daa

commit_message:
Added tox environment for gathering coverage

This technique was borrowed from the tox "cover" environment in
openstack/nova's tox.ini.  This leverages the fact that stestr lets
you override the python executable via the PYTHON environment
variable.  Doing this allows us to easily generate coverage for our
unit tests.

An important caveat is that this does not provide any coverage for
tests via zaza, amulet, etc.  It is purely focused on the unit tests.

Note that this replaces the previous .coveragerc; coverage
configuration is instead pulled from tox.ini.

Change-Id: I253e35de7ba72fb2f6a3ad018a45924771443465

commit_message:
Add "rpc_response_max_timeout" config variable in OVS agent

The configuration variable "rpc_response_max_timeout" is not defined
in the OVS agent configuration. When the agent is stopped (SIGTERM),
the exception is raised. This error can be seen in the fullstack tests.

Change-Id: Ieedb6e87a4e98efef0f895566f7d4d88c3cd9336
Closes-Bug: #1815797

That#s not enough to add a new repo, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html for all the changes needed.'}, {'account_id': 23488, 'date': '2019-02-22 13:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23488, 'date': '2019-02-22 14:28:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-02-22 14:54:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

looks like the job failure is 

"ERROR: Project openstack/rsd-virt-for-nova has redundant acl_config line, remove it."

but im glad to see this moving forward :)'}, {'account_id': 23488, 'date': '2019-02-22 16:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-02-24 10:35:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Change is fine but one question on set up:

Note that you will start with an empty repository. Your very first
patch needs to setup the repository and add all infrastructure so that
the jobs pass (this can be done with a cookiecutter project).

Also, you can import an existing repository including it's history if
you have one. Once the repository is created, importing is not
possible anymore, changes will have to go through the normal review
process.

If you have a lot of history to import, please use the upstream field
instead of creating a repository and then pushing the patches one at a
time. Pushing a large number of related patches all at one time causes
the CI infrastructure to slow down, which impacts work on all of the
other projects using it. After repo creation the infra team will not
push any content to it; this is your only chance to import directly.

Please confirm that starting with an empty repo is fine."}, {'account_id': 23488, 'date': '2019-02-25 08:46:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23488, 'date': '2019-02-25 09:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Add vendor override for openSUSE repositories

Zypper uses the concept of "vendor stickiness" and will refuse to
upgrade packages that require a vendor change. This change introduces
a new override variable to instruct zypper to view a list of vendors
as equivalent.

Change-Id: Ib3412b02f1edf9aae03cd5478ac2310cce3f2e8a
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@suse.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-05 18:43:45.000000000', 'message': 'ironic: partition compute services by conductor group

This uses ironic’s conductor group feature to limit the subset of nodes
which a nova-compute service will manage. This allows for partitioning
nova-compute services to a particular location (building, aisle, rack,
etc), and provides a way for operators to manage the failure domain of a
given nova-compute service.

This adds two config options to the [ironic] config group:
* partition_key: the key to match with the conductor_group property on
  ironic nodes to limit the subset of nodes which can be managed.
* peer_list: a list of other compute service hostnames which manage the
  same partition_key, used when building the hash ring.

Change-Id: I1b184ff37948dc403fe38874613cd4d870c644fd
Implements: blueprint ironic-conductor-groups

commit_message:
ironic: partition compute services by conductor group

This uses ironic’s conductor group feature to limit the subset of nodes
which a nova-compute service will manage. This allows for partitioning
nova-compute services to a particular location (building, aisle, rack,
etc), and provides a way for operators to manage the failure domain of a
given nova-compute service.

This adds two config options to the [ironic] config group:
* partition_key: the key to match with the conductor_group property on
  ironic nodes to limit the subset of nodes which can be managed.
* peer_list: a list of other compute service hostnames which manage the
  same partition_key, used when building the hash ring.

Change-Id: I1b184ff37948dc403fe38874613cd4d870c644fd
Implements: blueprint ironic-conductor-groups

commit_message:
Trigger build containers when tripleo-repos is modified

Assure we build containers when we modify this job in order to assure
we do not introduce regressions.

This is already working on RDO version but it was not happening on
upstream job (centos-7).

Corrects universal=1 in setup.cfg which also triggers the build
containers job (file pattern match).

Change-Id: I9e29a6ae55ffe57add66db0c5437da2a7dbd2a2c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639739/

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 06:13:57.000000000', 'message': 'Drop py35 jobs

Python 3.5 was the target runtime for the Rocky release.
The current target py3 runtime for Stein is Python 3.6,
so there is no reason to keep testing against the older version.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: Ie8dbbf3180da6ba487cebfa40bf831f20ba33a90
'}]
commit_message:
Drop py35 jobs

Python 3.5 was the target runtime for the Rocky release.
The current target py3 runtime for Stein is Python 3.6,
so there is no reason to keep testing against the older version.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: Ie8dbbf3180da6ba487cebfa40bf831f20ba33a90

commit_message:
make reproducer bash syntax more portable

Fix previous code which was giving syntax error on BSD bash.
The new checking is more portable.

- use portable way to check if variable is defined
- avoid use of &>> (bash4 only) and use 2>&1 >> instead

References:
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3601515/how-to-check-if-a-variable-is-set-in-bash
- https://stackoverflow.com/a/876242/99834

Partial-Bug: #1784648
Change-Id: I5178a9d22a0e3feba62a45c86bf15b52ee8435ed
Signed-off-by: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-05-31 21:24:58.000000000', 'message': "Add support for Cassandra 2.2 and 3.x

Changes from Cassandra 2.1 (current):

 - 'credentials' table was renamed to 'roles'.
    update the statement

 - It may take a couple of seconds before any role-related
   queries can be executed. Wait for 5s before securing the
   database.

 - The 'schema_keyspaces' table has been removed.
   Obtain the list of keyspaces from the cluster
   metadata instead (compatible with v2.1).

 - Some new configuration properties were added.
   Add updated templates and validation rules.
   Apply extra settings in the prepare call.

Add guestagent implementations for the two datastores.
Move the current Cassandra code to 'cassandra_common'
package and implement and make all versions
derive from it.

Newly exposed configuration properties:

Cassandra 2.2 (from 2.1):

    roles_validity_in_ms
    roles_update_interval_in_ms
    row_cache_class_name
    commitlog_compression
    start_rpc
    batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb
    unlogged_batch_across_partitions_warn_threshold
    tracetype_query_ttl
    tracetype_repair_ttl
    windows_timer_interval

Cassandra 3.x (from 2.2):

    allocate_tokens_for_keyspace
    hinted_handoff_disabled_datacenters
    hints_flush_period_in_ms
    max_hints_file_size_in_mb
    hints_compression
    concurrent_materialized_view_writes
    buffer_pool_use_heap_if_exhausted
    disk_optimization_strategy
    enable_scripted_user_defined_functions
    enable_user_defined_functions
    unlogged_batch_across_partitions_warn_threshold (removed)

Change-Id: Ia2c5af842e1230b1d7152c5fb80ddd07af2cfc9c
Closes-Bug: 1582923
