commit_message:
Add support for Cassandra 2.2 and 3.x

Changes from Cassandra 2.1 (current):

 - 'credentials' table was renamed to 'roles'.
    update the statement

 - The 'schema_keyspaces' table has been removed.
   Obtain the list of keyspaces from the cluster
   metadata instead (compatible with v2.1).

 - Some new configuration properties were added.
   Add updated templates and validation rules.
   Apply extra settings in the prepare call.

Add guestagent implementations for the two datastores.
Move the current Cassandra code to 'cassandra_common'
package and implement and make all versions
derive from it.

Newly exposed configuration properties:

Cassandra 2.2 (from 2.1):

    roles_validity_in_ms
    roles_update_interval_in_ms
    row_cache_class_name
    commitlog_compression
    start_rpc
    batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb
    unlogged_batch_across_partitions_warn_threshold
    tracetype_query_ttl
    tracetype_repair_ttl
    windows_timer_interval

Cassandra 3.x (from 2.2):

    allocate_tokens_for_keyspace
    hinted_handoff_disabled_datacenters
    hints_flush_period_in_ms
    max_hints_file_size_in_mb
    hints_compression
    concurrent_materialized_view_writes
    buffer_pool_use_heap_if_exhausted
    disk_optimization_strategy
    enable_scripted_user_defined_functions
    enable_user_defined_functions
    unlogged_batch_across_partitions_warn_threshold (removed)

Depends-On: I22e69f1f50f4fb9636ac39e4ac2bf199b9bed9be
Change-Id: Ia2c5af842e1230b1d7152c5fb80ddd07af2cfc9c
Closes-Bug: 1582923

commit_message:
Allow image checksum to be a URL

We allow image_source to be a URL, let us also support URLs for checksums.
This change copies handling of multi-file checksum files from metalsmith.

Change-Id: Ie4d7e5c79b76bdd72d50eeb384cf10519278a80c
Story: #2005061
Task: #29605

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I5a40ef5db945ece5a9f17fb5b7b1a9468f153db6
Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 09:56:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pysendfile requirement marker

Currently, any patch that changes one of the requirements files is
failing the requirements-check job, with the following error:

Requirement(package='pysendfile', location='', specifiers='>=2.0.0',
markers='', comment='# MIT', extras=frozenset()) 'markers': '' does not
match "sys_platform!='win32'"

Could not find a global requirements entry to match package {}. If the
package is already included in the global list, the name or platform
markers there may not match the local settings.

The problem is that a "sys_platform!='win32'" marker was added [1] to
the pysendfile requirement in the requirements repo, which needs to be
propagated to the requirements of all repos using the package.

This change adds the required marker to requirements.txt.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639084/

Change-Id: Ibd7656cbcfbf204930f9c8562f79ab92bd4aefb5
Story: 2005096
Task: 29697
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pysendfile requirement marker

Currently, any patch that changes one of the requirements files is
failing the requirements-check job, with the following error:

Requirement(package='pysendfile', location='', specifiers='>=2.0.0',
markers='', comment='# MIT', extras=frozenset()) 'markers': '' does not
match "sys_platform!='win32'"

Could not find a global requirements entry to match package {}. If the
package is already included in the global list, the name or platform
markers there may not match the local settings.

The problem is that a "sys_platform!='win32'" marker was added [1] to
the pysendfile requirement in the requirements repo, which needs to be
propagated to the requirements of all repos using the package.

This change adds the required marker to requirements.txt.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639084/

Change-Id: Ibd7656cbcfbf204930f9c8562f79ab92bd4aefb5
Story: 2005096
Task: 29697

commit_message:
Ensure passwordless ssh with stack between nodes

For compute migration to work, the stack user needs to be configured
with passwordless ssh between all hosts involved in the migration.

Reuse the build ssh-key for this, which is already distributed for
user root.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/563584

Change-Id: Id07f55fea06509466add35315c135dbfba6aa714
(cherry picked from commit afe141401997db054cd9987ca17d989415c65ad4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 10:59:01.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Use the correct mdev allocated from the pGPU

Now that we use nested resource providers for pGPUs, the VGPU allocation
is made on a child RP, not the root RP. That said, mediated devices are
blindly created or assigned by the libvirt driver to a specific PCI device
(here meaning a pGPU) meaning that the real usage could differ from what
Placement knows.
That said, until we support multiple types, all pGPUs sharing same type are
flattened from a resource perspective. Placement will allow allocations to be
made on some pGPU even if the pGPU is full, but since the total amount of
available vGPUs is identical, libvirt will be able to find another pGPU.

This change aims to fix this by allocating the right mediated device from the
same physical device.

Part of blueprint reshape-provider-tree
Part of blueprint vgpu-stein

Change-Id: Ia8f43199f70da9c5867acd9a76c43ca8c2c11c80
'}, {'created': '2019-02-14 17:46:18.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Use the correct mdev allocated from the pGPU

root RP.
This change aims to prepare this by allocating the right mediated device from the
same physical device.

Part of blueprint reshape-provider-tree
Part of blueprint vgpu-stein

Change-Id: Ia8f43199f70da9c5867acd9a76c43ca8c2c11c80
'}, {'created': '2019-02-15 10:52:55.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Use the correct mdev allocated from the pGPU

for pGPUs. Accordingly, the allocation will be made on a child RP, not the
root RP.
This change aims to prepare this by allocating the right mediated device from the
same physical device.

Part of blueprint reshape-provider-tree
Part of blueprint vgpu-stein

Change-Id: Ia8f43199f70da9c5867acd9a76c43ca8c2c11c80
'}, {'created': '2019-02-19 09:50:14.000000000', 'message': "Use the correct mdev allocated from the pGPU

In the next change in the series, we will use nested resource providers
for pGPUs. Accordingly, the allocation will be made on a child RP, not the
root RP.
This change aims to prepare this by allocating the right mediated device from the
same physical device.

Note that given we don't pass allocations when initializing the virt driver, in
case some mdevs are missing, we will recreate them blindly. Next change will
fix it.

Part of blueprint reshape-provider-tree
Part of blueprint vgpu-stein

Change-Id: Ia8f43199f70da9c5867acd9a76c43ca8c2c11c80
"}, {'created': '2019-02-27 12:31:17.000000000', 'message': "Use the correct mdev allocated from the pGPU

This change aims to prepare this by allocating the right mediated device from the

case some mdevs are missing, we will recreate them blindly. Next change will

Part of blueprint reshape-provider-tree
Part of blueprint vgpu-stein

Change-Id: Ia8f43199f70da9c5867acd9a76c43ca8c2c11c80
"}]
commit_message:
Use the correct mdev allocated from the pGPU

In the next change in the series, we will use nested resource providers
for pGPUs. Accordingly, the allocation will be made on a child RP, not the
root RP.
This change aims to prepare this by allocating the right mediated device from the
same physical device.

Note that given we don't pass allocations when initializing the virt driver, in
case some mdevs are missing, we will recreate them blindly. Next change will
fix it.

Part of blueprint reshape-provider-tree
Part of blueprint vgpu-stein

Change-Id: Ia8f43199f70da9c5867acd9a76c43ca8c2c11c80

commit_message:
docs: ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree in nova

This change is an update to the nova reference documentation to reflect
changes to the ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree method in nova drivers.

Change-Id: Ifae98d888069477748ade7ef5e0a5cde5c88ffc2
Closes-Bug: #1800657

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I33164e0e24e0c9384aae44f10e73f1f7b935c983
Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-21 16:56:32.000000000', 'message': 'Install packages into octavia-api image to support wsgi

This patch adds packages to the octavia-api container to support running
it under apache instead of under simple server. This resolves an issue
with haproxy as well as support IPv6.

Change-Id: I72e0a44f081747ebaec25fd5049db83ea6f418ff
Related-Bug: #1815811
(cherry picked from commit 2c75a2429b26eeabeb9d3f0b39a1fffd9cee00af)
'}]
commit_message:
Install packages into octavia-api image to support wsgi

This patch adds packages to the octavia-api container to support running
it under apache instead of under simple server. This resolves an issue
with haproxy as well as support IPv6.

Change-Id: I72e0a44f081747ebaec25fd5049db83ea6f418ff
Related-Bug: #1815811
(cherry picked from commit 2c75a2429b26eeabeb9d3f0b39a1fffd9cee00af)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 18:51:27.000000000', 'message': 'Use overlay2 in tools/setup_Redhat.sh

Currently CentOS gates use btrfs storage driver and
create /docker device backing btrfs.

This patch is to sync the gate run with Ubuntu.
(post-Trusty) does not use btrfs, only overlay2.

Change-Id: Ic5caa8cf0271b21f71f03fd33c35b3c7bc93ccf4
(cherry picked from commit c50df69045e361a3d1136471b147854684ab1e31)
'}]
commit_message:
Use overlay2 in tools/setup_Redhat.sh

Currently CentOS gates use btrfs storage driver and
create /docker device backing btrfs.

This patch is to sync the gate run with Ubuntu.
(post-Trusty) does not use btrfs, only overlay2.

Change-Id: Ic5caa8cf0271b21f71f03fd33c35b3c7bc93ccf4
(cherry picked from commit c50df69045e361a3d1136471b147854684ab1e31)

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Storage-assisted in-use retype support

PowerMax for Cinder driver now supports storage-assisted
in-use retype for volumes including those in replication
sessions.

Change-Id: If0d1262f0a400f1ab66615bead751591a9a969e9
Implements: blueprint powermax-storage-assisted-inuse-retype

subject: Remove duplicate target name from README
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-03-01 01:18:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-03-01 08:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThanks Sean'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 01:18:37.000000000', 'message': 'Remove duplicate target name from README

Duplicate targets in the README cause validation failures that would
cause pypi uploads to fail. This removes a defined target that
conflicted with one of the title implicit targets and was not referred
to.

Change-Id: Ife742651b68cd94d67d5af6f9d13d236c032e46e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove duplicate target name from README

Duplicate targets in the README cause validation failures that would
cause pypi uploads to fail. This removes a defined target that
conflicted with one of the title implicit targets and was not referred
to.

Change-Id: Ife742651b68cd94d67d5af6f9d13d236c032e46e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 14:45:36.000000000', 'message': 'Forwarding for br-vlan in aio does not persist

The ip forwarding for br-vlan does not persist after network service
restart.

The os-tempest-install.yml playbook fails, because it creates a test router
connected to public network which trigger a network service restart and
disable ip forwarding for br-vlan althrougt is it set manually with sysctl.

So the tempest tests which consists in connecting to cirros instance throught ssh from
the lxc utility container fail.

This modification correct it and set ip forwarding for br-vlan
persistant throught reboot.

Change-Id: I16d8fef93bf7a162357e607625119b649d80a65c
'}]
commit_message:
Forwarding for br-vlan in aio does not persist

The ip forwarding for br-vlan does not persist after network service
restart.

The os-tempest-install.yml playbook fails, because it creates a test router
connected to public network which trigger a network service restart and
disable ip forwarding for br-vlan althrougt is it set manually with sysctl.

So the tempest tests which consists in connecting to cirros instance throught ssh from
the lxc utility container fail.

This modification correct it and set ip forwarding for br-vlan
persistant throught reboot.

Change-Id: I16d8fef93bf7a162357e607625119b649d80a65c

commit_message:
Fix tls-proxy issues with the devstack plugin

Enabling tls-proxy allows devstack to
set up a tls proxy server that front-ends
interactions with the manila-api and
terminates tls connections.

Also enable tls-proxy in dummy and lvm
jobs. The dummy driver job is configured
to run the in-built wsgi server, the lvm
job is configured to use mod-wsgi.

Closes-Bug: #1816836
Change-Id: I48b0ccc082604d78242ba61bee94a45efeb2467b

commit_message:
[WIP] Fast Forward Upgrade spec

This spec describe fast-forward upgrade procedure with
Kolla-ansible for an offline upgrade which effectively
runs the upgrade processes for all versions of openstack
components from your originating version to your desired
version.

Change-Id: I5417db363885e7a20fa81df7aa61eb70ce63e058
Partially-Implements: blueprint fast-forward-upgrades-support

commit_message:
Use rand_password() for password when creating user

Some systems require strong passwords, so we'd better
use data_utils.rand_password() to create password when
creating user, to avoid password strength validation error.

Change-Id: I503ba6e068b6f7c8487b7077637ee21a9c104595

commit_message:
Add NetworkSubnetPools to tempest cleanup

The review adds support for NetworkSubnetPools service,
so if there are leftover subnet pools, tempest cleanup
is able to detect them and remove eventually.

Change-Id: Ieecde490d5eb20e1a894a7bdf3bcf0e7a54c08e2
Related-Bug: #1812660

commit_message:
Print the resource id instead of name

In Openstack, it is hard to find the failed reason with resources
name in logs, lots of logs information of resources are written with
resources id.

Change-Id: I543f0c7dd3d3168840d66b12afe1a121a73a1154

[{'created': '2019-02-27 15:54:11.000000000', 'message': 'Update tox and tests to work with modern setups

While trying to make some changes I discovered that the tox
configuration for osc-placement was rather out of date and
functional tests were not working for python3. With this
change we bring tox.ini into a style that is more in keeping
with modern standards, use stestr, and update some functional
tests so they work with python3.

The functional tests changes are either:

* to fix the decoding of response
* to adapt argparse error response checking between python
  version.

Change-Id: I999a3103dd85c0a437785766eef533875fca31fc
'}, {'created': '2019-02-27 16:38:42.000000000', 'message': "Update tox and tests to work with modern setups

While trying to make some changes I discovered that the tox
configuration for osc-placement was rather out of date and
functional tests were not working for python3. With this
change we bring tox.ini into a style that is more in keeping
with modern standards, use stestr, and update some functional
tests so they work with python3.

The functional tests changes are either:

* to fix the decoding of response
* to adapt argparse error response checking between python
  version.

These changes cascade some required change into how the gate-side
functional testing is performed. We make it explicit that in the
python2 job, the 'functional' tox job is run. When the python3
job is run, 'functional-py3' is run. Also stestr replaces
testr in the post-test hook

Finally, some requirements need to be tuned to pass the
requirements job.

Change-Id: I999a3103dd85c0a437785766eef533875fca31fc
"}, {'created': '2019-02-27 19:08:09.000000000', 'message': "Update tox and tests to work with modern setups

change we bring tox.ini into a style that is more in keeping
with modern standards, use stestr, and update some functional
tests so they work with python3.

The functional tests changes are either:

* to fix the decoding of response
* to adapt argparse error response checking between python
  version.

These changes cascade some required change into how the gate-side
functional testing is performed. We make it explicit that in the
python2 job, the 'functional' tox job is run. When the python3
job is run, 'functional-py3' is run. Also stestr replaces
testr in the post-test hook.

When the functional-py3 test had been run in the past it
was actually running a python2 osc-placement against a
python3 devstack. We change that here to be python3 and
python3. Once that was happening, additional failures
were revealed, now fixed.

One particular issue was that while the json module
for python 3.6 and greater will decode strings or bytes,
the version of 3.5 will only do strings. We switch
to using simplejson throughout which smooths things over.
This is added as a new requirement but it isn't really:
simplejson is required by osc-lib.

Finally, some requirements need to be tuned to pass the
gate requirements job.

Change-Id: I999a3103dd85c0a437785766eef533875fca31fc

commit_message:
Update tox and tests to work with modern setups

While trying to make some changes I discovered that the tox
configuration for osc-placement was rather out of date and
functional tests were not working for python3. With this
change we bring tox.ini into a style that is more in keeping
with modern standards, use stestr, and update some functional
tests so they work with python3.

The functional tests changes are either:

* to fix the decoding of response
* to adapt argparse error response checking between python
  version.

These changes cascade some required change into how the gate-side
functional testing is performed. We make it explicit that in the
python2 job, the 'functional' tox job is run. When the python3
job is run, 'functional-py3' is run. Also stestr replaces
testr in the post-test hook.

When the functional-py3 test had been run in the past it
was actually running a python2 osc-placement against a
python3 devstack. We change that here to be python3 and
python3. Once that was happening, additional failures
were revealed, now fixed.

One particular issue was that while the json module
for python 3.6 and greater will decode strings or bytes,
the version of 3.5 will only do strings. We switch
to using simplejson throughout which smooths things over.
This is added as a new requirement but it isn't really:
simplejson is required by osc-lib.

Finally, some requirements need to be tuned to pass the
gate requirements job.

Change-Id: I999a3103dd85c0a437785766eef533875fca31fc

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19604, 'date': '2019-02-15 04:27:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29209, 'date': '2019-02-15 05:25:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thanks for the patch! A few nits inside.
Also, I think this requires a release note :)'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2019-02-15 06:23:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thanks Ankit. LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-02-15 14:49:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19604, 'date': '2019-02-18 05:28:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 19604, 'date': '2019-02-18 05:29:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(5 comments)

Thanks Dmitry, Dhanuka for comments.
See my comments inline'}, {'account_id': 19604, 'date': '2019-02-18 09:51:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-02-18 10:04:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Thank you Ankit.'}, {'account_id': 19604, 'date': '2019-02-18 11:06:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 19604, 'date': '2019-02-18 11:06:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

Thanks Shiv for comments. Its fixed.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-18 14:46:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I'm a little worried by this patch and changing a base library to possibly be ilo centric, when we have no idea nor indication if it will work for other vendors, or if it just follows the standard precisely that it should be generic.

It may also be useful to have a release note."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-02-18 15:25:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

My concern here is that if we keep on adjusting the otherwise generic library to every possible vendor implementation, we grow sushy into a spaghetti monster.

As it sometimes happens with the monsters, it might eventually collapse under the weight of accumulated hacks once one hack runs into the other.

On the other hand, practicality bears purity...

Therefore, what if extend the pluggable OEM resource concept [1] onto standard resources so that every vendor could come up with their interpretation of the standard schema as a installable sushy extension package...?

This seems a bit less horrible than turning standard schemas into a mix of OEMs...

WDYT?

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/463829/'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-02-18 18:45:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I guess the key question is whether {} is the correct empty body or not. I don't have an opinion, we may bring it to DMTF."}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-02-18 22:34:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Sending empty JSON document seems more uniform to me than sending empty request body.

Quick look at the Redfish spec [1] does not reveal any obvious judgement.

1. http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP0266_1.5.0.html#actions-post'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-02-19 04:13:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

We had written to the iLO firmware team to check on the right syntax, but we haven't heard from them. Moreover DMTF json [1] indicates parameters for 'EjectMedia' as '{}'
[1] https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/VirtualMedia.v1_3_0.json"}, {'account_id': 19604, 'date': '2019-02-19 06:26:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 19604, 'date': '2019-02-19 06:52:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

Thanks Julia for comments. Its fixed'}, {'account_id': 19604, 'date': '2019-02-19 07:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@Julia.. I have tested this fix with HPE Proliant Gen10 servers. It works'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-02-25 08:47:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Few updates:-
1. iLO firmware team has confirmed that this implementation is based on Gen9 REST implementation.
2. This issue has been communicated to Redfish Forum and it would be discussed in their subsequent forum meeting. It seems there is a Redfish spec release is due in May'19 and it could carry clarification related to this."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-25 20:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-02-28 07:23:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(3 comments)

Thank you Ankit.'}, {'account_id': 19604, 'date': '2019-03-01 05:23:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

Thanks Shiv for comments. I have raised a follow-up 
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/640261/'}]

commit_message:
add python 3.7 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

subject: Add Adjutant as admin-logic
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10420, 'name': 'Adrian Turjak', 'email': 'devs+openstack@uncaught-exceptions.com', 'username': 'adriant'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-01-30 01:05:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-01-30 01:10:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Please don't just merge this! I'd like some discussion before we solidify this as the Adjutant service type.

Originally the service-type was 'registration' which is clearly no longer just the case, and I couldn't really think of anything appropriate.

Some options that I'd considered:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/744214/

In the end I went with 'operator-logic' because 'business-logic' doesn't sound right, and congress already uses 'operator-policy' which makes this sound like a better fit.

So... opinions? Once this is merged I'll go through and update the service and other libraries to match, but want someone else who knows what Adjutant (the service labelled misc) does, and if they agree with the type."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-30 01:30:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Brought up in IRC that congress uses "operator-policy", so I think this at has some logic behind it.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-01-30 02:08:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Some discussion was had in the TC 
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-tc/%23openstack-tc.2019-01-30.log.html#t2019-01-30T01:23:19

Best to read through it for context, but quick summary: This is an awful service to pick a type for, and all the terms are overloaded or with too many meanings so picking anything is like walking through a minefield.


"operator-automation" was put forward as another alternative that could potentially work.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-01-30 02:24:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

yeah, difficult to choose the best fit name.  *-automation or admin-* are something close fit. so 'operator-automation' also ok for me."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-01-30 07:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Not a fan of *-automation because I associate that with deployment tools, even if those will never have service types. I prefer *-management, I feel like this tool is all about giving APIs and buttons to things you have to manage as a cloud operator. account-management, operations-management (not operators-management), project-management, site-management, process-management, ... (tbh I quite like account-management)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-30 12:09:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Letting this stew some more, I actually like operator-automation. Since this exposes a way to perform things that otherwise an operator would need to do, but automates it for various needs. One of which is account management, but I think that is just one example of the various operations it can be used to automate. I think Zane said it well in IRC:

< zaneb> I think of it as automating some aspects of administration (particularly account management) that 
               would otherwise be done by hand (or I guess by some non-standard custom code)

So I'm kind of leaning towards {admin|administration}-automation or operations-automation, with a preference for the latter."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-01-30 23:26:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

My main point against 'account-management' is that it makes me think of:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Account_manager


We also have 1 point against automation (I agree that it makes me also think of deployment tools a bit), while 2 are for. 

Like I said, minefield of terms that everyone has some opinion/view on. :(

Zane probably put it best with:
<zaneb>: as fun as this discussion is, I think the real answer is that it doesn't actually matter all that much


So right now, since no one has stated too many major issues with 'operator-logic' I'm inclined to stick with it at least for now."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-05 16:45:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I'm okay with operator-logic as operator-automation (except that it sounds like a system to automate operators). operations-automation is a mouthful. operations-management or operator-management feel overly huge.

As others have said it doesn't matter _that_ much, as long as it sticks around. The rules in http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/service-types-authority/tree/README.rst may help with some additional suggestions.

+1 for now to signal it's okay, but seems like there more room to talk

logic-gap-filling-management"}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-02-07 06:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-02-19 15:31:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'm not a fan of "operator", because I consider operators to be more deployers/installers/low-level hardware infrastructure managers whereas I consider the target of Adjutant to be the administrator, not the operator.

In fact, the first sentence in the Adjutant docs accurately describe the project itself:

"A basic workflow framework built using Django and Django-Rest-Framework to help automate Admin tasks within an OpenStack cluster."

Given the above, I'd recommend: "admin-workflow"

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:10:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:25:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

naming is hard. disagreeing with Monty? totes easy.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:26:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Pulling the +2 - on second reading - I think I like jay's suggestion better."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:27:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

For clarity sake - I most like the 'admin' part. I would be fine with either admin-logic or admin-workflow."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:37:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

admin-management?'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-02-28 21:21:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I can live with 'admin-logic'. 

Honestly I don't care too much what we end up with, I just want one chosen and merged so I can get on with it. 

No on anything with 'workflow' in it though, because lets not step on Mistrals toes, and overload a term that in reality is internal system stuff to Adjutant."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-03-01 01:17:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-03-01 01:18:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-03-01 01:25:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Works for me.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-01 04:02:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

This seems to be where the dust settled.'}]

commit_message:
Add Adjutant as admin-logic

Rather than business-logic, because it may not exactly
be used by a business, and avoiding the word 'workflow'.

Story: 2004498

Change-Id: Ie565e06f48980d49a1527949ad55088fc506c48d

commit_message:
Fix bug in scenario validation

Without inheriting default meta from parent class, OpenStack scenarios do not use `args_spec`
validator https://github.com/openstack/rally/blob/1.4.0/rally/task/scenario.py#L85
which is critical for checking input task config. This commit changes that behaviour.

Also, this patch fixes broken samples for one of barbocan scenarios

Change-Id: I281d361577135377654bde3ae60c3ebd355e3561

commit_message:
[k8s-fedora-atomic] Use ClusterIP for prometheus service

The NodePort type service, by design, bypasses almost all network
security in Kubernetes, so is not recommended to be used in the cloud
enviroment.

This patch changes the prometheus service type from NodePort to ClusterIP.

Story: #2005098
Task: #29712

Change-Id: Ic47a334bcf81afb87a78a5e66db1a988b473a47e

commit_message:
Enable the tempest role ping test for AIO testing

In order to verify that the tempest host is able to ping
the external network, we enable the ping test implemented
in the os_tempest role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/639728
Change-Id: I7432648fc3b8104e2232232122d7451a3d8b884c

Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 7102, 'name': 'Thomas Bechtold', 'email': 'thomas.bechtold@canonical.com', 'username': 'toabctl'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27900, 'name': 'Artem Goncharov', 'email': 'artem.goncharov@gmail.com', 'username': 'gtema'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-09-25 11:24:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-09-25 11:54:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Honestly my first instinct is to say that I'd rather this not live in keystoneauth, we should try to keep keystoneauth's scope slim. Anytime `import threading` is involved the chance of bugs increases and the testability decreases. This can be done in a wrapper, and moreover I'm guessing there's more than one way this could be implemented in a wrapper, so I'd rather leave it up to the user.

It's not a hard no from me but that's my initial feeling."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-10-16 12:52:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Colleen: yeah, I was a little on the fence about it myself - but, dtantsur just pushed up a patch to sdk to allow the use of the ksa retriable_status_code feature. That made me want to circle back around to this - because if we're going to have client-side rate limiting, and we're going to have retriable_status_code, then I think both need to live in the same place. Otherwise we'd have ksa doing retries under the covers and a higher level rate limiting would be unaware of the additional calls."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-10-16 13:05:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-25 11:24:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for client-side rate limiting

shade/openstacksdk has implemented client-side rate limiting on top of
keystoneauth for ages and uses it extensively in nodepool. As part of an
effort to refactor that code a new approach was devised which was much
simpler and therfore suitable for inclusion in keystoneauth directly.

The underlying goal is two-fold, but fundamentally is about allowing a
user to add some settings so that they can avoid slamming their cloud.
First, allow a user to express that they never want to exceed a given
rate. Second, allow a user to limit the number of concurrent requests
allowed to be in flight.

The settings and logic are added to Adapter and not Session so that the
settings can easily be per-service. There is no need to block requests
to nova on a neutron rate limit, after all.

Change-Id: Ic831e03a37d804f45b7ee58c87f92fa0f4411ad8
'}, {'created': '2018-10-19 14:15:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for client-side rate limiting

commit_message:
Add support for client-side rate limiting

shade/openstacksdk has implemented client-side rate limiting on top of
keystoneauth for ages and uses it extensively in nodepool. As part of an
effort to refactor that code a new approach was devised which was much
simpler and therfore suitable for inclusion in keystoneauth directly.

The underlying goal is two-fold, but fundamentally is about allowing a
user to add some settings so that they can avoid slamming their cloud.
First, allow a user to express that they never want to exceed a given
rate. Second, allow a user to limit the number of concurrent requests
allowed to be in flight.

The settings and logic are added to Adapter and not Session so that the
settings can easily be per-service. There is no need to block requests
to nova on a neutron rate limit, after all.

Co-Authored-By: Ian Wienand <iwienand@redhat.com>
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/604926
Change-Id: Ic831e03a37d804f45b7ee58c87f92fa0f4411ad8

commit_message:
step5: flatten the neutron service configurations

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration
for the neutron-sriov-agent, neutron-plugin-nsx, and neutron-sfc-api
services.

Change-Id: I3403575928df245798468b2d17f4a620bbf209e5
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and the others use it in many place,
this PS to update the json moudule to oslo jsonutils for consistency.

subject: stop using common db mixin
messages: [{'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2019-02-07 18:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2019-02-07 18:45:07.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from use-lib-rpc to bp/neutronlib-decouple-db'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2019-02-11 16:22:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2019-02-20 22:08:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-02-28 06:27:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19350, 'date': '2019-03-01 00:04:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19350, 'date': '2019-03-01 00:04:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 18:44:39.000000000', 'message': "stop using common db mixin methods

All of the methods of common db mixin are available via neutron-lib
and the mixin will be removed before long.
This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's APIs rather
than those of the mixin.

Change-Id: I1e9790e47c0befebc6f0073098694440dbc62873
"}, {'created': '2019-02-11 16:22:39.000000000', 'message': "stop using common db mixin

All of the methods of common db mixin are available via neutron-lib
and the mixin will be removed before long.
This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's APIs rather
than those of the mixin and stops using the mixin as a parent class.

Change-Id: I1e9790e47c0befebc6f0073098694440dbc62873
"}, {'created': '2019-02-20 22:08:52.000000000', 'message': "stop using common db mixin

All of the methods of common db mixin are available via neutron-lib
and the mixin will be removed before long.
This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's APIs rather
than those of the mixin and stops using the mixin as a parent class.

Change-Id: I1e9790e47c0befebc6f0073098694440dbc62873
"}]
commit_message:
stop using common db mixin

All of the methods of common db mixin are available via neutron-lib
and the mixin will be removed before long.
This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's APIs rather
than those of the mixin and stops using the mixin as a parent class.

Change-Id: I1e9790e47c0befebc6f0073098694440dbc62873

subject: Remove possible existing packages in deployment test
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 09:52:57.000000000', 'message': 'Remove possible existing packages in deployment test

In scenario test, test packages will be uploaded and then deleted after test
executed. But in case of the packages deletion failure, it will block the
following tests.

This patch checks and removes those test packages before uploading them.

Change-Id: I90c5d903d8c5c3eeface2735bba61d01a877aaf8
'}]
commit_message:
Remove possible existing packages in deployment test

In scenario test, test packages will be uploaded and then deleted after test
executed. But in case of the packages deletion failure, it will block the
following tests.

This patch checks and removes those test packages before uploading them.

Change-Id: I90c5d903d8c5c3eeface2735bba61d01a877aaf8

commit_message:
[CI] Run integration tests with tls-proxy

tls-proxy was disabled because of a bug
with manila's devstack plugin. Remove the
override.

Change-Id: I3ddad74ee336ca5aa7e7ca4720256d5e6de35bd9
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/638320/
Related-Bug: #1816836
Closes-Bug: #1815973

commit_message:
Enable nova VNC configuration on the subnode

The n-novnc service only runs on the controller node, however novnc
settings must be enabled on both nodes for vnc to work, since both
hosts are compute hosts.

Change-Id: Icc29441f507e6e4df9fd900eb7f35b0862f52043
(cherry picked from commit 05da9a9b1e86babe829c1c2349fa7e9838095ee8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 23:32:05.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for microversion 2.69

This adds support for microversion 2.69 which exposes
the 'tag' field in the following APIs:

* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments/{volume_id}
* POST /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-interface
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-interface/{port_id}
* POST /servers/{server_id}/os-interface

Which corresponds to showing the tag in the output of
the following commands:

* nova volume-attachments
* nova volume-attach
* nova interface-list

Note that the "nova interface-attach" command does not
produce output so there is nothing to update for that here
but a unit test is added anyway to assert that behavior.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/631948/

Part of blueprint expose-virtual-device-tags-in-rest-api

Change-Id: I5e9d7e0219605503a56d2cf745b95c6e05d01101

commit_message:
Add support for microversion 2.70 - expose device tags

This adds support for microversion 2.70 which exposes
the 'tag' field in the following APIs:

* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments/{volume_id}
* POST /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-interface
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-interface/{port_id}
* POST /servers/{server_id}/os-interface

Which corresponds to showing the tag in the output of
the following commands:

* nova volume-attachments
* nova volume-attach
* nova interface-list
* nova interface-attach

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/631948/

Part of blueprint expose-virtual-device-tags-in-rest-api

Change-Id: I5e9d7e0219605503a56d2cf745b95c6e05d01101

commit_message:
flatten database service MySQL Server

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration.

With this patch the baremetal version of database service MySQL Server
has been removed.

Change-Id: I407bd8d8fe9bde53609e4316b12eb0b7151552ca
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

subject: generator: Convert sphinx-isms in opt help text
messages:
[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-16 22:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-07-17 13:55:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

We're going to need documentation for this but it looks pretty good otherwise. I do wonder, however, if we should actually reverse the order of this and convert ``[group] opt`` to :oslo.config:option: in HTML documentation. That would require less changes to a project like nova, at least"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-17 14:43:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> We're going to need documentation for this

Other than the help text in the opts? Where do those docs live?

> I do wonder, however, if we should actually reverse the order of this and convert ``[group] opt`` to :oslo.config:option: in HTML documentation.

Problems with that:
- There's no consistency of format today in help text ([group] opt, [group]/opt, [group]opt, group.opt, all of the above with various backticks...) and we don't want to get into regex craziness trying to identify all of them.
- There's no guarantee that a [group]/opt string is referring to an option that's in *this* project's config reference.  For instance, vif_plugging_timeout [1] refers to [agent]/root_helper_daemon, which is a *neutron* config option.
- It's backwards from the way we're trying to do everything else, which is to use rst-isms in the help strings.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/configuration/config.html#DEFAULT.vif_plugging_timeout"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-17 16:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-17 17:38:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> > We're going to need documentation for this
> Other than the help text in the opts? Where do those docs live?

I found an rst and updated it. Is that it?"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-17 17:38:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-08 10:30:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I've been putting off making a decision on this for a while. The truth of the matter is that I just don't like this idea. I get the problem we're trying to solve here but it just feels too hacky for its own good. I'd much rather we recycled something like Sphinx's TextBuilder [1] to do this as there are definitely more Sphinx-isms we might want to be stripping out. I'm not -2 as I'm more than willing to be overruled but I can't be +2. Sorry :(

[1] http://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/builders/#sphinx.builders.text.TextBuilder"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-12-12 15:59:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I've been putting off making a decision on this for a while. The
 > truth of the matter is that I just don't like this idea. I get the
 > problem we're trying to solve here but it just feels too hacky for
 > its own good. I'd much rather we recycled something like Sphinx's
 > TextBuilder [1] to do this as there are definitely more Sphinx-isms
 > we might want to be stripping out. I'm not -2 as I'm more than
 > willing to be overruled but I can't be +2. Sorry :(
 > 
 > [1] http://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/builders/#sphinx.builders.text.TextBuilder

I put my money where my mouth is and wrote something

  https://github.com/stephenfin/rst2txt

Personally, I'd like to run the text through that before emitting it to the INI files, meaning people could go and edit their help texts without need for fragile regexes, which seem like less work but also see way too likely to break, IMO.

Agree/disagree?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-12-12 16:53:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > I've been putting off making a decision on this for a while. The
 > > truth of the matter is that I just don't like this idea. I get
 > the
 > > problem we're trying to solve here but it just feels too hacky
 > for
 > > its own good. I'd much rather we recycled something like Sphinx's
 > > TextBuilder [1] to do this as there are definitely more
 > Sphinx-isms
 > > we might want to be stripping out. I'm not -2 as I'm more than
 > > willing to be overruled but I can't be +2. Sorry :(
 > >
 > > [1] http://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/builders/#sphinx.builders.text.TextBuilder
 > 
 > I put my money where my mouth is and wrote something
 > 
 > https://github.com/stephenfin/rst2txt
 > 
 > Personally, I'd like to run the text through that before emitting
 > it to the INI files, meaning people could go and edit their help
 > texts without need for fragile regexes, which seem like less work
 > but also see way too likely to break, IMO.
 > 
 > Agree/disagree?

I'm not sure I'm ready to have oslo.config depend on pygments. Is there a way to do this without introducing that into the dependency chain?"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-12-12 19:05:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > > I've been putting off making a decision on this for a while.
 > The
 > > > truth of the matter is that I just don't like this idea. I get
 > > the
 > > > problem we're trying to solve here but it just feels too hacky
 > > for
 > > > its own good. I'd much rather we recycled something like
 > Sphinx's
 > > > TextBuilder [1] to do this as there are definitely more
 > > Sphinx-isms
 > > > we might want to be stripping out. I'm not -2 as I'm more than
 > > > willing to be overruled but I can't be +2. Sorry :(
 > > >
 > > > [1] http://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/builders/#sphinx.builders.text.TextBuilder
 > >
 > > I put my money where my mouth is and wrote something
 > >
 > > https://github.com/stephenfin/rst2txt
 > >
 > > Personally, I'd like to run the text through that before emitting
 > > it to the INI files, meaning people could go and edit their help
 > > texts without need for fragile regexes, which seem like less work
 > > but also see way too likely to break, IMO.
 > >
 > > Agree/disagree?
 > 
 > I'm not sure I'm ready to have oslo.config depend on pygments. Is
 > there a way to do this without introducing that into the dependency
 > chain?

Ah, I was going to say we already include Sphinx (which includes pygments) but that's optional.

I did try to override the few directives to allow rst2txt to work without pygments but couldn't get it working. I could give it another go"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-11 20:18:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Would this idea have more support if we just decided on a conversion (e.g. [group]option and [group]) and got rid of the configurability? Or is it the source regex that's bugging you, because it's lexing differently than sphinx does?

Basically, without something in place, developers will be hesitant to use the group/option roles in config opt helps because it renders ugly in the text. If writing a whole new library and setting up the dependencies on it is really a relatively easy thing, I can get behind it. But otherwise IMO the benefit to be gained by enabling this hack is worth it on this small scale."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-02-11 22:10:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

I don't have any issue with the simpler implementation, per se. One question inline."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-11 23:32:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:13:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I tried to do this with rst2txt in [1]. It seems like a more complete solution but it does come with its own disadvantages, noted in the commit message. Fancy weighing in on that before we decide which direction to go in?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/640057'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-28 23:18:28.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I like where Stephen's solution [1] is going.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/640057"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 22:41:57.000000000', 'message': "generator: Convert sphinx-isms in opt help text

Prior to this change, sphinx directives :oslo.config:option:`group.name`
or :oslo.config:group:`group`, when included in ConfigOpts help text,
would render as helpful links in HTML output, but would appear unchanged
in generated config file output, which is arguably undesirable.

This change adds two new conf options to the generator,
sphinx_option_replacement and sphinx_group_replacement. These may be set
to a replacement string (à la re.sub()) using backreferences \g<group>
and \g<name> for the former and just \g<group> for the latter. For
example, the default values:

sphinx_option_replacement = r'[\g<group>]/\g<name>'
sphinx_group_replacement = r'[\g<group>]'

...will cause help text such as:

 The libvirt driver can be configured by setting

commit_message:
generator: Convert sphinx-isms in opt help text

Prior to this change, sphinx directives :oslo.config:option:`group.name`
or :oslo.config:group:`group`, when included in ConfigOpts help text,
would render as helpful links in HTML output, but would appear unchanged
in generated config file output, which is arguably undesirable.

This change adds two new conf options to the generator,
sphinx_option_replacement and sphinx_group_replacement. These may be set
to a replacement string (à la re.sub()) using backreferences \g<group>
and \g<name> for the former and just \g<group> for the latter. For
example, the default values:

sphinx_option_replacement = r'[\g<group>]/\g<name>'
sphinx_group_replacement = r'[\g<group>]'

...will cause help text such as:

 The libvirt driver can be configured by setting
 :oslo.config:option:`compute.compute_driver` to ``libvirt``. See the
 options in the :oslo.config:group:`libvirt` section for more.

...to render as:

 # The libvirt driver can be configured by setting
 # [compute]/compute_driver to ``libvirt``. See the options in the
 # [libvirt] section for more.

...in the config sample.

Change-Id: I7450ad4756c266e217b7017f78ef13cb1b830847

We do not have a maintainer at the moment for SELinux and hopefully
we will adopt the upstream openstack-selinux package, but for now
in order to let deploys in environments where SELinux is set to
permissive work, we'll have to remove these bits.

This change can be reverted whenever we have a maintainer that's

(cherry picked from commit 1c222d60b35189db90506554a80f24d881451c37)

commit_message:
Drop SELinux support for CentOS 7

We do not have a maintainer at the moment for SELinux and hopefully
we will adopt the upstream openstack-selinux package, but for now
in order to let deploys in environments where SELinux is set to
permissive work, we'll have to remove these bits.

This change can be reverted whenever we have a maintainer that's
available to do the work required.

Change-Id: I968937bcc7730faf75750971f8c72b0ea037cbd9
(cherry picked from commit 1c222d60b35189db90506554a80f24d881451c37)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonçalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 6579, 'name': 'Nir Magnezi', 'email': 'nmagnezi@redhat.com', 'username': 'nmagnezi'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 16688, 'name': 'Rodolfo Alonso', 'email': 'ralonsoh@redhat.com', 'username': 'rodolfo-alonso-hernandez'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-11-09 04:25:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-11-09 04:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-11-09 10:44:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-11-11 22:15:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

What is the reason to revert this change?'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-11-11 23:52:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

As commented in [1], I see no reasons for this revert.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-midonet/+bug/1802438/comments/2'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-11-20 14:06:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Rodolfo, i explained in the bug. please take a look.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-11-21 12:31:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Rodolfo, i explained in the bug. please take a look.

Replied in the bug. These calls you are referring in the bug are done by midonet. The pool creation request is built by midonet service, this is not the output of lbaas client.'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-12-25 06:30:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Rodolfo,

yes, it's between networking-midonet and midonet.
but the payload in the question was generated from the object given to the driver, which has been altered by this change. this revert restores it."}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-02-07 07:40:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck to see if it still works'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-02-07 07:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Rodolfo,

are you still against the revert?
if so, can you explain why?'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-02-07 10:04:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hello Yamamoto:

Yes, I'm still against the revert. This patch was pushed on top of this one [1] in order to solve some problems with the testing CI. That means because the mentioned patch is also merged, you also need to remove it.

[1] was an effort to improve the database access and reduce the time expended during CRUD operations. This patch removes some relations between objects and the need of reading dependent objects during the load of OVO.

Talking about the problem you pointed out in the bug, as you can see in your own trace, now the listener information is loaded in "listeners" field. As you can see, this list contains the ID of the dependent listeners:

"listeners": [{"id": "ebbc4509-36d6-43d0-8a23-56c80850c712"}]

You can use this value for you operations, retrieving first the listener object if you need it.

I know this is a change in the API and this kind of modifications should be done carefully. Please contact lbaas cores to ask for more information.

About pushing the patch to stable versions, this is because of a problem we had in a LTS support version; because of that we cherry-pick this patch through the still maintained versions and the we did the same in our repositories.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-02-19 09:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Rodolfo,

so, you are basically saying "my problem is more important than midonet"?
i can totally understand it. i can even agree with it. :-)

maybe i'll give up and consider having some workaround in midonet side.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-02-19 11:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> Rodolfo,
 > 
 > so, you are basically saying "my problem is more important than
 > midonet"?
 > i can totally understand it. i can even agree with it. :-)
 > 
 > maybe i'll give up and consider having some workaround in midonet
 > side.

I didn't say this and I'll never say this. No one's problem is more important than other people problem. Please, first of all, contact lbaas core reviewers.

As I said, this patch was a small part of a big refactor to improve (dramatically) the DB speed access. So the benefit is evident. I know this patch changes the API and I'm sorry for that because is breaking your implementation. As I commented, the value needed (the pool listeners) is still stored in the object returned, but in other field.

Please, contact lbaas core reviewers for more explanations.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-02-20 21:42:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I can see how this change could break the interface to the drivers by not updating the proper fields on pool objects for return.
As this code is deprecated and should not be making any functional changes, I support the revert.'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-02-21 04:55:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Rodolfo,

i don't doubt that the change in question has a benefit.
otoh, i believe you agree that maintaining api compatibility has a benefit. (especially on stable branches)
so i thought you just meant you preferred one over the other.
sorry if it was my misunderstanding.

can you tell me what "some problems with the testing CI" were?
the CI doesn't seem complaining on this revert.
do you mean, if we revert this change, other changes should be reverted together?'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-02-26 15:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Rodolfo,
 > 
 > i don't doubt that the change in question has a benefit.
 > otoh, i believe you agree that maintaining api compatibility has a
 > benefit. (especially on stable branches)
 > so i thought you just meant you preferred one over the other.
 > sorry if it was my misunderstanding.
 > 
 > can you tell me what "some problems with the testing CI" were?
 > the CI doesn't seem complaining on this revert.
 > do you mean, if we revert this change, other changes should be
 > reverted together?

The problems in the CI were in previous stable branches (Q if I remember correctly) when trying to implement the speedup improvements. I submitted this one following the submission path: master and then cherry-pick to stable ones.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-02-28 19:29:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

We just deployed Rocky and lbaas does not function without first reverting this patch.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-02-28 21:13:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Support ports belonging to Neutron DHCP agents (ii)

This patch is fixing a bug from [0] when there were
network:dhcp owner ports belonging to Neutron DHCP agents.
In this case, metadata port was not being created and
instances were not able to reach the service.

[0] ecef7c27c15a875f4b48440ea7c212984db88b62
Related-Bug: #1804390
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I26edf7ba8f66d39f0c1e6f4fa60ed81cb243c6a3

commit_message:
Add wrapper for Confluent Kafka client consumer

This change provides a wrapper around a high-level Kafka consumer which
can be used in all Monasca components, in particular in
monasca-persister and monasca-notification.

Story: 2003705
Task: 29711
Change-Id: Iee317c3016f9868616022389209e36994cf185cf

commit_message:
PowerMax driver - solve issue of concurrent snapvx operations

Stricter locking is required around snapvx operations on the same source
volume to prevent concurrency issues, most notibly around the
'create_cloned_volume' api and the use of snapvx generations.

Change-Id: Ia509adedfa937b7770de8a9a603d4aac0dce71e7
Closes-Bug: #1812231

commit_message:
Support cephfs_volume_mode parameter

manila now [1] supports configuring an octal value for the
rwx permissions mode of the cephfs volumes and snapshots
and groups of these that back manila shares, snapshots,
and groups.

Expose this parameter in the backend manifests for manila
with cephfs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614332

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639417/
Change-Id: I0e3f841523dc0cc213100296bc352ac88eb1ff74
(cherry picked from commit 127dbb4e815b26fcfc32fbf2a498380dcb010e8a)

file that performs the docker service installation and configuration
for the neutron-lbaas-api, neutron-plugin-ml2-ansible,

We added retries to the functest client ages ago, but object PUTs were
skipped because they used slightly different machinery.

We added retires to PUT later in the related change, but it added it's
own slightly different retry machinery.

Although neither is perfect (e.g. no exponential backoff) - this change
moves them closer together, so that future improvements can help both.

Change-Id: If65dbc6e524b6ba83b27f5697cae0927a3891320
"}]
commit_message:
Consolidate retry code in functest client

We added retries to the functest client ages ago, but object PUTs were
skipped because they used slightly different machinery.

We added retires to PUT later in the related change, but it added it's
own slightly different retry machinery.

Although neither is perfect (e.g. no exponential backoff) - this change
moves them closer together, so that future improvements can help both.

Related-Change-Id: I90a319943e948ac7df86cb29046f711adbb2fe20

Change-Id: If65dbc6e524b6ba83b27f5697cae0927a3891320

These nova.conf config were added while rocky was being added and
so didnt make it into the rocky nova.conf (since the template didnt
exist when the patches were started).

commit_message:
Use transport_url for Queens or later

Add a new template for Queens based on the Mitaka template.

Switch Queens and Rocky templates to use parts from openstack layer
for [DEFAULT]transport_url and remaining [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
HA and SSL configuration options.

Note that this service differs from others in that it did not
adopt standard oslo.messaging configuration sections until
Queens.

Change-Id: I988ef92bce127f075d062009d5f1ab43cf7cf4d0
Closes-Bug: 1817672

commit_message:
Standardize os_tempest playbook and set vars dynamically

os_tempest role is now integrated with standalone job but the
problem is that we need to define lots of os_tempest vars, it
makes harder for end user to run the os_tempest playbook.
Moving the vars using set_fact and generating it dynamically
helps to reuse the same playbook in another playbook for
running tempest using os_tempest.

It also adds the default tests we want to run.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/794

Change-Id: If1d87bd122291c839dd2376dff3ac37d7784d5a3

Instead of mocking objects and restoring the original value at the
end of the test, this patch uses the mock context.

The original implementation is prone to errors. If the test doesn't
finish correctly, the original object is never restored. However inside

commit_message:
Use mock context in test_fwaas

Instead of mocking objects and restoring the original value at the
end of the test, this patch uses the mock context.

The original implementation is prone to errors. If the test doesn't
finish correctly, the original object is never restored. However inside
a mock context, if the test exits prematurely, the original object is
restored.

Change-Id: Ia333230b906470e27da326b7365049f79b7dcf6a

[{'created': '2019-02-22 02:28:59.000000000', 'message': 'Remove broken conditions when including playbooks

The conditions in our setup playbooks have been broken for a long time
however they've not caused any issues because they're not deprecated
because the use of "When" with playbook includes is simply ignored.
This change removes the conditions which cleans up our setup playbooks.
The conditions to exit or execute a given playbook has been moved into
the playbook. If the condition is not met then the meta tag is used
to exit the playbook and continue.

commit_message:
Remove broken conditions when including playbooks

The conditions in our setup playbooks have been broken for a long time
however they've not caused any issues because they're not deprecated
because the use of "When" with playbook includes is simply ignored.
This change removes the conditions which cleans up our setup playbooks.
The conditions to exit or execute a given playbook has been moved into
the playbook. If the condition is not met then the meta tag is used
to exit the playbook and continue.

Change-Id: I4e1c2eb1ebb0dfb01e5c98e0fd13272943e9a97c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

[{'created': '2019-02-22 01:09:19.000000000', 'message': 'Convert include to either import_playbook or include_tasks

This change resolves the deprecation warnings for the use of "include"
which has been removed upstream. Playbooks will now use "import_playbook"
and tasks will now use "include_tasks". While this change attempts to
resolve all of the include issues several playbooks will need to be
refactored to resolve the use of include with variables as this is not
a pattern that is supported by mainline ansible.

Change-Id: I8fdb2f9f75f38986ba1dc9f93e274749c49e5c67

commit_message:
Convert include to either import_playbook or include_tasks

This change resolves the deprecation warnings for the use of "include"
which has been removed upstream. Playbooks will now use "import_playbook"
and tasks will now use "include_tasks". While this change attempts to
resolve all of the include issues several playbooks will need to be
refactored to resolve the use of include with variables as this is not
a pattern that is supported by mainline ansible.

Change-Id: I8fdb2f9f75f38986ba1dc9f93e274749c49e5c67
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Use publish-to-pypi for instack-undercloud

Jobs were duplicated as part of the process to deprecate master,
but we need the template to be used in order to do releases for
stable branches. Adding the template back is OK now that master
is closed for changes anyway.

Change-Id: Ibec07dfc1131ff6b8fd2670c8ebf0b9f36f28a33

commit_message:
JSON ingester experimental feature flag

Add an experimental feature flag to make sure the experimental
JSON ingester code do not affect normal Congress operations
unless BOTH the experimental flag is set in congress config
AND the JSON ingester YAML config files are present.

Change-Id: I8e3822461fa41e62511b485b807a0df27981609d
partially-implements: bp json-data-model

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 14:56:36.000000000', 'message': 'Change LibvirtDriver.capabilities to an instance variable

Since at least one libvirt capability is already dynamic due to
depending on support being present in QEMU and libvirt, change the
LibvirtDriver.capabilities dictionary from a class variable to an
instance variable.  This prevents the risk of one test setting a
capability which bleeds over into other tests, in the same way it was
already done in the PowerVM driver:

    https://github.com/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/cc7564549a90a59f2ef27cca14862c33b9a07c25

Change-Id: Ic4c16b23834b43a258be5073e32bcdb9c0421f02
'}, {'created': '2019-02-26 22:45:37.000000000', 'message': 'Change LibvirtDriver.capabilities to an instance variable

Since at least one libvirt capability is already dynamic due to
depending on support being present in QEMU and libvirt, change the
LibvirtDriver.capabilities dictionary from a class variable to an
instance variable.  This prevents the risk of one test setting a
capability which bleeds over into other tests, in the same way it was
already done in the PowerVM driver:

    https://github.com/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/cc7564549a90a59f2ef27cca14862c33b9a07c25

Change-Id: Ic4c16b23834b43a258be5073e32bcdb9c0421f02
'}]
commit_message:
Change LibvirtDriver.capabilities to an instance variable

Since at least one libvirt capability is already dynamic due to
depending on support being present in QEMU and libvirt, change the
LibvirtDriver.capabilities dictionary from a class variable to an
instance variable.  This prevents the risk of one test setting a
capability which bleeds over into other tests, in the same way it was
already done in the PowerVM driver:

    https://github.com/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/cc7564549a90a59f2ef27cca14862c33b9a07c25

Change-Id: Ic4c16b23834b43a258be5073e32bcdb9c0421f02

commit_message:
Deprecates [processing]store_data_location

Since the introspection data could be retrieved from inspector API,
there is no need to keep an extra link in ironic. This also keeps
inspector's behavior consistent by doing so.

Change-Id: Ib667afc4f16551b195641888831df7b681217184
Story: 1726713
Task: 11373

commit_message:
Do state report after setting start_flag on OVS restart

This fixes race condition leading to lack of fdb entries
on agent after OVS restart, if agent managed to handle all ports
before sending state report with start_flag set to True.

Change-Id: I943f8d805630cdfbefff9cff1fb4bce89210618b
Closes-Bug: #1808136
(cherry picked from commit 3995abefb16181594181133b271cdf35fa8d9937)

commit_message:
Updated "create_pool" method in plugin

Once the pool object is created in the DB and the listeners
are updated with the pool information, the updated listeners
are retrieved and populated into the pool object.

The DB method to create the pool now flushes the context to
retrieve an updated pool DB object at the end of the method,
instead of retrieving again the same object from the DB.

Removed "cls.port" member in test.tempest.v2.api.base.BaseTestCase
class. "cls.port" is not used in tests.

This is needed to make solve the Queens backport of
I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e.

Story: 2001962

Change-Id: Icf43952f6e5c5004a5c4d8d541b6efcb5d3ec50c
(cherry picked from commit c672b0d5675e3723df76f4943d9f3e5e7d63fb88)

commit_message:
Updated "create_pool" method in plugin

Once the pool object is created in the DB and the listeners
are updated with the pool information, the updated listeners
are retrieved and populated into the pool object.

The DB method to create the pool now flushes the context to
retrieve an updated pool DB object at the end of the method,
instead of retrieving again the same object from the DB.

This is needed to make solve the Queens backport of
I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e.

Story: 2001962

Change-Id: Icf43952f6e5c5004a5c4d8d541b6efcb5d3ec50c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-21 22:30:21.000000000', 'message': 'Move ipa enrollment to host_prep_tasks

This addresses a possible bug when using FreeIPA to do TLS
everywhere.

It is possible that the IPA server is not on the ctlplane.
In this case, when the nodes start up, the registration of the node
with IPA will fail, resulting in failed certificate issuance requests
later on.

We introduce a composable service to run in host_prep_tasks.
This will always run once the networks have been set up.  If the
instance has already been enrolled (by cloud-init or in an update),
then the script executed by the service will just exit.

In this iteration, we simply execute the code that the cloud-init
would have done.  In later releases, we will execute all the code
performed by novajoin-server here in ansible - and deprecate the
novajoin server.

Change-Id: I31f64c3cbd1d151e3c2a436cc3e2ec5316535087
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Resolves: rhbz#1661635
Closes-Bug: #1815924

commit_message:
Move ipa enrollment to host_prep_tasks

This addresses a possible bug when using FreeIPA to do TLS
everywhere.

It is possible that the IPA server is not on the ctlplane.
In this case, when the nodes start up, the registration of the node
with IPA will fail, resulting in failed certificate issuance requests
later on.

We introduce a composable service to run in host_prep_tasks.
This will always run once the networks have been set up.  If the
instance has already been enrolled (by cloud-init or in an update),
then the script executed by the service will just exit.

In this iteration, we simply execute the code that the cloud-init
would have done.  In later releases, we will execute all the code
performed by novajoin-server here in ansible - and deprecate the
novajoin server.

Change-Id: I31f64c3cbd1d151e3c2a436cc3e2ec5316535087
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Resolves: rhbz#1661635
Closes-Bug: #1815924
(cherry-picked from commit 19373b0efb71a9f39a8a9f21d656a8aa23efd0f5)

commit_message:
Remove the rokcy services from queens ComputeOvsDpdkSriov role

Services BootParams, MetricsQdr and NovaLibvirtGuests are introduced
in rokcy. During the backport to queens, it has been added to
ComputeOvsDpdkSriov roles. Removed these services.
Closes-Bug: #1817818

Change-Id: I219cd5fb6e95ac57d481ef3c6cb6970375ac4c3b

commit_message:
Support cephfs_volume_mode parameter

manila now [1] supports configuring an octal value for the
rwx permissions mode of the cephfs volumes and snapshots
and groups of these that back manila shares, snapshots,
and groups.

Expose this parameter in the backend manifests for manila
with cephfs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614332

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639327
Change-Id: Id8cbdfeff8299ff08a84c1c5902fb909353d4678
(cherry picked from commit 32827b39c1c68018d561ceb0c69e696f9b5c13cd)

commit_message:
Add tests for project users interacting with services

This commit introduces some tests that show how project users
are expected to behave with the services API. A subsequent patch
will clean up the new obsolete policies in the
policy.v3cloudsample.json file.

Change-Id: Ib05e5bf96c992aa498d3812aea5e80dbe1a56377
Related-Bug: 1804462

commit_message:
Tweak find_image method to search in hidden images

With Image v2.7 a possibility of hiding and image is being added (an 
attribute 'os_hidden'). After an image is being hidden the only 
possibility to find image by name is to do a list with `os_hidden=True` 
to list hidden images. So what we do here is search as usual, and if 
nothing found try also to search in hidden images (list of hidden images 
and grep by name)

Change-Id: I237da3e7e6b5d23010d8b26a3fcbfabaddeb5f31

subject: [FFU] Ensure compatibility with ansible 2.6.
messages: [{'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-26 10:56:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2019-02-27 18:41:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-02-28 16:22:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 10:56:22.000000000', 'message': "[FFU] Ensure compatibility with ansible 2.6.

Ansible 2.6 fix didn't properly selct bootstrap node. Also
new ansible changed mysql backend library making it unable
to read misformated my.cnf. This library also needs to have
socket specified if it's going to connect to local server.

Change-Id: I31b38eaf66bb899e72b1bfeca8795e5d1007eee5
Resolves: rhbz#1678235
Closes-bug: #1816422
(cherry picked from commit d8c368e09f375136efc94cc2b2512bbad8a7ad67)
"}]
commit_message:
[FFU] Ensure compatibility with ansible 2.6.

Ansible 2.6 fix didn't properly selct bootstrap node. Also
new ansible changed mysql backend library making it unable
to read misformated my.cnf. This library also needs to have
socket specified if it's going to connect to local server.

Change-Id: I31b38eaf66bb899e72b1bfeca8795e5d1007eee5
Resolves: rhbz#1678235
Closes-bug: #1816422
(cherry picked from commit d8c368e09f375136efc94cc2b2512bbad8a7ad67)

commit_message:
Install ipmitool in the mistral_executor image

This package is needed by TripleO to run baremetal node discovery from
the undercloud.

Bug #1807159
