commit_message:
Deprecate Cisco drivers

Due to a lack of operating third party CI and a lack
of maintenance of the drivers, the cisco drivers are
being deprecated by the ironic community.
More information can be found on the mailing list[0].

[0]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/002460.html

Change-Id: I3e7ee9728fba2bf6a779adfb5fa0ddf1fb369c49
Task: 29521
Story: 2005033

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/637673, the get introspection
interface is narrowed down to only accept node uuid, which previously
accepts both uuid and name. But the name to uuid conversion is
missing in the reapply api, which causes feature regression, and
this is the fix :(

Story: 1726713
Task: 11373

Change-Id: I6912853deab77f1365f665ca1e52c13063d2cdf1
'}]
commit_message:
Follow up to introspection data driver api revision

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/637673, the get introspection
interface is narrowed down to only accept node uuid, which previously
accepts both uuid and name. But the name to uuid conversion is
missing in the reapply api, which causes feature regression, and
this is the fix :(

Story: 1726713
Task: 11373

Change-Id: I6912853deab77f1365f665ca1e52c13063d2cdf1

subject: Validate access types versus share protocols
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 21863, 'name': 'Infinidat CI', 'email': 'jenkins@infinidat.com', 'username': 'infinidat-openstack'}, {'_account_id': 21884, 'name': 'DellEMC Unity CI', 'email': 'emc.unity.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-unity-ci'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24236, 'name': 'INSPUR CI', 'email': 'inspur.ci@inspur.com', 'username': 'INSPUR-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-27 20:34:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-02-27 20:36:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-02-27 20:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

An old review discussing this issue: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391514/'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-27 20:38:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Want to check that this is on the right track before adding tests, etc.

The feature mapping [1] shows some back ends supporting USER for NFS and IP for CIFS, etc. so I may not have the restrictions right yet.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-27 20:47:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@gouthamr - you were ahead of me.  So we should enforce only the laxer rules that can be derived from the feature support mapping matrix.

  cephx: cephfs native (i'll add a column for cephfs with nfs)
  cert: glusterfs native
  user: nfs, cifs, maprfs, hdfs)
  ip: nfs, cifs"}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-27 21:06:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-27 21:10:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@gouthamr: If I understand Valeriy's position he's saying that we should let drivers enforce this in the back end and the API should allow any access type with any protocol.  If we're going to hold to that I want to make an exception and at least do this check for cephx since there is no appropriate behavior to preserve for backwards compatability.  That we allowed cephx rules for NFS shares is a bug, potentially a security bug."}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-27 21:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

And fixing it in the api rather than letting it go to the back end for an error is a lot better experience for the user.'}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2019-02-27 23:14:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- dsvm-tempest-infinibox-nfs http://openstack-ci-logs.aws.infinidat.com/17/639817/2/check/dsvm-tempest-infinibox-nfs/03be25d : SUCCESS in 1h 00m 24s'}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2019-02-28 00:52:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Build succeed.

- EMC_Unity_Manila http://publiclogs.emc.com/17/639817/2/check/EMC_Unity_Manila/8364532/EMC_Unity_Manila/453 : SUCCESS in 2h 12m 20s

Leave a comment with 'run-dell-emc-unity' to trigger a recheck, for more information about CI, please see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/Dell_EMC_Unity_CI"}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-28 18:44:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I am going to push a different patch that disallows the specific cephx plus nfs combination in the ceph back end.'}]

commit_message:
Validate access types versus share protocols

Tighten up access-rule validation in the API so that
one can only specify access types that are appropriate
given the access protocol of the share to which the
access rule is being applied.

WIP: need to fix/add tests, release note, fix the
feature_support_mapping developer doc.

Change-Id: I8a349ea2b7a8d27e0f148f036bcdf709b8f45d31
Closes-bug: #1816420

Quick heads up - there is another change in flight, https://review.openstack.org/609684 - to work on merging the shade and sdk methods. I don't think it conflicts with this ... so it shouldn't be a problem.

That said - we might want to consider adding a url to the create method instead of a whole new method. Or - it might be worth having the new method but also support url in the create method. We should ponder that a bit more.

Anyway - only +1 for now until I get that other patch in and can wrap my head around how this fits in."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-02-27 14:31:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-02-27 16:43:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-02-28 10:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-02-28 13:37:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2019-02-28 13:58:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:10:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:12:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-25 15:03:03.000000000', 'message': "Add glance image import support

Interoperable image import process are introduced in the Image API v2.6. It
mainly allow image importing from an external url and let Image Service
download it by itself without sending binary data at image creation.

This commit will add a method import_image in both Image resource and proxy.

I also add a simple create_image proxy function for creating an image without
uploading it's data, as it is not required in glance API.

Change-Id: Idee9bea3f1f5db412e0ecd2105adff316aef4c4b
Story: 2005085
Task: 29671

commit_message:
Add glance image import support

Interoperable image import process are introduced in the Image API v2.6. It
mainly allow image importing from an external url and let Image Service
download it by itself without sending binary data at image creation.

This commit will add a method import_image in both Image resource and proxy.

I also add a simple create_image proxy function for creating an image without
uploading it's data, as it is not required in glance API.

Change-Id: Idee9bea3f1f5db412e0ecd2105adff316aef4c4b
Story: 2005085
Task: 29671

commit_message:
Use retriable_status_codes in image upload

This is supported down at the keystoneauth layer. Use it.

Change-Id: I3dfdc885a1c7989eb17244242c816a0a55aaea4a

commit_message:
update oslo.messaging to v9.4.0

- Also fix BuildRequires/Requires for vmware-nsxlib . The problem got
  visible while updating oslo.messaging
- Also fix mistral build for newer oslo.messaging version, and update
  to 8.0.0.0b1

Co-Authored-By: Thomas Bechtold <tbechtold@suse.com>
Change-Id: I6bbbe32f228a408d170da3644423763d21cbb3c9
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/639994

commit_message:
Fix DuplicateOptError for duplicate option

This change fixes error for duplicate option in tempest.conf.
DuplicateOptError: duplicate option: barbican

Change-Id: I9f36dbd14e2597593114af03ac0e0a9770874685
Closes-Bug: #1817154

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-11 12:15:17.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Move image methods to sdk image proxy

We have excellent image uploading code - people should get to use it
whether they use the abstraction layer or not.

The sdk is version specific, so we can split v1 and v2 using those
classes. Make a base class for both proxies so that we can define a
general interface and handle some of the argument normalization
and processing.

NOTE: This is very unfinished. The proxy methods should be transformed
to using the Resource layer. There are many places where calls back in
to the Connection haven't had self._connection pre-pended to them.

The wait logic needs to be reworked. We should make a v2.ImageTask
resource (I think) with a wait method - and a v2.Image with a
wait method so that we can have a proxy wait_for_image method that will
work fully for put and task. Then we should remove the wait loops from
the shade layer and have it call self.image.wait_for_image(image) if
wait/timeout have been passed.

At the end of this, create_image in shade should basically be:

  if volume:
    self.block_storage.create_image()
  else:
    self.image.create_image()
  if wait:
    self.image.wait_for_image(wait, timeout)

This is also a straw man for a general approach to shifting important
logic into the sdk layer so that it can be shared, but also keep things
like the wait/timeout and "call image or block-storage api calls"
in shade.

The block_storage.create_image is going to be interesting - because it
realy needs to return an Image resource. I think the existing code is
racey/buggy - because for not-wait it returns get_image(image_id) - but
I'm pretty sure that can't possibly be guaranteed to exist that instant.
However, with Image resource we can just create a blank Image object
with image_id filled in, and that blank object can be used as a
parameter to wait_for_image.

Change-Id: Idfeb25e8d6b20d7f5ea218aaf05af9a52fb1cfb8

the shade layer and have it call self.image.wait_for_image(image) if
wait/timeout have been passed.

At the end of this, create_image in shade should basically be:

  if volume:
    self.block_storage.create_image()
  else:
    self.image.create_image()
  if wait:
    self.image.wait_for_image(wait, timeout)

This is also a straw man for a general approach to shifting important
logic into the sdk layer so that it can be shared, but also keep things
like the wait/timeout and "call image or block-storage api calls"
in shade.

The block_storage.create_image is going to be interesting - because it
realy needs to return an Image resource. I think the existing code is
racey/buggy - because for not-wait it returns get_image(image_id) - but
I'm pretty sure that can't possibly be guaranteed to exist that instant.
However, with Image resource we can just create a blank Image object
with image_id filled in, and that blank object can be used as a
parameter to wait_for_image.

Change-Id: Idfeb25e8d6b20d7f5ea218aaf05af9a52fb1cfb8

commit_message:
Move image methods to sdk image proxy

We have excellent image uploading code - people should get to use it
whether they use the abstraction layer or not.

The sdk is version specific, so we can split v1 and v2 using those
classes. Make a base class for both proxies so that we can define a
general interface and handle some of the argument normalization
and processing.

NOTE: This is very unfinished. The proxy methods should be transformed
to using the Resource layer. There are many places where calls back in
to the Connection haven't had self._connection pre-pended to them.

The wait logic needs to be reworked. We should make a v2.ImageTask
resource (I think) with a wait method - and a v2.Image with a
wait method so that we can have a proxy wait_for_image method that will
work fully for put and task. Then we should remove the wait loops from
the shade layer and have it call self.image.wait_for_image(image) if
wait/timeout have been passed.

At the end of this, create_image in shade should basically be:

  if volume:
    self.block_storage.create_image()
  else:
    self.image.create_image()
  if wait:
    self.image.wait_for_image(wait, timeout)

This is also a straw man for a general approach to shifting important
logic into the sdk layer so that it can be shared, but also keep things
like the wait/timeout and "call image or block-storage api calls"
in shade.

The block_storage.create_image is going to be interesting - because it
realy needs to return an Image resource. I think the existing code is
racey/buggy - because for not-wait it returns get_image(image_id) - but
I'm pretty sure that can't possibly be guaranteed to exist that instant.
However, with Image resource we can just create a blank Image object
with image_id filled in, and that blank object can be used as a
parameter to wait_for_image.

Change-Id: Idfeb25e8d6b20d7f5ea218aaf05af9a52fb1cfb8

commit_message:
flatten the ec2 service configurations

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration
for the ec2 services.

Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

Change-Id: I401a1766222d45a4a584069d27cd880806cbab9f

[{'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-12-13 05:50:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-12-13 08:04:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2018-12-13 21:08:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Rataj,

I still have the same error. [1]

Before this patch, the volume's status was `error_restoring`. Thanks to Rajat's fix, after the restore, the volume is available. However, the restore doesn't happen.

Please let me know if I'm doing something wrong. 

Thanks, 
Sofi

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/737265/"}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2018-12-13 21:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I copy paste badly in the last lines of the paste openstack:

$ cinder list

+--------------------------------------+-----------+------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+                                                                                                         
| ID                                   | Status    | Name | Size | Volume Type | Bootable | Attached to |                                                                                                         
+--------------------------------------+-----------+------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+                                                                                                         
| e30815b1-a8d2-4d93-91b2-ab0c7bba394c | available | v3   | 2    | ceph        | false    |             |                                                                                                         
+--------------------------------------+-----------+------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-12-14 05:11:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Hi Rataj,
 > 
 > I still have the same error. [1]
 > 
 > Before this patch, the volume's status was `error_restoring`.
 > Thanks to Rajat's fix, after the restore, the volume is available.
 > However, the restore doesn't happen.
 > 
 > Please let me know if I'm doing something wrong.
 > 
 > Thanks,
 > Sofi
 > 
 > [1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/737265/

Hi Sofia,
As per the implemented design of backup-restore, There is only one exception condition while restoring a backup, the volume size shouldn't be less than the backup size [1].
If the volume size is greater than the backup size then it restores the backup normally while keeping the size of the volume.[2]
Also incase of ceph driver (which i think you're currently using), the size used for restore is the volume size [3]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/backup/api.py#L386-L390
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/backup/manager.py#L561-L564
[3] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/backup/drivers/ceph.py#L1168"}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-12-19 16:48:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

This fix makes sense to me.  Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 25111, 'date': '2018-12-20 06:44:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-12-20 08:59:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

LGTM, and I test it in my env, works! thanks!'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-12-20 13:08:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-12-20 13:16:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2018-12-20 17:31:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Works on my env ! I retry it with `sudo python setup.py install`. Looks good to me, but someone else must approve'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-12-22 01:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-01-08 06:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-01-09 20:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-01-09 20:55:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-01-09 20:56:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Fix: Restore output 'VolumeBackupsRestore' object is not iterable

VolumeBackupsRetore object has '_info' attribute
which contains the output data of the restore
command which should be returned instead of the
'VolumeBackupsRestore' object.

Change-Id: I64b75649c1ac9c24e05a197f7280975564b4d386
Story: 2004740
Task: 28811

commit_message:
Final Oslo releases for Stein

This is largely to clean up any pending doc and test changes in the
Oslo projects. Normally those don't require a release, but because
stable branches are created based on the latest release hash, we need
to release these changes so they will be present on the stable branches.
Otherwise we end up having to backport changes unnecessarily.

Change-Id: I4f3b9ea53f61b869bcc329ea18990795f40a4769

commit_message:
Check that the networks are defined on update

Check defined networks in the resource registry of the stack against the
networks defined in the environment files. If the environment provided
doesn't have the networks defined, it's likely they were improperly
dropped which can lead to deployment issues. This is a light check that
only checks for the existance of the networks but not the contents of
those networks. This handles the case where a user forgets to include
the network-isolation configuration on a subsequent update to the cloud.
This does not prevent a user from changing the contents of the networks
to something that breaks their deployment.

Partial-Bug: #1817631
Change-Id: Ia97a2367770e37bf8c55f2fd04c9a9efde914a67

commit_message:
Release 0.3.0 of os-resource-classes

This release adds the normalize_name utility method which
can be used by clients of the library to generate a
known-good name of a resource class. The change does not
otherwise impact the library so is of minimal risk to
any existing installs.

Also, the team is updated from placement to nova. The
launchpad (for now) remains the same. Storyboard is
in progress, but not happened yet.

Change-Id: Ib878cc7a4e2df1186493b63b3c3d7dcc50fceda0

commit_message:
Support cephfs_volume_mode parameter

manila now [1] supports configuring an octal value for the
rwx permissions mode of the cephfs volumes and snapshots
and groups of these that back manila shares, snapshots,
and groups.

Expose this parameter in the backend manifests for manila
with cephfs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614332
Change-Id: I28410e8c5e452ada87c7e64da637c699fcb1faba
(cherry picked from commit 43df3f75947207e11ee8ea53ec90472c586ccd9b)
(cherry picked from commit 6881e9ace4058df054d0defd75daa66dba95b203)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 19:04:20.000000000', 'message': "Avoid BadRequest error log on volume attachment

At the gate, only AttachVolumeNegativeTest makes nova-api output
error log as a negative test case like:

  ERROR nova.volume.cinder [None req-dcc8814f-7439-44c8-872e-86ea51f4b319
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524]
   [instance: ca526f93-e723-4372-a1c1-4fa03ffc1bd7]
   Create attachment failed for volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418.
   Error: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418 status
     must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)
   Code: 400:
   BadRequest: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418
     status must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)

Operators don't need to take care of BadRequest cases in general because
that is due to end user mistakes. So this patch makes nova-api avoiding
such error log case.

Change-Id: I22d9d974822282ffc3c0942d4766b135717dd369
"}, {'created': '2018-07-10 21:37:23.000000000', 'message': "Avoid BadRequest error log on volume attachment

At the gate, only AttachVolumeNegativeTest makes nova-api output
error log as a negative test case like:

  ERROR nova.volume.cinder [None req-dcc8814f-7439-44c8-872e-86ea51f4b319
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524]
   [instance: ca526f93-e723-4372-a1c1-4fa03ffc1bd7]
   Create attachment failed for volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418.
   Error: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418 status
     must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)
   Code: 400:
   BadRequest: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418
     status must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)

Operators don't need to take care of BadRequest cases in general because
that is due to end user mistakes. So this patch makes nova-api avoiding
such error log case.

Change-Id: I22d9d974822282ffc3c0942d4766b135717dd369
"}, {'created': '2019-02-11 20:02:59.000000000', 'message': "Avoid BadRequest error log on volume attachment

At the gate, only AttachVolumeNegativeTest makes nova-api output
error log as a negative test case like:

  ERROR nova.volume.cinder [None req-dcc8814f-7439-44c8-872e-86ea51f4b319
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524]
   [instance: ca526f93-e723-4372-a1c1-4fa03ffc1bd7]
   Create attachment failed for volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418.
   Error: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418 status
     must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)
   Code: 400:
   BadRequest: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418
     status must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)

Operators don't need to take care of BadRequest cases in general because
that is due to end user mistakes. So this patch makes nova-api avoiding
such error log case.

Closes-Bug: #1797237

Change-Id: I22d9d974822282ffc3c0942d4766b135717dd369
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid BadRequest error log on volume attachment

At the gate, only AttachVolumeNegativeTest makes nova-api output
error log as a negative test case like:

  ERROR nova.volume.cinder [None req-dcc8814f-7439-44c8-872e-86ea51f4b319
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524]
   [instance: ca526f93-e723-4372-a1c1-4fa03ffc1bd7]
   Create attachment failed for volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418.
   Error: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418 status
     must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)
   Code: 400:
   BadRequest: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418
     status must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)

Operators don't need to take care of BadRequest cases in general because
that is due to end user mistakes. So this patch makes nova-api avoiding
such error log case.

Closes-Bug: #1797237

Change-Id: I22d9d974822282ffc3c0942d4766b135717dd369

commit_message:
Fix async reserved word in python3.7

kubernetes-client has patched this [1]. To retain backwards
compatibility, we can use **kwargs to handle async/async_req arguments

[1]: https://github.com/kubernetes-client/python/commit/b10c7b6a175ab96291a6f74d68ea6027151f3b71

Change-Id: I8e738b4f99091786dd76e081bffa36ef5ab70085

commit_message:
FakeLoopingCall raises IOError

All unittests using FakeLoopingCall raise an IOError if an initial
delay is not specified, because the default initial_dealy is -1.
Changing the default initial delay to 0.

story: 2005112
task: 29748
Change-Id: I6cbae0996c2347e25d8be617e4b3fd93f4d9cc95

commit_message:
release neutron-lib 1.25.0

Release the latest code from neutron-lib so that we can begin to consume
it in networking related projects. Particularly, common codes related to
the upgarde check and policy-in-code efforts have been moved from neutron
to neutron-lib.

Change-Id: Iea19e683fdbea04e7f39c26e7b3bffa83031a811

It was brought to my attention that the RBD driver
does now have replication working.  As a result I
am updating that information with this patch.

Change-Id: I01dc1101d66379c41d32b6883b4db1fc28d7c2b4

commit_message:
Fix incorrect replication info for RBD

It was brought to my attention that the RBD driver
does now have replication working.  As a result I
am updating that information with this patch.

Change-Id: I01dc1101d66379c41d32b6883b4db1fc28d7c2b4

commit_message:
[api-ref] Fix the parameter of image metadata

The value of os-vol-image-meta is not in parameters.yaml, so use
os-show_image_metadata to replace it.

Change-Id: I0400a1bf8dbe34f4b857e62832d11b098a8a2d2f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-26 02:25:59.000000000', 'message': "VNX: update sg in cache

When `destroy_empty_storage_group` is enabled, the sg will be deleted
after the last lun is detached from it. The issue is that the sg cache
isn't updated, which caused the failure of subsequent attaching volumes
to the same host because the sg in the cache will be used directly which
doesn't exist any more.

The fix is updating the sg with poll after deleting it. This doesn't
delete the sg from cache explicitly but makes sure the sg in cache with
latest status `not-exist`. Subsequent attaching will create the sg if it
is `not-exist`.

When `destroy_empty_storage_group` is enabled, the sg will be deleted
after the last lun is detached from it. The issue is that the sg cache
isn't updated, which caused the failure of subsequent attaching volumes
to the same host because the sg in the cache will be used directly which
doesn't exist any more.

The fix is updating the sg with poll after deleting it. This doesn't
delete the sg from cache explicitly but makes sure the sg in cache with
latest status `not-exist`. Subsequent attaching will create the sg if it

commit_message:
VNX: update sg in cache

When `destroy_empty_storage_group` is enabled, the sg will be deleted
after the last lun is detached from it. The issue is that the sg cache
isn't updated, which caused the failure of subsequent attaching volumes
to the same host because the sg in the cache will be used directly which
doesn't exist any more.

The fix is updating the sg with poll after deleting it. This doesn't
delete the sg from cache explicitly but makes sure the sg in cache with
latest status `not-exist`. Subsequent attaching will create the sg if it
is `not-exist`.

Closes-bug: #1817385
Change-Id: Ibb39879a77c97c6a5d885461e93116810d16b265

commit_message:
Limit instances exposure

Prior to this commit, `sushy-emulator` served all libvirt domains
and OpenStack instances to Redfish clients. This might impose security
risks by exposing too much through Redfish.

This change introduces a way to limit backend VMs exposure to
Redfish clients by way of configuring allowed instance identities
via `SUSHY_EMULATOR_ALLOWED_INSTANCES` configuration option.

Story: 2004305
Task: 27865
Change-Id: Iff194ec63a27300b7687bfcdcb4fca579f111183

commit_message:
Be able to know when we are running inside a minor update workflow

With this change we add an ansible variable called
'tripleo_minor_update' set to true only during the update_steps_playbook
which get run during a minor update.
Then inside common/deploy-steps-tasks when starting containers with
paunch we export this 'tripleo_minor_update' ansible variable and
push it inside the 'TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE' environment variable.

Inside change Id1d671506d3ec827bc311b47d9363952e1239ce3 we will then
use the env variable and export it to the restart_bundles in order
to detect if we're inside a minor update workflow (as opposed to
a redeploy - aka stack update). The testing that has been done is
described in the above change.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib3562adbd83f7162c2aeb450329b7cc4ab200fc2

[{'created': '2019-02-28 10:46:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect application of 'ip' commands for bridges

The code that applies iproute2 commands to bridges that are
modified specifies "interface" rather than "bridge", so it does
not function correctly. This patch fixes the typos so that
bridges will have updates applied through iproute2 if a restart
is not required.

Change-Id: I53df2f3506cca2b69e4f1f59471c7b90dc8fdfb7
Closes-bug: 1806128
(cherry picked from commit 61b0d665e6b9a0ff35ce06e2bcc315a54e4efbdb)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect application of 'ip' commands for bridges

The code that applies iproute2 commands to bridges that are
modified specifies "interface" rather than "bridge", so it does
not function correctly. This patch fixes the typos so that
bridges will have updates applied through iproute2 if a restart
is not required.

Change-Id: I53df2f3506cca2b69e4f1f59471c7b90dc8fdfb7
Closes-bug: 1806128
(cherry picked from commit 61b0d665e6b9a0ff35ce06e2bcc315a54e4efbdb)

[{'created': '2019-02-27 20:55:50.000000000', 'message': "Provide more specific error when namespace is missing

Previously if a non-existent namespace was specified, we just got
a generic KeyError from stevedore that didn't say a whole lot about
what went wrong. You pretty much had to go read the code to figure
out what happened.

This change adds an explicit check for a missing namespace and raises
a KeyError with a more specific error message that explains what is
wrong.

Change-Id: Ia56d4655d70cee78661567188a977f67b7c3ee78
Closes-Bug: 1817953
"}]
commit_message:
Provide more specific error when namespace is missing

Previously if a non-existent namespace was specified, we just got
a generic KeyError from stevedore that didn't say a whole lot about
what went wrong. You pretty much had to go read the code to figure
out what happened.

This change adds an explicit check for a missing namespace and raises
a KeyError with a more specific error message that explains what is
wrong.

Change-Id: Ia56d4655d70cee78661567188a977f67b7c3ee78
Closes-Bug: 1817953

commit_message:
Add the metric name to the Exception message when validation fails

In the general validate_metric case, when possible add the metric
name to the exception message. This makes it much easier to
track down what metric failed.

Also, fixing code where an exception could be thrown but then
immediately ignored and another exception fo the same type
with a different message would be thrown.

Change-Id: I8b8f04bb98a65b6904894dc00af88ea367a350f8
Story: 2004185
Task: 27675

[{'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-12-05 22:36:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-01-29 02:07:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-01-29 02:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-01-29 02:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-08 09:27:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-11 08:04:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-11 20:08:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-11 20:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-11 20:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thanks, Spyros.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-02-12 00:24:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Looks good to me, but as mentioned on IRC we should re-evalulate this as a follow up patch. Maybe move it into a text blob, or json file.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-17 11:20:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Maybe one more improvement.

We could have one option like --use-keystone, default false, or --use-certificate, default true, (I would prefer keystone by default but it is better to not change the default behavior).

With the current implementation, we output both admin credentials and  a keystone compatible config file.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-18 00:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@Spyros, do you mean use the --use-certificate or --user-keystone to switch the current context?'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-18 09:17:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> @Spyros, do you mean use the --use-certificate or --user-keystone
 > to switch the current context?

If the two options produce different outputs, users can share the keystone-enabled kubeconfig easily and store it safely anywhere they want.

--use-certificate produces:

apiVersion: v1
clusters:
- cluster:
    certificate-authority: ...
    server: ...
  name: ...
contexts:
- context:
    cluster: ...
    user: admin
  name: default
current-context: default
kind: Config
preferences: {}
users:
- name: admin
  user:
    client-certificate: ...
    client-key: ...


--use-keystone produces:

apiVersion: v1
clusters:
- cluster:
    certificate-authority-data: ...
    server: ...
  name: ...
contexts:
- context:
    cluster: ...
    user: openstackuser
  name: openstackuser@kubernetes
current-context: openstackuser@kubernetes
kind: Config
preferences: {}
users:
- name: openstackuser
  user:
    exec:
      command: /bin/bash
      apiVersion: client.authentication.k8s.io/v1alpha1
      args:
      - -c
      - >
        if [ -z ${OS_TOKEN} ]; then
            echo 'Error: Missing OpenStack credential from environment variable $OS_TOKEN' > /dev/stderr
            exit 1
        else
            echo '{ "apiVersion": "client.authentication.k8s.io/v1alpha1", "kind": "ExecCredential", "status": { "token": "'"${OS_TOKEN}"'"}}'
        fi'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-18 16:59:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hmm... Adding two arguments to produce different config files isn't a bad idea. But as the first version, I would like to keep it simple, we can easily add those arguments later."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-20 18:23:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

does it really make sense to have both contexts in the file? A big plus of keystone is to not leak the admin certificate'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-25 11:10:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

We should break kubeconfig in two. openstack creds and the admin cert in the same file doesn't make a lot of sense"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-25 11:33:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

OK, that makes more sense to me. I will propose a new patch set to split the config into two based on the given arguments.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-26 02:10:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-26 02:47:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-02-26 09:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-27 10:36:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-27 11:08:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-27 11:22:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)

let's put up a patch for releasenotes here or in the magnum repo.

we will need docs too."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-27 11:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Update cloud-archive.list when upgrading from Pike to Queens

ceph-osd charm only upgrades when the ceph version changes, for the
case of upgrading from Pike to Queens the charm is skipping any
upgrades, because the Cloud Archive has Luminous for those 2 releases.

This patch checks if the requested ceph version is luminous and if the
'source' changed from pike to queens to then upgrade
/etc/apt/sources.list.d/cloud-archive.list via add_source()

As part of this backport, I manually un-picked the stein dict
entry from lib/ceph/utils.py, as it is not currently applicable to
the stable charm.

Change-Id: I27c2d7648a1add6528924724a03682060d2d6007
Closes-Bug: 1778823
(cherry picked from commit 336581efeb9a1c5d363c5d3ce631d9bad1a8a337)

(cherry picked from commit 5ed4956f2bc594d42abf6fd2fa64dcddc1b86da5)
"}]
commit_message:
Update cloud-archive.list when upgrading from Pike to Queens

ceph-mon charm only upgrades when the ceph version changes, for the
case of upgrading from Pike to Queens the charm is skipping any
upgrades, because the Cloud Archive has Luminous for those 2 releases.

This patch checks if the requested ceph version is luminous and if the
'source' changed from pike to queens to then upgrade
/etc/apt/sources.list.d/cloud-archive.list via add_source()

As part of this backport, I manually un-picked the stein dict
entry from lib/ceph/utils.py, as it is not currently applicable to
the stable charm.

Change-Id: I05b7d722e45d3a02a97866903a67bd9b16d4f552
Closes-Bug: 1778823
(cherry picked from commit 5ed4956f2bc594d42abf6fd2fa64dcddc1b86da5)

commit_message:
Update source/packages if config changes

Also, this change removes the harden decorators as
the required configuration for harden is _not_ present
in the charm config, rendering it useless.

Change-Id: I20c124d9588b8fd6c0e6611725a848eaf892f6af
Closes-Bug: #1812219
(cherry picked from commit eca9d8cd28f7ce6c71c8491e43281a0c0e3bf663)

commit_message:
Add zuul jobs

This patch adds the following Zuul CI jobs:

- Python 2.7 unit tests
- Python 3.6 unit tests
- Functional tests with LVM
- Functional tests with Ceph
- Publis documentation
- Release notes

Change-Id: I2f3f34c1db4716b323c48908f51500898c2c6242

commit_message:
stop using common db mixin

All of the methods of common db mixin are available via neutron-lib
and the mixin will be removed before long.
This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's APIs rather
than those of the mixin as well as top using the mixin as a parent
class.

Change-Id: I0cd42b3bb1b9b365ef9770ead006b54a2828453f

commit_message:
Add check for object versions

Adds a check for compatibility of the object versions (in the DB)
with the release of ironic. This check is used by the
'ironic-status upgrade check' command.

The ironic-status command is added to devstack and grenade (when
upgrading).

Change-Id: I2043dc01856106d50356637db327a2817db90366
Story: 2004990
Task: 29459

commit_message:
Revert "Refactor create_pool." and "Add request_access_to_group method"

This reverts commit e4997e5ab8467f28902d4f8da3e45654033aa83c and
288bab66dd45a722622aa9d36d9cb02705eda546.

This is necessary as this change does not verify that there is not an
existing request to do this in the queue, and will end up creating
infinite create_pool requests on the ceph-mon

Change-Id: I76305181ddba83eca414d9e08bbd58408d2b01ce

commit_message:
APIv2 support for scenario tests

Add the support for APIv2 clients to scenario tests, while
keeping the code compatible with APIv1.1. Most of the changes
are due to the renaming of job/job_execution to job_template/job.

A new job (sahara-tests-scenario-v2) runs the APIv2 scenario tests.
Story: 2004511
Task: 28239
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/581774
Change-Id: I4c69c5f9d263dc69911117282f3b9daee8650d80

https://openstack-ci-reports.ubuntu.com/artifacts/test_charm_pipeline/openstack/charm-rabbitmq-server/499906/10/7398/consoleText.test_charm_amulet_smoke_9225.txt'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-14 22:50:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I talked with Drew; I'm going to try to take point on this."}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-15 22:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-15 22:49:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

The issue was that set-action was breaking on vhost /.  Keys to set-action have a limited character set that can be used, so putting the vhost directly in a set-action key made things fragile.

I moved the vhost into the value, and used a JSON object to avoid issues with parsing in case of spaces in vhost/queue names.  Hope that seems reasonable; let me know if you have alternative suggestions.

Finally, the amulet test is very basic; it basically just verifies that the action can be executed and nothing more.  Maybe this is okay, or maybe we want to push a message to a new queue and verify that it gets listed as unconsumed?  I'm not sure what others feel, and there are unit tests already which cover this functionality via mocks, so please let me know."}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-15 22:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2019-02-19 17:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-02-19 23:36:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

This looks good and passes tests. Paul may decide to add more tests. Several of us have touched this change. So we need to find a reviewer who has not.'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-23 00:09:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-23 00:30:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-23 00:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-23 00:34:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

I updated the test to publish to an empty queue and to verify that the queue contains unconsumed messages using the new action.

I did a few revisions here since I didn't feel like things were adequately robust for ensuring the queue was unused prior to the test.  Apologies for the thrash.  Let me know what you think."}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-25 08:06:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-25 08:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

The changes here should have nothing to do with that test.  I'm guessing it's an intermittent failure?

I'm going to kick off a re-run, but I wonder if a bug should be filed for this?'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-25 08:36:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

Ack, sorry, ignore the last comment; was meant for a different review.'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-25 13:07:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-26 14:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

Bug found in my rework.  The iterator generating some of the action_set keys was being reset on each vhost; that was logically valid when the vhost was part of the key but is now incorrect since that has changed.

Testing fix locally.'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-26 15:35:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-27 08:36:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 26040, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:41:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review+2

Code looks good. Looks like you might need to poke at that failing smoke test, though.'}, {'account_id': 26040, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Pete Vander Giessen <pete.vandergiessen@canonical.com>
'}, {'account_id': 26040, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:55:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1

The code looks good, but it looks like we have a legitimate failure in the smoke tests.

Unfortunately, the rabbitmq logs don't make it into the crash dump, so we can't tell what went wrong. Please try deploying this manually, so that you can troubleshoot."}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-27 14:18:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:20:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

Okay...

Re-running CI made it pass; I'm pretty sure we have an intermittent problem on our hands.

Further, I believe that this code makes such breakage no more likely to occur, other than the fact that it runs one more amulet test which gives these intermittent errors more time to manifest.  The nature of the changes seem very unlikely to cause unexpected side effects in the other existing tests, and the new amulet test runs at the very end after all the others.

I'm currently trying to reproduce the error on serverstack with the upstream version.  Due to how long this takes to run, it may take some time for me to do so."}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:26:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

Based upon discussion with Ryan, I'll file a bug regarding what I've been able to find here.  He's done numerous reruns and hasn't been able to reproduce.  I'm also having trouble with consistent reproduction.

Pete, would you be okay +2-ing this?  As far as I can tell, these failures are not related to this patch."}, {'account_id': 26040, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:28:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: Code-Review+2

I agree that we can set aside our qualms about the build for now. I don't think that it's related to the code.

In any case, LGTM."}, {'account_id': 26040, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:28:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Added list-unconsumed-queues action

Add status inquiry list-unconsumed-queues action to allow operators to
determine which queues are not being consumed in each RMQ vhost. Useful for
troubleshooting message queue volume alerts.

Closes-Bug: 1767437
Change-Id: Icdd0b8c4db607701bc5e33d86e263b6a5f1bb7f5

commit_message:
Don't look for primary_role ips in AllNodesValidationConfig

We changed the AllNodesValidationConfig to be role specific.
However, we still use primary_role_name ips.

Change-Id: I0aa1174992f6f049f1e64faea6d88e377d357bad
Closes-Bug: #1817087
(cherry picked from commit 95362173c2659e4f70d3cb4190d6512aee1d11ca)

[{'created': '2017-09-28 14:25:51.000000000', 'message': 'Make grafana and prometheus cluster accessible only

Instead of using NodePort and exposing the host port,
grafana and prometheus can be accessed with their service
name and with kubectl proxy.

Add the prometheus datasource with a jon instead of talking to
the node that grafana is running.

* update doc

Change-Id: I449e6210aaee3019ae25cb98a50799449b05a844
Partially-Fixes: #1720146
'}]
commit_message:
Make grafana and prometheus cluster accessible only

Instead of using NodePort and exposing the host port,
grafana and prometheus can be accessed with their service
name and with kubectl proxy.

Add the prometheus datasource with a jon instead of talking to
the node that grafana is running.

TODO:
* add reno
* update doc

Change-Id: I449e6210aaee3019ae25cb98a50799449b05a844
Partially-Fixes: #1720146

commit_message:
Update Neutron-Neutron Interconnections

- Move specification for Neutron-Neutron Interconnections RFE for
  implementation in Stein release,
- Remove redundant states from lifecycle FSM,
- Add remote_interconnection_id attribute to interconnection resource,
- Minor update in API exchange example.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Related-Bug: 1750368

commit_message:
Add image.task resource

This change implements a Task resource of the image service with a 
wait_for_task method to wait for task to reach certain (normally 
'success') status

Change-Id: Ib74bb59bb06b6753720fc5047af1168c3cd66898

commit_message:
Enable OVN baremetal by default with Ironic service

Switch overcloud Ironic to OVN baremetal and distinguish undercloud
ironic config from overcloud ironic config. Currently undercloud is
using ML2/OVS and will need 'openvswitch' driver there while the
overcloud default driver has now been shifted to ML2/OVN.
Hence we need to split the ironic environment to cover both scenarios.

Change-Id: I754edb68a715b6386a77684d9a72af64e4f188b2

[{'created': '2019-02-26 11:08:31.000000000', 'message': "Configure region_name_for_services in heat.conf

backport: rocky

Not including this means that SoftwareDeployments do not have a
configured region (it's set to 'null'), and can therefore not
communicate back to the heat API. In particular, this breaks Magnum with
the following error in the journal on the deployed servers:

publicURL endpoint for orchestration service in null region not found

Change-Id: Ia2c18ef10727391812368c958262a92385374ace
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john@stackhpc.com>
Closes-Bug: #1817051
(cherry picked from commit 54203843dd944211ef0b99e8c69d09638701a086)
"}]
commit_message:
Configure region_name_for_services in heat.conf

backport: rocky

Not including this means that SoftwareDeployments do not have a
configured region (it's set to 'null'), and can therefore not
communicate back to the heat API. In particular, this breaks Magnum with
the following error in the journal on the deployed servers:

publicURL endpoint for orchestration service in null region not found

Change-Id: Ia2c18ef10727391812368c958262a92385374ace
Co-Authored-By: John Garbutt <john@stackhpc.com>
Closes-Bug: #1817051
(cherry picked from commit 54203843dd944211ef0b99e8c69d09638701a086)

commit_message:
baremetal: support network_data when building configdrive

This change adds support for network_data.json as defined in:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/liberty/implemented/metadata-service-network-info.html

Also make user_data options, since it is actually optional.

Change-Id: I28b7152e47bb6648b63d9216fbcdad22c1649888
Story: #2005083

subject: Refactor create_pool.
messages: [{'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2019-01-08 11:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-01-08 12:17:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I76305181ddba83eca414d9e08bbd58408d2b01ce'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 11:40:03.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor create_pool.

Refactor create_pool to allow future methods to easily access
the existing request. This change also includes two changes in
behaviour:

 * If an existing request is invalid due to invalid json or missing
   ops attribute then the exception is now propagated rather than
   logged and suppressed. If an existing request is corrupt then
   fail early otherwise bad things will follow.
 * The existing implementation only allows for a single create_pool
   request. Any additional requests would overwrite previous ones.
   This change allows for multiple pools to be requested in a
   single broker request.

Change-Id: I61998c2ce70325cb904add8c51cbc9c34b3c9564
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor create_pool.

Refactor create_pool to allow future methods to easily access
the existing request. This change also includes two changes in
behaviour:

 * If an existing request is invalid due to invalid json or missing
   ops attribute then the exception is now propagated rather than
   logged and suppressed. If an existing request is corrupt then
   fail early otherwise bad things will follow.
 * The existing implementation only allows for a single create_pool
   request. Any additional requests would overwrite previous ones.
   This change allows for multiple pools to be requested in a
   single broker request.

Change-Id: I61998c2ce70325cb904add8c51cbc9c34b3c9564

@Kendall and JP: Jay is a member of cinder-stable-maint, or am I misunderstanding what you're asking for here?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-02-15 14:03:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

We usually have one of the stable SIG members review releases. That tends to be Matt or Tony, in most cases."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-02-18 16:19:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> > @Kendall and JP: Jay is a member of cinder-stable-maint, or am I
 > > misunderstanding what you're asking for here?
 > 
 > We usually have one of the stable SIG members review releases. That
 > tends to be Matt or Tony, in most cases.

Yes, on top of it, I counted Jay here for the PTL case, so I expected to "not stack" votes on him :p

But I am generally okay with it so I am submitting a shy +1 :)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-02-20 15:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There were a couple of questionable backports of driver changes included here. We are past the Monday review day for stable, but I will hold off on approving to see if we can still get some stable team eyes on this.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-02-25 05:20:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks for delaying this a little.  I did look at it last week and frankly was a little overwhelmed by the volume of backports in a single release[1].

There are definitely some interesting backports in there.  Some I assume have been added in order to make follow-up backports clean and keep the same functionality in all drivers with the same version number.

This release adds a number of new config options:

 $ git diff 11.1.1..0e623cc42733bffe997a9bc2a771f16c800481ae -- ':(exclude)cinder/tests/*' | grep -Ei '^\+.*cfg\.'
 +    cfg.BoolOpt('sio_allow_non_padded_volumes',
 +    cfg.BoolOpt('remove_empty_host',
 +    cfg.BoolOpt('rbd_exclusive_cinder_pool', default=False,
 +    cfg.StrOpt('vmware_snapshot_format',

It also changes a couple of defaults which can be a problem:

 $ git diff 11.1.1..0e623cc42733bffe997a9bc2a771f16c800481ae -- ':(exclude)cinder/tests/*' | grep -EiC2 'default=\[\],'
      cfg.ListOpt('unity_storage_pool_names',
 -                default=None,
 +                default=[],
                  help='A comma-separated list of storage pool names to be '
                  'used.'),
      cfg.ListOpt('unity_io_ports',
 -                default=None,
 +                default=[],
                  help='A comma-separated list of iSCSI or FC ports to be used. '
 -                     'Each port can be Unix-style glob expressions.')]


I8a922f4a7a9e62658469ef31eb55c6d4b9ab8477 Also adds a new requirement on fallocate being installed on the system while I expect this is okay I do wonder about very locked down environments or systems with cinder-volume running in restricted/minimal containers.

I don't see anything here that's really problematic and I'm not going to block the release or request reverts but with all that and looking at the release notes[2] I'd be much happier if this were 11.2.0



[1] Which is still nothing compare to some other projects ;P 
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/01/636401/1/check/releases-tox-list-changes/62a62d1/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-02-12_17_56_31_245683"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-02-27 16:45:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-02-27 16:46:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-02-27 16:47:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We discussed this at today's Cinder team meeting, agreed with Tony that 11.2.0 makes sense for this release."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-02-27 17:06:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-02-27 17:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

It seems there is a consensus on 11.2.0 then.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
release os-vif 1.15.1

the 1.15.0 release of os-vif contained a bug
introduced as part of the brctl removeal.
os-vif 1.15.1 resolves this issue and adds
gate jobs to improve testing.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639732/
Change-Id: I58bab7bd8e82f8296a3c3344ac17659e14e0ceb2

subject: Updates references to latest release to rocky.
messages:
[{'account_id': 30015, 'date': '2019-02-27 21:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-02-27 21:08:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2019-02-28 03:37:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Welcome and this is a nice catch! :)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-02-28 09:28:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks for the commit. Normally we make changes on the master branch first, then backport them. I'll make an exception in this case because really I think the master branch should be using the latest documentation, so I'm putting together a patch to do that."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-02-28 09:30:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Change for master: https://review.openstack.org/639952'}, {'account_id': 30015, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:16:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Glad to help! This is my first open source contribution, so it's pretty exciting, even though it's just a doc update.
I wasn't quite sure which branch to start from since it only applied to Rocky; I'll keep that in mind for future updates. Thanks!"}]

commit_message:

Non-containerized multinode scenario jobs are no longer supported
and should be removed from zuul config.

commit_message:
Release Senlin Stein b1

senlin:
* Bug fixes and feature implementations that include changes to the API
and breaking change to health policy.

python-senlinclient:
* Bug fix in cluster delete and node delete to work with latest
openstacksdk

senlin-dashboard:
* Bug fix to work with latest openstacksdk
* Bug fix in profile create form submission

senlin-tempest-plugin:
* Add new tests for health policy

Change-Id: I6fb26da9742e31704ff2858bc2e3e3dc1a84d75c

commit_message:
Fix image download URL regex for opensuse-leap-15.0

The image file name has changed from the form of:
opensuse-leap-15.0-image.x86_64-1.0.0-lxc-Buildlp150.26.23.tar.xz

to the form of:
opensuse-leap-15.0-image.x86_64-1.0.0-lxc-Build26.24.tar.xz

This patch changes the regex to accommodate the new form.

Change-Id: Ic6fb62b31f4f5892fef32380909e121f13e08f3e

commit_message:
Fix minor issues in the baremetal proxy docs

* Corrected indentation that caused lists to have definitions lists
  inside of them.
* Chassis and ports do not have names, stop mentioning them.
* Small wording fixes.

Potential problems to fix in the future:
* find_chassis and find_port probably work incorrectly because
  these resources do not have names.
* the fields arguments to get_port and get_port_group probably
  do not work this way.

Change-Id: Id7ab627ac08f986142d1755543d602d878e0f53e

commit_message:
Implement system admin role in groups API

The commit introduces the system admin role to the group API, making
it consistent with other system-admin policy definitions.

Subsequent patches will incorporate:

  - domain reader functionality
  - domain member test coverage
  - domain admin functionality

Change-Id: Ib0ff05396bed2bfefefa712491aeb0b9b5f2c1d0
Related-Bug: 968696
Related-Bug: 1808859
Closes-Bug: 1805369

subject: Added gc_threshold overrides to sysctl.conf
messages: [{'account_id': 26040, 'date': '2019-02-28 11:00:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-02-28 11:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26040, 'date': '2019-02-28 12:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-02-28 12:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 11:00:54.000000000', 'message': 'Added gc_threshold overrides to sysctl.conf

When clouds have a large number of hosts, the default size of the ARP
cache is too small. The cache can overflow, which means that the
system has no way to reach some ip addresses.

Setting the threshold limits higher addresses the situation, in a
reasonably safe way (the maximum impact is 5MB or so of additional RAM
used). Docs on ARP at http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/arp.7.html,
and more discussion of the issue in the bug.

Change-Id: Iaf8382ee0b42e1444cfea589bb05a687cd0c23fa
Closes-Bug: 1780348
'}]
commit_message:
Added gc_threshold overrides to sysctl.conf

When clouds have a large number of hosts, the default size of the ARP
cache is too small. The cache can overflow, which means that the
system has no way to reach some ip addresses.

Setting the threshold limits higher addresses the situation, in a
reasonably safe way (the maximum impact is 5MB or so of additional RAM
used). Docs on ARP at http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/arp.7.html,
and more discussion of the issue in the bug.

Change-Id: Iaf8382ee0b42e1444cfea589bb05a687cd0c23fa
Closes-Bug: 1780348

commit_message:
Implement system member test coverage for groups

This commit introduces explicity test coverage for system members,
making sure they are allowed to perform readable and not writable
group operations.

Subsequent patches will incorporate:

  - system admin functionality
  - domain reader functionality
  - domain member test coverage
  - domain admin functionality

Change-Id: Ie22a18ac7b243089509001fda930474f55e29d3f
Related-Bug: 1805369
Related-Bug: 1808859
Related-Bug: 968696

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-17 23:08:16.000000000', 'message': 'Implement system reader role for groups

This commit introduces the system reader role to the group API, making
it easier for administrators to delegate subsets of responsibilities
to the API by default. This commit also maintains the ability for
any user to be able to fetch their own group memberships, which
encapsulates a bunch of tests for what regular project users can do
with groups.

Subsequent patches will incorporate:

  - system member test coverage
  - system admin functionality
  - domain reader functionality
  - domain member test coverage
  - domain admin functionality

Change-Id: I24ff27da79bb01322e05c6d8cd37f02693fd5b9f

commit_message:
Implement system reader role for groups

This commit introduces the system reader role to the group API, making
it easier for administrators to delegate subsets of responsibilities
to the API by default. This commit also maintains the ability for
any user to be able to fetch their own group memberships, which
encapsulates a bunch of tests for what regular project users can do
with groups.

Subsequent patches will incorporate:

  - system member test coverage
  - system admin functionality
  - domain reader functionality
  - domain member test coverage
  - domain admin functionality

Change-Id: I24ff27da79bb01322e05c6d8cd37f02693fd5b9f
Related-Bug: 1805369
Related-Bug: 1808859
Related-Bug: 968696

commit_message:
Use transport_url for Ocata or later

Switch to using [DEFAULT]transport_url for configuration of
oslo.messaging connectivity to RabbitMQ.

Use section-oslo-messaging-rabbit to set [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
sectional configuration options for HA and SSL.

Update amulet test to only run ceilometer upgrade in deployments
with Gnocchi (>= Xenial/Queens).

Change-Id: If0ee7a09bac3bb4c5e6823adb1994ad3a120f9d5
Closes-Bug: 1817672

commit_message:
Added gc_threshold overrides to sysctl.conf

When clouds have a large number of hosts, the default size of the ARP
cache is too small. The cache can overflow, which means that the
system has no way to reach some ip addresses.

Setting the threshold limits higher addresses the situation, in a
reasonably safe way (the maximum impact is 5MB or so of additional RAM
used). Docs on ARP at http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/arp.7.html,
and more discussion of the issue in the bug.

Change-Id: I329ec51eff85a2a99a929c67ff0c68b3b36d7273
Closes-Bug: 1780348

commit_message:
Delete FreeIPA enroll script

This was used to manually enroll nodes to FreeIPa. It's not used nor
supported, so lets delete it. The favored alternative is to use
novajoin.

Change-Id: I2168e8d52adbae79e12981b2a9971c0c03c22762
Closes-Bug: #1786762

messages: [{'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-02-22 12:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-02-28 12:44:20.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned\n\nI don't think this is necessary. revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 12:38:45.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify upgrade situation in NUMA live migration

This patch clarifies the upgrade impact of NUMA live migration by
splitting out the N/N+1 truth table into its 4 distinct possibilities
and expanding on the details in each.

Change-Id: I27917ceece967abcf78f2711d160fa809ce3d77a
Implements: bp/numa-aware-live-migration
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify upgrade situation in NUMA live migration

This patch clarifies the upgrade impact of NUMA live migration by
splitting out the N/N+1 truth table into its 4 distinct possibilities
and expanding on the details in each.

Change-Id: I27917ceece967abcf78f2711d160fa809ce3d77a
Implements: bp/numa-aware-live-migration

[{'created': '2019-02-28 09:35:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix heat-dashboard build

The heat-dashboard added integration tests to its test suite[1]. The
integration tests rely on firefox, so we need to skip them.
Unfortunately even though the tests themselves are tagged in a way that
allows us to skip them, the modules are still imported, so we need to
add their python dependencies to the build requirements.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/634796

Change-Id: Iecfd316aaa19e02787fc66f10bec5c0c52f6a352

commit_message:
Fix heat-dashboard build

heat-dashboard added integration tests to its test suite[1]. The
integration tests rely on firefox, so we need to skip them.
Unfortunately even though the tests themselves are tagged in a way that
allows us to skip them, the modules are still imported, so we need
remove the files entirely.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/634796

Change-Id: Iecfd316aaa19e02787fc66f10bec5c0c52f6a352

commit_message:
Trivial: Fix error message when waiting for power state

The power states already contain the word 'power', so currently
an error reads:
"Timed out after 30 secs wating for power power off on node ..."

Change-Id: I2535c15172df475a7d08c5219c2b97690ea67a58

commit_message:
python3 fix: decode binary cert data if encountered

We are writing to files opened with text mode ('w+'), so binary data
will have to be decoded before writing

Task: 29577
Story: 2005057
Change-Id: I034d0230c3022e701111bdc71f0af43da1852c3c

Leave a comment with 'run-dell-emc-unity' to trigger a recheck, for more information about CI, please see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/Dell_EMC_Unity_CI"}, {'account_id': 26968, 'date': '2019-02-27 08:31:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

I think the problem here is that six dynamically generates its attributes, which makes it quite complicated for pylint to traverse through the module. [1] [2]

I believe the solution here can be simpler:
If we're in Python 2, set the HTTP response codes module as httplib.
If we're in Python 3, set the HTTP response codes module as http.HTTPStatus.
I think this should work, and as far as I can tell, the response codes names in both modules are identical.

IMO, if this doesn't work, we should add six.moves to ignored-modules in .pylintrc.

Thanks.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/200
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/issues/1640"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-02-27 20:33:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> I think the problem here is that six dynamically generates its attributes, which makes it quite complicated for pylint to traverse through the module. [1] [2]
> I believe the solution here can be simpler:
> If we're in Python 2, set the HTTP response codes module as httplib.
> If we're in Python 3, set the HTTP response codes module as http.HTTPStatus.

This is what six.moves does for us, the links you pointed do confirm that pylint folks added astroid/brain support to resolve http.HTTPStatus in python3, but they're not going to do anything about httplib in python2, because it is really gone, and no-one's supposed to be using it. 

> IMO, if this doesn't work, we should add six.moves to ignored-modules in .pylintrc.
six.moves is already part of the ignored-modules in our pylintrc [1]

What do we lose by not using the codes from our local version as Tom's proposing?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/4d0abb4/.pylintrc#L188"}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-02-28 11:27:40.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

amit has a better approach that we'll use"}]

commit_message:
[pylint] fix errors with http.client status codes

pylint does not recognize http.client status codes as
module members, so define these codes -- which are well
known and not subject to change -- in a local http_codes.py
file and use that.

Note that the http.client module documenation [1] indicates that
it is "normally not used directly."

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/http.client.html

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/637659/
Change-Id: Ia028425cde1d9702123cfaa14aba52a790095e4f

commit_message:
monasca-notification: Add jira as BuildRequires

jira is now needed for oslo-config-generator. Also keep the jira tests
given that we need the BuildRequire now anyway.
Note: jira is currently not available in the RDO CI so only create the
config and run the tests on openSUSE/SLES systems

Change-Id: I41ae4dd3dff424f66b56cbacd86474de50fa3997

commit_message:
Add documentation about iLO's active NIC inspection

This patch adds documentation on the limitation of
inspecting active NICs by ``ilo`` drivers.

story: #2004950
task: #29366

Change-Id: I2a3fdac030f1775df475fdde8bff7eea33dac432

[{'account_id': 29209, 'date': '2018-10-08 04:53:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29209, 'date': '2018-10-08 04:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-10-08 09:04:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(9 comments)

Thank you for the patch!

I'd suggest you to read the white paper on hardware composition to figure out the typical workflow. That might help you to come up with some higher-level convenience methods to add to sushy library's composition service."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-10-08 09:58:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 29209, 'date': '2018-10-08 13:06:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (9 comments)

 > I'd suggest you to read the white paper on hardware composition to
 > figure out the typical workflow. That might help you to come up
 > with some higher-level convenience methods to add to sushy
 > library's composition service.

I'm kinda confused, implementing ResourceBlockTypeField as per you requested.
resourceblock.py @line 41

there is no mension of it's fields in the white paper or in the json examples.
So, I tried,
`class ResourceBlockTypeField(base.CompositeField):`
`name = base.Field('Name')`

and 

`class ResourceBlockTypeField(base.CompositeField):`
`schemas = base.ListField('Schema')`

`ListField` is used becuase It's an array in the json file

at both times unit test fails :("}, {'account_id': 29209, 'date': '2018-10-08 13:08:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (2 comments)

Thank you very much for the review :)

can you please explain what do you mean by compositionservice.py @line 40
"these are currently unused. I'd prefer we implement public references to them in the same patch."

Did you mean instantiation of objects(ResourceBlock, ResourceZone)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-10-08 14:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29209, 'date': '2018-10-21 14:34:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2018-10-22 09:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

As more and more Redfish resources are getting added to Sushy it makes me think if we are getting deviated from the core intention [1] of the Sushy library. It makes me think whether we should add such varied Redfish resources (which are still not or possibly not in near future will be getting used by Ironic) to an extended library of Sushy (e.g. Sushy-Sashimi, this is just to name it for the namesake) so that users can benefit from having access to those Redfish resources (in Sushy manner) and Ironic also remains slim and trim by having dependency only on the Sushy core library. To all, wdyt?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/sushy#about-sushy'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-10-22 09:39:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

This sounds like a lot of maintenance burden for unclear benefit.. In any case, the hardware composition is quite in scope for ironic. We don't have a way to model composable hardware, but one day we will.

I suggest we start discussing this topic with a wider audience (on the ML?), but I don't think it blocks this particular change. Thank you for raising this!"}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-10-22 10:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

May be we could introduce some sort of discoverable "plugins" supporting specific branches of the Redfish service document tree...? That way others could extend sushy not touching the core library and installing only those sushy-* plugins they actually need.

Re composition service - given the latest developments in the hardware sphere, it seems that it makes sense to have some sort of composition feature in ironic. There is this spec [1] and also the MaaS project has composition implemented already.

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/253452/'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-10-22 10:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

> May be we could introduce some sort of discoverable "plugins" supporting specific branches of the Redfish service document tree...? That way others could extend sushy not touching the core library and installing only those sushy-* plugins they actually need.

This may be a solution, but I'm yet to see the problem :) Installing additional 5-10 kB of Python code is certainly not one.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-10-22 11:10:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> This may be a solution, but I'm yet to see the problem :) Installing additional 5-10 kB of Python code is certainly not one.

Well, pushing various logic into plugins would keep the core small, simple and more stable. On top of that, ironic 3-rd party driver developers would extend sushy via sushy plugins without introducing otherwise unused pieces to the core library.

I can bring this discussion up to the ML for wider audience."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-10-22 11:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

> Well, pushing various logic into plugins would keep the core small, simple and more stable.

Being small is not a goal. Simple - yes, stable - no, why? The downside is us (who else?) having to maintain many projects, which does incur costs with release management, reviews, etc.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-10-22 11:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

As Deb noted, here is the goal statement for sushy:

    The goal of the library is to be extremely simple, small, have as few dependencies 
    as possible and be very conservative when dealing with BMCs by issuing just enough
    requests to it (BMCs are very flaky).

Being stable in the sense of lesser chances for blocking bugs seems like a useful quality.

The other thing is that dedicated plugins for individual schemes would let the users to mix and match the schemes depending on their BMCs capabilities and quirks. Though you might consider this as an over engineering. ;)'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2018-10-26 19:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Hi Dhanuka, thanks for the patch! Could you realign this patch to: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581645/ and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613197/'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2018-10-26 19:06:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 29209, 'date': '2018-10-28 23:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 29209, 'date': '2018-10-28 23:52:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:
