(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-02-14 08:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

I think the schema versions need to be udpated, please check the comments inline'}, {'account_id': 29209, 'date': '2019-02-14 09:49:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

Thanks Riccardo for the review :)

I started to work on this patch according to the latest schema version. At the same time I started to working on "update currently implemented sushy models to latest schema bundle[1]" patch. So, according to DSP8010_2018.1 bundle[2] CompositionService.v1_0_0 was the latest. That's why I used it here too. It seems like I forgot to update rest of code :)

Also, now there is DSP8010_2018.3 [3] as the latest bundle. So, I could do one of the followings,

1) leave the current schema version as it is and update the rest of the code according to it.
2) Update the schema version to the latest one. [4]
3) Update the schema version to latest schema bundle [3]

@Dmitry @Ilya what approach should I take :)

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/616534/
[2] https://www.dmtf.org/documents/redfish-spmf/redfish-schema-bundle-20181
[3] https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP8010_2018.3.zip
[4] https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/CompositionService.v1_1_0.json'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-02-15 12:23:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

Given that this is a future-looking work, I'd prefer to update to the latest schema. Then you can mention the version of the schema in your commit message, so that we don't argue about it again :)"}, {'account_id': 29209, 'date': '2019-02-15 12:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 29209, 'date': '2019-02-15 13:01:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-02-15 13:33:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

> Given that this is a future-looking work, I'd prefer to update to the latest schema. Then you can mention the version of the schema in your commit message, so that we don't argue about it again :)

One thing to keep in mind is that we should probably crave support schemas belonging to the same schema bundle. In hope that BMC vendors do the same. Which is questionable."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-18 14:48:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review-1

Please rebase when you have a chance, Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 29209, 'date': '2019-02-18 14:58:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

commit_message:
Add support for the `CompositionService` resource

Adds the `CompositionService` resource of Redfish standard schema.
The `CompositionService` is the top level resource for all things
related to Composability. If a Redfish service supports Composability,
the Service Root resource will contain the `CompositionService`
property.

Implemented according to the latest Redfish schema versions[1].
[1]https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/

Story: #2003853
Task: #26650

Change-Id: I135d9d58e6693647a53cdd405b3c841edad4772a

just a minor nit, otherwise LGTM'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-02-21 11:38:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-02-21 13:21:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-21 13:25:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Would it make sense to add warnings to nova::wsgi::apache_placement class as well? Or would it be redundant? I'm thinking if somebody uses nova::wsgi::apache_placement for installing placement but doesn't actually use the service class to configure the config options or fix the dependency chaining for the service related things."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-21 13:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

If so, we need to add more to the release note as well.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-02-21 13:30:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

> Would it make sense to add warnings to nova::wsgi::apache_placement
 > class as well? Or would it be redundant? I'm thinking if somebody
 > uses nova::wsgi::apache_placement for installing placement but
 > doesn't actually use the service class to configure the config
 > options or fix the dependency chaining for the service related
 > things.

Right, that's what I also added in comment to patch set 4. I think we should deprecate it as well and add a warning."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-21 13:36:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Just doing a plain grep in puppet-nova, we probably want to be very verbose with warnings and release notes about the...

* nova::keystone::auth_placement
* nova::db::mysql_placement

classes and the "placement_database_connection" and "placement_slave_connection" parameters that exist in ::nova class as well.

What do you think? I think it's best if we are as verbose with release notes as possible so that we can cleanup everything in next release, because if we miss something we'll have to keep it just to no break the Puppet interface, even if the functionality is moved away.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-02-21 14:00:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-02-21 15:33:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-02-21 15:33:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-02-21 15:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-02-21 15:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I think placement_database_connection and the slave in ::nova should be deprecated as well. like Tobias mentioned'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-02-21 15:59:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-02-22 09:07:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
placement: Deprecate the deployment of the Placement service

The Placement service is currently scheduled to be extracted from the
Nova project during the Train cycle. Ahead of this the deployment of the
service using puppet-nova has now been deprecated in favour of the
puppet-placement module.

Change-Id: Iefade0f0a9bb0ab83c0aba6c5f263bde240cf9a2

commit_message:
Limit scope of puppet-nova-tripleo-standalone tempest tests

The previous `compute` white list was resulting in the job timing out
more often than not. This change limits this white list to the compute
API and basic server ops scenario tests to ensure we no longer time out.

Change-Id: I7d4ac315d8ce0c9e1b651e58abfc569bbe3f7505

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-30 21:20:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect application of 'ip' commands for bridges

The code that applies iproute2 commands to bridges that are
modified specifies "interface" rather than "bridge", so it does
not function correctly. This patch fixes the typos so that
bridges will have updates applied through iproute2 if a restart
is not required.

Change-Id: I53df2f3506cca2b69e4f1f59471c7b90dc8fdfb7
Closes-bug: 1806128
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect application of 'ip' commands for bridges

The code that applies iproute2 commands to bridges that are
modified specifies "interface" rather than "bridge", so it does
not function correctly. This patch fixes the typos so that
bridges will have updates applied through iproute2 if a restart
is not required.

Change-Id: I53df2f3506cca2b69e4f1f59471c7b90dc8fdfb7
Closes-bug: 1806128

[{'created': '2019-02-28 09:30:29.000000000', 'message': 'Update links in docs to latest

To avoid links to OpenStack docs getting out of date in our docs, use
the latest version.

Ideally after cutting each stable branch we should change these links to
use the current release.

Co-Authored-By: Isaiah Inuwa
Change-Id: Ia1e3c720f4e688861b8f76874a3943b0f4e50b17
'}]
commit_message:
Update links in docs to latest

To avoid links to OpenStack docs getting out of date in our docs, use
the latest version.

Ideally after cutting each stable branch we should change these links to
use the current release.

Co-Authored-By: Isaiah Inuwa
Change-Id: Ia1e3c720f4e688861b8f76874a3943b0f4e50b17

Initial testing seems to show that something in the updated tox.ini doesn't work well with tox 2.3.1, but works fine with later releases.  I'm trying to feel out what this is."}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-26 08:36:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Apparently the older version of tox doesn't handle recursive substitution.  If I inline that particular bit (and leave in the other substitution bits), then it works."}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-26 08:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-26 08:41:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-26 08:53:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 29805, 'date': '2019-02-26 09:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-25 16:56:13.000000000', 'message': 'Added tox environment for gathering coverage.

This technique was borrowed from the tox "cover" environment in
openstack/nova's tox.ini.  This leverages the fact that stestr lets
you override the python executable via the PYTHON environment
variable.  Doing this allows us to easily generate coverage for our
unit tests.

An important caveat is that this does not provide any coverage for
tests via zaza, amulet, etc.  It is purely focused on the unit tests.

Note that this replaces the previous .coveragerc; coverage
configuration is instead pulled from tox.ini.

Change-Id: I20a4f267abb05f2123000518ae9b8ec8d5f0961c

commit_message:
Added tox environment for gathering coverage

This technique was borrowed from the tox "cover" environment in
openstack/nova's tox.ini.  This leverages the fact that stestr lets
you override the python executable via the PYTHON environment
variable.  Doing this allows us to easily generate coverage for our
unit tests.

An important caveat is that this does not provide any coverage for
tests via zaza, amulet, etc.  It is purely focused on the unit tests.

Note that this replaces the previous .coveragerc; coverage
configuration is instead pulled from tox.ini.

Change-Id: I20a4f267abb05f2123000518ae9b8ec8d5f0961c

commit_message:
Make api log in perfload be linkable

The default zuul handling is that a file needs to end
.txt if it is to be htmlified and thus have links to timestamps.

That's a nice feature to have in the placement-api log, so we
give it a txt extension.

Change-Id: I98e7058b2420d1cb7927e5e11200ab7f0805faad

PBR uses git information to properly version the produced pypi package correctly.  Since the cinder repo already has that, then there would be conflicts from the cinder versioning and cinderlib versioning.   I believe we need to put cinderlib in it's own repo owned by the cinder team."}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-02-14 18:26:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

cinderlib change: https://github.com/Akrog/cinderlib/commit/43683db47754a750751228ae0226bfbab8ef8422'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-02-28 10:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Cinderlib has now its own repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-28 18:17:54.000000000', 'message': 'Import the cinderlib code

This patch adds the cinderlib code and unit tests from the external
repository into the Cinder repository.

Having the cinderlib code inside the repository will provide the Cinder
team with more control over this library, allow it to benefit from a
tighter integration into Cinder, and leverage third party CIs.

The library will have its own cinderlib namespace instead of sharing the
cinder name space.  This will provide a clear separation of these 2
elements and allow packagers to release Cinder without cinderlib if they
so decide.

Change-Id: I431571d3b54bb64634def2bcdbc97efec5ad6fe4

Add cinderlib unit tests

commit_message:
Import the cinderlib code

This patch adds the cinderlib code and unit tests from the external
repository into the Cinder repository.

Having the cinderlib code inside the repository will provide the Cinder
team with more control over this library, allow it to benefit from a
tighter integration into Cinder, and leverage third party CIs.

The library will have its own cinderlib namespace instead of sharing the
cinder name space.  This will provide a clear separation of these 2
elements and allow packagers to release Cinder without cinderlib if they
so decide.

Change-Id: I68112f2560bbad45ba7632ceb413d7c793d47ae7

This patch adds documentation for the Cinder Library (cinderlib).

The documentation included in this patch is a modified version of the
one in the original cinderlib repository, which removes some unnecessary
sections, modifies references to it being an external project, and
expands on some topics that were in the TODO list.

commit_message:
Add cinderlib docs

This patch adds documentation for the Cinder Library (cinderlib).

The documentation included in this patch is a modified version of the
one in the original cinderlib repository, which removes some unnecessary
sections, modifies references to it being an external project, and
expands on some topics that were in the TODO list.

Change-Id: I703be4fe1cfe36f739ecf41f00c1cb0bdf912c37
